data.value: Request was sent. It may take some time to restart application.

data.name: Administration.BannedIP.Description
data.value: Allows you to ban users with specific IP addresses from accessing or using websites. You can ban addresses globally, or separately for individual sites.

data.name: Administration.Categories.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage the hierarchy of global and site categories. You can manage personal categories in the My profile application.

data.name: Administration.CMS.Activities.Description
data.value: This section enables you to work with activities. You are able to view list of logged activities. You can also create new custom activities.

data.name: Administration.CMS.ContactManagement.Description
data.value: This section enables to work with Accounts and Contacts. You are able to assign Contacts to Accounts and vice versa. You can also split&merge Contacts and Accounts. You can create dynamic or static Contact groups or manage specific statuses.

data.name: Administration.EventLog.Description
data.value: This section displays an event log. You can select to display the log for the whole system or for one particular site. The log can also be cleared here. Detailed information about each of the logged events can also be displayed.

data.name: Administration.Membership.Description
data.value: Allows you to create and manage memberships for users. Memberships grant users the permissions of one or more roles. For example, you can use memberships to allow users to access restricted sections of a website. Typically, memberships are associated with a product that users can purchase for a certain duration of time. Memberships can be global or site-specific.

data.name: Administration.Permissions.Description
data.value: Allows you to set permissions for user roles. Users need permissions to access applications and perform actions within the administration interface. Permissions are available for groups of functionality (modules), page types and custom table.

data.name: Administration.Permissions.NoSite
data.value: There are no sites specified. Please specify a site to enable this section.

data.name: Administration.Roles.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage user roles. Roles determine which users can access information and perform actions, both on the pages of websites and within the administration interface. You can create new roles, assign roles to users, and define the authorization options that individual roles provide.

data.name: Administration.ScheduledTasks.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage the system's scheduled tasks. The tasks perform a certain function at a specified time or regularly according to a set interval. You can configure the default tasks and register custom tasks prepared by developers. The application also provides a way to run tasks manually.

data.name: administration.ui.categoriesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the hierarchy of global and site categories. You can manage personal categories in the My profile application.

data.name: administration.ui.emailtemplatesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage email templates. The templates define the content of automatic emails sent by the system. For example, workflow notifications informing about the status of pages are based on email templates. By default, the system uses global templates, but you can create site-specific versions of each template.

data.name: administration.ui.eventlogdescription
data.value: The event log displays a list of errors and warnings that occurred within the system and keeps track of other events, such as object changes. You can view the log for the entire system or for individual sites. Check the event log if you encounter problems on your website.

data.name: Administration.UIPersonalization.Description
data.value: Allows you to choose which parts of the administration interface are visible for user roles. You can use UI personalization to simplify the interface for business users by hiding entire applications, tabs or parts of pages.

data.name: administration.users.approveallselectedquestion
data.value: Do you want to approve all selected users?

data.name: Administration.Users.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage all users in the system. You can manually create new users and edit the settings of existing user accounts. The application also provides several features, such as sending of mass emails, monitoring which users are currently online, and kicking users from sites.

data.name: administration.users.usedbrepository.disabled
data.value: In order to display additional information such as location of visitors, anonymous guests details or related contact profiles you need to enable storing on-line users in the database. To enable it, please go to ##ui|cms|settings## -> Security & Membership and check the Store on-line users in database field.

data.name: administration-leftmenu.recyclebindescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the deleted pages and files. You can restore deleted items or destroy them permanently.

data.name: Administration-LeftMenu.SmartSearchDescription
data.value: Allows you to create and manage search indexes for the content of websites and other data in the system. To create a search interface for the indexed content, add Smart search web parts onto your site's pages through the Pages application.

data.name: administration-leftmenu.smtpserversdescription
data.value: Allows you to register and manage additional SMTP servers that the system uses to deliver emails. You can make the SMTP servers available globally for all sites, or add dedicated servers for specific sites. To set the primary SMTP server, open the Settings application and select the System -> Emails category.

data.name: administration-leftmenu.systemdescription
data.value: Displays information about the application and the environment where the system is running. Also allows you to perform system tasks, such as clearing the cache, restarting the application, deployment of virtual objects to the file system, separation of the on-line marketing database, searching for macro expressions and global management of macro signatures.

data.name: administration-leftmenu.webfarmdescription
data.value: Allows you to define web farm servers. You can scale the performance of websites by distributing computing among multiple web servers, and use a web farm to synchronize the servers. The application also provides a list of all web farm synchronization tasks that are waiting to be processed.

data.name: bannermanagement.hidewebpartifbannernotfound.description
data.value: If true, the whole web part will be hidden if no valid banner is found in the selected category. If false, even if there are no banners, the web part container will be shown.

data.name: bannermanagement.KeepPreviousBannerOnPostBack.description
data.value: If true, the web part will not select another banner when postback is performed. Instead, it will display the same banner as before the postback. Additionally, it won't count a new impression.

data.name: bannermanagement.userdirectlink.description
data.value: If true, the banner link will lead to the real target (as set in banner settings) and will be changed to the redirection handler after clicking. If false, the link will lead directly to the redirection handler.

data.name: bannermanagement.width.description
data.value: The width of the banner. The value will be rendered as an in-line style of the encapsulating anchor. The value can be in any format which is understood by CSS (px, pt, etc.).

Select the virtual objects that you wish to store in the file system. You can then edit the code in external editors or use external source control. If you disable source control for an object type and apply the changes, all changes made externally are transferred to the database.

The selected object types are stored in the file system, the others only in the database:

data.name: Deployment.SynchronizeChangesInfo

data.name: development.cssstylesheetsdescription
data.value: Allows you to create, edit and manage CSS stylesheets. Stylesheets define the appearance and design of pages and their components. Use the Sites and Pages applications to assign stylesheets to sites or individual pages.

data.name: development.culturesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the system's resource strings and cultures (languages). Resource strings store the text displayed within the administration interface, and provide a way to insert localization expressions with different values for each language. The application only manages resource strings stored in the database, the system's default strings are stored on the file system in resx files.

data.name: Development.CustomSettings.GroupDeleteConfirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this group?

data.name: Development.CustomSettingsDescription
data.value: This section enables to define custom settings categories and keys.

data.name: Development.DeviceProfilessDescription
data.value: Allows you to define profiles that categorize visitors based on the device they use to access the website. You can create and display alternative page layouts for different device profiles.

data.name: Development.DocTypesDescription
data.value: Allows you to manage page types. You can create new page types or define their structure. You can also specify which page types can be used in certain sections of the site.

data.name: development.documenttypes.esdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage page types. You can create new page types or define their structure. You can also specify which page types can be used in certain sections of the site.

data.name: development.invalidtransformationlevel
data.value: Level must be an integer greater than or equal to -1.

data.name: development.javascriptdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage custom JavaScript files through the administration interface, without requiring direct access to the file system.

data.name: development.macrorulesdescription
data.value: Allows you to create global and form validation macro rules. Macro rules are text-based representations of macro conditions that define certain requirements. Users can build conditions out of macro rules without knowledge of the macro syntax.

data.name: development.modulesdescription
data.value: Allows developers to find information about the system and perform customizations. The system's functionality is separated into modules. For example, you can use modules to create custom settings, add fields to system objects or extend the administration interface.

data.name: development.pagelayoutdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage shared page layouts and edit their code. Layouts define the structure of portal engine page templates. Use the Page templates application to edit the layout of templates that have their own custom layout.

data.name: development.relationshipnamesdescription
data.value: Allows you to prepare relationship types for pages and system objects. To create relationships between pages, open the Pages application and edit pages on the Properties -> Related pages tab.

data.name: Development.SearchEngineDescription
data.value: Allows you to configure the system's data on search engines. Marketing applications use the data for monitoring website traffic sources. The default data includes the most common search engines, and you can add any other search engines related to your websites.

data.name: Development.Settings.NoSettingsInCat
data.value: There are no settings in this category, please select some other category.

data.name: Development.Settings.SearchSettings
data.value: Choose a category or use the search function to find a specific setting.

data.name: development.taggroupsdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the tag groups available on the site and view tags in specific tag groups. To tag pages, go to the Pages application and edit pages on the Properties -> Metadata tab.

data.name: development.translationservicesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the translation services registered in the system. The services provide a way to translate the content of websites externally, without direct editing in the administration interface. You can configure the default translation services, and add your own custom-developed services.

data.name: development.webcontainersdescription
data.value: Allows you to create containers for web parts. Containers consist of HTML code placed before and after the web part. To assign containers to instances of web parts, open the Pages application, edit pages on the Design tab, configure the web parts and set the Web part container property.

data.name: development.webtemplatesdescription
data.value: Allows you to save existing sites as web templates. You can then use the web templates as starting points for developing new sites.

data.name: development.workflowsdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage basic and advanced workflows. You can define the sequence of steps for each workflow, configure notifications or turn check-in/check-out on or off.

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationfailurecouldnotwritelicencefilehtml
data.value: The licence file '{1}' could not be written to this web sites bin folder '{2}'. Create a text file with the extension .lic and paste the licence key into the file. Save the text file in the bin folder.

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationfailuregenerichtml
data.value: Whoops. There was a problem activating the licence key or uploading premium data. We're unsure why this happened. Please Contact Us providing details of your web site implementation, relevent entries from your log file, and we'll try and help you.

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationfailurehttphtml
data.value:
We were unable to reach the 51Degrees.mobi licence validation web site at the host '{1}'. This could be for one of the following reasons.

  • This web site is running in medium trust mode and the originUrl attribute in the web.config does not allow access the host '{1}'. Change the originUrl to include '{1}'. Multiple host names can be seperated by | signs.
  • The web servers firewall or another firewall is blocking access to the host or the SSL port 443. Check the firewall configuration.

When you've completed these checks try activating the licence key again.

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationfailureinvalidhtml
data.value: The licence key provided failed validation. Please check the license key is validate with your reseller.

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationstreamfailurehtml

data.name: device_profile.settings.activationsuccesshtml

data.name: device_profile.settings.shareusageerrorhtml
data.value: There was a problem recording your share usage data preference. If the web site is operating in a medium trust environment or modify permission to the configuration file(s) is not granted to the application pool identity you will have to change this value in the configuration file manually. Find the fiftyOne/detection element in the config file and set the shareUsage attribute.

data.name: device_profile.settings.shareusagetruehtml

data.name: dialogs.newfile.notallowed
data.value: You are not allowed to create page of type '{0}' in required location.

data.name: dialogs.resize.wrongformat
data.value: Please enter dimensions as positive integer numbers or leave them empty.

data.name: dialogs.view.list.nodata
data.value: There are no files to display.

data.name: dialogs.web.selecttype
data.value: The media type was not recognized. Please select media type manually.

data.name: dialogs.youtube.invalidsize
data.value: Please enter valid width and height.

data.name: discouncoupon_edit.discountcouponcodeexists
data.value: Product coupon with given code already exists.

data.name: DiscounCoupon_Edit.errorCodeFormat
data.value: Please enter coupon code in identifier format without spaces and special characters; '.', '_' and '-' are allowed.

data.name: discouncoupon_edit.errordisplay
data.value: Please enter a product coupon display name

data.name: doc.ErrorDuringAction
data.value: An error occurred during the page action. Please see event log for more details.

data.name: doc.nosteps
data.value: There are no next steps available.

data.name: doc.notauthorizedaction
data.value: You are not authorized to move the page to another step.

data.name: doc.urls.doacaliasnotunique
data.value: Page alias is in collision with other page alias or page URL path

data.name: doctype.ecommerce.isproduct
data.value: Page type represents a product type

data.name: doctype.ecommerce.isproductsection
data.value: Page type represents a product section

data.name: doctype.ecommerce.mappingwarning
data.value: Please do not use these settings in Kentico 8 and later. These settings provide backward compatibility for websites created in earlier versions of Kentico. The system now maps page fields to SKU fields automatically.

data.name: doctypeiconselector.hidden
data.value: Form control is visible only if page type data are available.

data.name: documenation.webpartproperties.allowdesignmode
data.value: If checked, design mode editing (resizing with mouse, additional design actions) is enabled for the user.

data.name: Document.VersionCreated
data.value: New page version has been created.

data.name: document_type_edit.documents.used
data.value: The page type is used for the following pages

data.name: documentation.allowselecttheme
data.value: If checked, administrators will be allowed to select which theme (CSS stylesheet) will be applied to the group.

data.name: documentation.generalproperties.reporttable
data.value: Selects the report and specific table that will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.generalproperties.reportvalue
data.value: Selects the report and specific value that will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.info
data.value: Below you can find links to the Kentico on-line documentation.

data.name: documentation.property.addglobalobjectsuffix
data.value: Indicates whether the selector adds a suffix to the names of global objects in the selection list.

data.name: documentation.property.additionalcolumns
data.value: Specifies the names of columns that the selector loads along with the objects of the specified data type (in addition to the columns required by default).

data.name: documentation.property.additionalurlparameters
data.value: Additional URL parameters added to the URL of the selection dialog. Must start with '&'.

data.name: documentation.property.AddObjectIDTobreadcrumbs
data.value: If enabled, links in the page title breadcrumbs add the object ID parameter to the URL query string.

data.name: documentation.property.afterdeletescript
data.value: Script executed after an item is deleted in the listing.

data.name: documentation.property.allowall
data.value: Indicates whether the site selector contains the '(all)' value. Only applies if the Selector type is 'Classic'.

data.name: documentation.property.allowedextensions
data.value: Determines which file types are displayed in the file system dialog. Enter a list of allowed file extensions, separated by semicolons.

data.name: documentation.property.allowedittextbox
data.value: If enabled, users can manually edit the selected value in textbox modes.

data.name: documentation.property.allowempty
data.value: Indicates whether the site selector contains the '(none)' value. Only applies if the Selector type is 'Classic'.

data.name: documentation.property.allowglobal
data.value: Indicates whether the site selector contains the '(global)' value. Only applies if the Selector type is 'Classic'.

data.name: documentation.property.allowglobalobjectnameprefix
data.value: Indicates whether the selector adds the '.' prefix to the selection values of global objects.

data.name: documentation.property.alternativeform
data.value: Selects the alternative form for the object editing form.

data.name: documentation.property.breadcrumbwindowtarget
data.value: Sets the target for links in the page title breadcrumbs (_parent, _top, _self, _blank).

data.name: documentation.property.buttonimage
data.value: Sets the path to the image that the selector displays in button selection modes.

data.name: documentation.property.CallbackMethod
data.value: Sets the name of the callback JavaScript method.

data.name: documentation.property.categoryedit
data.value: Enter the code name of the UI element that defines the editing interface for categories in the object tree.

data.name: documentation.property.categoryparentcolumn
data.value: Enter the name of the data column that stores the ID of the parent category for category objects. For example: 'CategoryParentID'

data.name: documentation.property.checkmodifypermission
data.value: If enabled, users can edit the relationships only if they have the Modify permission for the related object type's module.

data.name: documentation.property.contextname
data.value: Sets the property name under which the selector's value is stored in the UI context. You can access the value in other web parts on the template through macros: {% UIContext.<property name> % }

data.name: documentation.property.controlpath
data.value: Specifies the virtual path to the .ascx file of the user control placed on the page. For example: ~/CMSGlobalFiles/control.ascx

data.name: documentation.property.cssclass
data.value: Sets the name of the CSS class applied to the entire editing form.

data.name: documentation.property.custom
data.value: Custom properties appended to the UI element.

data.name: documentation.property.decriptionlink
data.value: Link to Application description or its short version. Note that short version is prefered. (e.g.: Link = https://kentico.atlassian.net/wiki/x/DwAaAQ, Short version = DwAaAQ)

data.name: documentation.property.defaultfieldlayout
data.value: Sets the layout of individual form fields - the position of the field labels and editing controls.

data.name: documentation.property.defaultformlayout
data.value: Determines the design of categories in the form.

data.name: documentation.property.DialogGridName
data.value: Path to the XML configuration file of the UniGrid used for the selection dialog in Multiple selection mode.

data.name: documentation.property.DialogWindowName
data.value: Sets the name of the selection dialog window to prevent conflicts between multiple selectors.

data.name: documentation.property.DialogWindowWidth
data.value: Sets the width of the selection dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.disableditems
data.value: Allows you to disable elements in the selection dialog in multiple choice mode. Enter the identifiers of elements separated by semicolons.

data.name: documentation.property.displaybreadcrumbs
data.value: Indicates whether the page title displays breadcrumbs showing the current location in the user interface.

data.name: documentation.property.displaycategorybreadcrumb
data.value: Indicates whether the element's page title breadcrumbs display category names in the path.

data.name: documentation.property.displayguide
data.value: If enabled, the element displays a guide page (descriptions of child elements) in the content area when loaded for the first time. If disabled, the first child element is displayed.

data.name: documentation.property.displaynameformat
data.value: Sets the format for the object names in the selection list. To display the values of objects, use macro expressions in format: {%ColumnName% }.

data.name: documentation.property.DisplayTitleInTabs
data.value: Indicates whether the tab layout displays the page title for child elements.

data.name: documentation.property.EditActionURL
data.value: Sets the URL of the page that opens when the edit button is clicked for an object in the listing. Add '{0}' into the value to dynamically insert the ID of the edited object.

data.name: documentation.property.editindialog
data.value: If checked, object will be edited in a modal dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.editpageurl
data.value: Can be used to specify the URL of a custom page that handles the editing of the selected object. Only available for single text box and drop-down list selection modes.

data.name: documentation.property.elementname
data.value: Sets the code name of the UI element whose child elements the menu displays. Automatically uses the current element if empty.

data.name: documentation.property.emptyreplacement
data.value: Replaces items which don't have any visible value to be displayed. The default value is  .

data.name: documentation.property.enabledcolumnname
data.value: Can be used to specify the name of the column that determines if the selected object is enabled.

data.name: documentation.property.FilterControl
data.value: Sets the path to a custom filter control for use in the object selection dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.generalobjecttype
data.value: Sets the object type used by the UI element. The selected object type affects the behavior of UI web parts on the template.

data.name: documentation.property.globalobjectsuffix
data.value: Specifies the suffix added to the names of global objects in the selection list (if the 'Add global object suffix' property is enabled). The default value is "(global)".

data.name: documentation.property.gridextender
data.value: Specifies an extender class for the Listing web part.

data.name: documentation.property.GridName
data.value: Sets the relative path to the Listing UniGrid's XML definition file. You can enter only the name of the XML file to use a default path based on the UI element's Object type. For example 'CustomGrid.xml' loads the file from ~/App_Data/CMSModules/{{modulename}}/UI/Grids/{{objecttype}}/. If you leave the grid path empty, the 'default.xml' name is used.

data.name: documentation.property.guidetemplate
data.value: Sets the page template of the ribbon guide (used if 'Display guide' is enabled). If empty, the 'Ribbon guide' template is used.

data.name: documentation.property.helptopicname
data.value: Sets the name (identifier) of the help topic used in the link generated by the page title.

data.name: documentation.property.hidehelpicon
data.value: If enabled, the element's page title does not generate a help topic link.

data.name: documentation.property.iconpath
data.value: Specifies the path to the image used in the title of the selection dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.includejquery
data.value: If checked, the jQuery Javascript is included prior to any other includes.

data.name: documentation.property.inlinescript
data.value: Specifies the code of the in-line script that will be rendered on the page.

data.name: documentation.property.itemedit
data.value: Enter the code name of the UI element that defines the editing interface for individual objects in the tree.

data.name: documentation.property.itemsperpage
data.value: Default number of items displayed per page. Applies to the multiple selection grid, drop-down list, single and multiple selection dialogs. The default value is 25.

data.name: documentation.property.linkedfile
data.value: Can be used to specify the path to an external script file. A request for the script will be added to the page. For example: ~/CMSScripts/Custom/jquery.js. If you wish to prevent duplicate loading of the same JS library (e.g. by other web parts on the page), a special value can be entered for some common libraries. These options are: jquery, mootools, silverlight, prototype.

data.name: documentation.property.localizeitems
data.value: Specifies whether the selector resolves localization macros.

data.name: documentation.property.maxdisplayeditems
data.value: Sets the maximum number of displayed items in drop-down list mode (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 25. If the number is exceeded, the remaining items can be selected through the (more..) option.

data.name: documentation.property.maxdisplayedtotalitems
data.value: The number of maximum displayed total items in drop-down list selection mode (excluding the special and generic items). The default value is 50. If exceeded, only the number of items set by the 'Max displayed items' property will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.property.maxrelativelevel
data.value: Determines how many levels of child elements the tree displays.

data.name: documentation.property.maxtreenodes
data.value: Limits the maximum number of child items that the object tree displays under a single node. Applied only if 'Use max node limit' is enabled.

data.name: documentation.property.newcategory
data.value: Enter the code name of the UI element that defines the interface for creating new categories.

data.name: documentation.property.NewElement
data.value: Code name of the UI element that the system loads when the "new" header button is clicked. The target element must belong under the same module as the current element. You can alternatively specify the target through a URL using the 'Action URL' property.

data.name: documentation.property.newitem
data.value: Enter the code name of the UI element that defines the interface for creating new objects.

data.name: documentation.property.newitempageurl
data.value: Can be used to specify the URL of a custom page that handles the creation of new objects. Only available for single textbox selection mode.

data.name: documentation.property.newtextfileextension
data.value: Sets the extension used when creating new files in the dialog. The files are always text-based.

data.name: documentation.property.objectparameterid
data.value: Sets the name of a query string parameter that the tab layout appends to the URLs generated for the tab pages. The parameter stores the object ID value.

data.name: documentation.property.ObjectSiteName
data.value: If set, only objects which belong to specified site are retrieved (if the object has SiteID column). If null or empty, all objects are retrieved. Use #currentsite for CurrentSite and #global for global objects.

data.name: documentation.property.objecttype
data.value: Specifies the data class of the objects to be selected.

data.name: documentation.property.OnAfterClientChanged
data.value: Client JavaScript code executed after the UniSelector's 'onchange' event.

data.name: documentation.property.OnBeforeClientChanged
data.value: Client JavaScript code executed before the UniSelector's 'onchange' event.

data.name: documentation.property.openindialog
data.value: If checked, new object will be created in a modal dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.pageextender
data.value: Specifies the extender class for the page's code behind.

data.name: documentation.property.parentobjecttype
data.value: Sets the parent object type of the object type used by the UI element. Required for UI web parts that display an object hierarchy, such as the Object tree menu.

data.name: documentation.property.path
data.value: Sets the location of the managed folder in the file system. If empty, a predefined theme path is used based on the UI element's object type, for example: "~/App_Themes/Components/WebParts/<web part code name>"

data.name: documentation.property.pathcolumn
data.value: Enter the name of the data column that stores the full path of category objects in the tree hierarchy. For example: 'CategoryPath'

data.name: documentation.property.postbackonchange
data.value: Indicates whether the selector triggers a postback after the selection is changed.

data.name: documentation.property.removeconfiguration
data.value: Confirmation message displayed when removing items. To disable confirmation, set this property to an empty string.

data.name: documentation.property.removemultiplecommas
data.value: Indicates whether multiple commas should be removed from the names of the offered items. This can happen if the DisplayNameFormat is in format {%column1%}, {%column2%}, {column3} and column2 is empty.

data.name: documentation.property.resourcename
data.value: Sets the resource name (module code name) of the UI element whose chid elements the menu displays. Automatically uses the resource name of the current element if empty.

data.name: documentation.property.resourceprefix
data.value: Sets a prefix that will be used in the full names of resource strings in the selector. The default value is "General".

data.name: documentation.property.returncolumnname
data.value: Specifies the name of the object column whose value the selector saves. If empty, the object's ID column is used. To ensure correct functionality, the column must be a unique identifier for the given object type.

data.name: documentation.property.ribbonextender
data.value: Specifies an extender class for the Ribbon web part.

data.name: documentation.property.selectedvalue
data.value: Sets the option that the selector offers by default in drop-down mode when the page is loaded for the first time.

data.name: documentation.property.selectionmode
data.value: Determines the design and behavior of the selection dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.selectitempageurl
data.value: Can be used to set a custom URL for the object selection dialog.

data.name: documentation.property.selectorlabel
data.value: Sets the text of the label located before the selector.

data.name: documentation.property.selectortype
data.value: Classic: The selector provides a list of sites. Site or global: The selector offers the current site, the global option, and both.

data.name: documentation.property.showitems
data.value: Indicates whether the tree menu displays individual objects. If disabled, the menu only contains object categories.

data.name: documentation.property.tabextender
data.value: Specifies an extender class for the tabs web part.

data.name: documentation.property.targetURL
data.value: Sets the URL of the page that opens when the "new" header button is clicked. You can alternatively specify the target as a UI element through the 'New element' property.

data.name: documentation.property.text
data.value: Sets the content displayed by the 'Text' web part.

data.name: documentation.property.titleimage
data.value: Selects the image displayed as the icon in the page title. If empty, the title uses the 'Icon path' of the current UI element.

data.name: documentation.property.titletext
data.value: Sets the text displayed as the page title. If empty, the title uses the 'Caption' of the current UI element.

data.name: documentation.property.treeexntender
data.value: Specifies an extender class for the Tree web part.

data.name: documentation.property.treeguidetemplate
data.value: Sets the page template of the tree guide (used if 'Display guide' is enabled). If empty, the 'Tree guide' template is used.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorallowall
data.value: Indicates if the selector allows selection of all items. If enabled, the selector displays the (all) option in drop-down mode. When this option is chosen, the selector doesn't load any data from the database, it just returns -1 and external code must handle the loading of data.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorallowdefault
data.value: Indicates if the selector offers the default option. If enabled, the selector offers the (default) option in drop-down mode.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorallowempty
data.value: Determines if the selector allows empty selection. If enabled, the selector offers the (none) option in the drop-down mode and a Clear button in text box modes. For empty selection, the selector stores an empty string as the value or 0 in drop-down mode.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorextender
data.value: Specifies an extender class for the Selector web part.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectororderby
data.value: Sets the order of the items offered for selection via a standard ORDER BY clause.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorspecialfields
data.value: Defines custom options displayed in drop-down list selection mode. Enter each option on a new line, with two values separated by a semicolon. The first value is the name of the option in the list, the second represents the value of that item when it is selected.

data.name: documentation.property.uniselectorwherecondition
data.value: WHERE condition applied when loading the objects available for selection.

data.name: documentation.property.UseMaxNodeLimit
data.value: If enabled, the number of items displayed under individual nodes is limited to the 'Max tree nodes' value.

data.name: documentation.property.valuesseparator
data.value: If multi-selection is enabled, the selector stores the values separated by the entered string. A semicolon(";") is used by default.

data.name: documentation.property.visiblecondition
data.value: Sets a macro condition that specifies when the Selector web part is visible.

data.name: documentation.property.zerorowstext
data.value: Text displayed if no records are found for the listing.

data.name: documentation.sendwaitingforapprovalmail
data.value: Contains a list of administrator email addresses, separated by semicolons ( ; ), to which a notification will be sent informing that a newly created group is waiting for approval.

data.name: documentation.webpart.addtocartconversionregistrationname
data.value: Name of the add to cart conversion used in web analytics.

data.name: documentation.webpart.addtocartconversionregistrationvalue
data.value: Sets a number that will be recorded along with the specified conversion when a product is added to the shopping cart. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value will be added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current site context.

data.name: documentation.webpart.allowuserchangedisplayname
data.value: Indicates if administrators should be able to edit the group's display name.

data.name: documentation.webpart.conversionregistrationvalue
data.value: Sets a number that will be recorded along with the registration conversion when it is logged. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value will be added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current site context.

data.name: documentation.webpart.loadpagesindividually
data.value: If checked, the data source loads and caches individual pages from the database instead of loading the complete data of all pages at once. Only used if the data is paged using an external pager component (UniPager). Using this property also requires the "Order by" and "Selected columns" properties to be set.

data.name: documentation.webpart.loadpagesindividuallydocuments
data.value: If checked, the data source loads and caches individual pages from the database instead of loading the complete data of all pages at once. Only used if the data is paged using an external pager component (UniPager).

data.name: documentation.webpart.orderconversionvalue
data.value: Sets a number that will be recorded along with the Order conversion when it is logged. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value will be added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current site context.

data.name: documentation.webpart.pm.mytasks.allowtaskaction
data.value: Indicates whether users with the appropriate permissions should be allowed to perform task actions (create or delete tasks).

data.name: documentation.webpart.pm.projecttasks.allowtaskaction
data.value: Indicates whether users with the appropriate permissions may delete tasks.

data.name: documentation.webpart.pm.sitename
data.value: Can be used to select if tasks should be displayed from all sites, or only the current site.

data.name: documentation.webpart.taskdetailurl
data.value: Contains the URL of a page that is linked when the displayed message is clicked. If left empty, the value is taken from the '##ui|cms|settings## -> Intranet & Collaboration -> Projects -> Task detail page' field. If neither of these locations contain a value, the message will not work as a link.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.abusereportconfirm
data.value: Sets the confirmation text displayed after an abuse report is successfully submitted by a user.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.abusereporttitle
data.value: Sets the title used to identify the reports submitted by this web part in Social & Community -> Abuse report. This property can be used to distinguish reports from different sections of a website.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.acceleratorbuttontext
data.value: Sets the text caption of the button.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.acceleratordescription
data.value: Sets the descritpion of the search accelerator for the Internet Explorer context menu.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.acceleratorname
data.value: Sets the name of the search accelerator in the Internet Explorer context menu.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.align
data.value: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the web part zone content.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.allowdesignmode
data.value: If checked, actions that allow users to manage (add, remove or resize) the sections of the layout will be available directly in the design mode. If disabled, the layout will have to be managed through the property configuration dialog of the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.allowforpostback
data.value: By default, the system clears the partial cache of web parts whenever a postback occurs on the page. If you enable this property, the partial cache of the web part instance persists through postbacks.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.alterntransform
data.value: Specifies the transformation used to display even items in the List view mode. Transformations are specified in the <class name>.<transformation name> format.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.applymenudesign
data.value: Indicates if page settings for menu design should be applied to the navigation items displayed by the web part. These settings can be configured for individual pages in ##ui|cms.content|content## -> Edit -> Properties -> Navigation.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.attachmentgroup
data.value: Allows the selection of the page field from which the attachments will be loaded. This field must use the 'Page attachments control' form control. If empty, attachments bound to the DocumentID field (managable via ##ui|cms.content|content## -> Properties -> Attachments) will be selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.attachmentimagemaxsidesize
data.value: Sets the maximum side size of images displayed in forum post attachments.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.attachmentpath
data.value: Specifies the path of the page from which attachments will be loaded. If empty, the curent page will be used automatically.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.backnextlocation
data.value: Indicates if the buttons used for navigating to the previous and next page should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardbaseurl
data.value: URL used as the URL base of links to message boards in notification emails. If empty, value from##ui|cms|settings## -> Community -> Message boards -> Board base URL will be used. If that property is empty too, message boards cannot be placed on pages with wildcard URLs.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.bodycssclass
data.value: Name of the CSS class which will be added to the BODY tag's class attribute. The specified class must be defined in the site's current CSS stylesheet for the styling to take effect.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cachebyqueryparameters
data.value: Semicolon separated list of query string parameter names that are a part of cache item name, e.g. rss;campaign. The web part creates a new cache item for each unique value of the specified parameters.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cachedependencies
data.value: Contains a list of cache keys on which the content cache of the web part depends. When the specified cache items change, the system deletes the content cache of the web part. Add one cache key per line. If you leave the 'Use default cache dependencies' box checked, the system automatically clears the web part's content cache whenever the loaded data changes. Default dependencies do not work for external or custom data sources.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cacheitemname
data.value: Sets the name of the cache key used for the content of the web part. If not specified, this name is generated automatically based on the site, page path, Web part control ID and current user. A cache key can be shared between multiple web parts with the same content on different pages in order to avoid keeping redundant data in the memory.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cacheminutes
data.value: Sets the number of minutes for which the content of the web part should remain cached before its latest version is reloaded from the database. If left empty, the value entered into the ##ui|cms|settings## -> System -> Performance -> Cache content (minutes) setting will be used instead. If set to 0, caching will be disabled for the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.calendardayfield
data.value: Sets the page field from which the web part will obtain the dates used to place items into the calendar. The field must use the 'Date and time' data type. If left empty, the 'DocumentModifiedWhen' column will be used by default (pages will be displayed in the calendar according to the date when they were last modified).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.calendartransformation
data.value: Sets the transformation used to display items in the calendar. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.checkperm
data.value: Indicates whether the web part checks the permissions of the users viewing the content. If enabled, the web part only loads pages for which the user has the 'Read' permission.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.columns
data.value: Lists the database columns that are loaded for the given objects. Enter a list of column names separated by commas (,). If empty, all columns are loaded. Specifying a list without unnecessary columns can significantly improve performance.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.combinewithculture
data.value: Specifies whether the default language version of pages is used as a replacement for pages that are not translated into the currently selected language. If you select the 'Use site settings' option, the web part loads the value from '##ui|cms|settings## -> Content -> Combine with default culture'.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.combinewithdefaultculture
data.value: Indicates whether search results should be retrieved from pages in the default culture in addition to the culture that is currently selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.combinewithdefaultculturedesc
data.value: Indicates whether search results should be retrieved from pages in the default culture in addition to the culture that is currently selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.comments
data.value: May be used to enter a comment for the given wireframe component. Components that have a comment are displayed in the wireframe grid with an additional question mark icon in their corner, which shows the text of the comment as a tooltip.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.container
data.value: Specifies the name of the container (box) to be displayed around the web part. Only containers defined in ##ui|cms.Design|Development.WebContainers## can be selected. The selected container can be edited directly by using the Edit button.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.containercssclass
data.value: CSS class used for the container. Applied only if the {%ContainerCSSClass%} macro is used as the value of the Class attribute in the code of the container.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.containercustomcontent
data.value: Custom content to be used in the container. Applied only if the {%ContainerCustomContent%} macro is used in the code of the container.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.containerhideonsub
data.value: If enabled, the container does not appear on pages that inherit the web part from an ancestor page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.containertitle
data.value: Sets a title for the container. This title is displayed only if the {%ContainerTitle%} macro is used in the code of the container.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.contentafter
data.value: HTML content placed after the web part. Can be used to display a footer or close the tags contained in the ContentBefore value, such as or elements.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.contentbefore
data.value: HTML content placed before the web part. Can be used to display a header or add some encapsulating code, such as <div> or <table> elements to achieve the required layout.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.conversionname
data.value: Selects the conversion object used to track the actions that users perform via the web part/widget.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.conversionvalue
data.value: Sets a number that will be recorded along with the conversion when the tracked action is performed. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value will be added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. If you wish to specify a dynamic value, insert an appropriate macro expression by clicking the arrow icon (Edit value) next to the field.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cssfiles
data.value: Can be used to specify the path to external stylesheet files that are required to generate the effect. A request for these stylesheets will be added to the head element of the page. Each path must be entered on a new line. For example: ~/CMSWebParts/Viewers/Effects/lightbox_files/lightbox.css

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.culturecode
data.value: Indicates which culture version of the specified pages should be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.culturedesc
data.value: Sets the culture code of the pages that should be included in searches. If empty, the current culture is searched. The ##ALL## macro can be used to search in pages of all cultures.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.currentpage
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the currently selected page. Use <%# Eval("Page") %> to get the current page number, <%# Eval("PageURL") %> to get the page URL or <%# Eval("PageLink") %> to get a link to the current page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.customtable
data.value: Allows the selection of the custom table from which data should be loaded.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.customtimezone
data.value: May be used to assign a custom time zone specifically for the content of this web part. If selected, the time zone will be used regardless of current user or website time zone settings.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.datasourcecheckperm
data.value: Indicates if permissions should be checked for the displayed content and only the items for which the current user has appropriate permission should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.datasourcename
data.value: Must contain the Web part control ID of the data source web part which provides the objects to be displayed. The data source web part must be placed on the same page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.datasourcenamedocuments
data.value: In order to display pages provided by a data source web part, its Web part control ID must be entered into this property. The data source web part must be placed on the same page. Only the Pages data source may be connected to this web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.datatableexpressionwhere
data.value: Sets the value of the WHERE clause in the SELECT expression executed on the source DataTable in memory.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.defaulttargeturl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the page where users should be redirected after they successfully log in. For example: ~/clientportal.aspx. This property is ignored if a different URL is passed through the ReturnUrl query string parameter (e.g. when a user is redirected to a logon page after they attempt to access a website section that requires authentication).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.directpage
data.value: Sets the transformation that implements direct page changing. Use a text box or drop-down list control with an ID set to "directPageControl" to register the page change event.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.disablemacros
data.value: If checked, macros contained in the values of the web part's properties will no longer be resolved.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.disableonsub
data.value: If checked, the web part does not perform its function on pages that inherit the web part from an ancestor page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.disableviewstate
data.value: Indicates if view state should be disabled for this web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displayattachmentimage
data.value: Determines whether images in forum post attachments should be displayed directly in the post. If not checked, only links to the images will be shown.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaybadgeinfo
data.value: Indicates whether badge information should be displayed for post authors in the forums.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displayblogpostssubscriptions
data.value: Indicates if subscriptions to blog posts should be displayed to users on the Subscriptions tab.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displayfirstlastautomatically
data.value: If enabled, the "go to first page" and "go to last page" buttons of the pager will be displayed only when there is no other way to access the first or last page through the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displayhighlighteditemaslink
data.value: Indicates if items in the menu that are part of the currently selected path should be displayed as links.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaymessageboardssubscriptions
data.value: Indicates if subscriptions to message boards should be displayed to users on the Subscriptions tab.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaynewsletterssubscriptions
data.value: Indicates if email campaign subscriptions should be displayed to users on the Subscriptions tab.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaypreviousnextautomatically
data.value: If enabled, the "go to previous page" and "go to next page" buttons of the pager will be displayed only when there is no other way of accessing the previous or next page through the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaytoroles
data.value: Contains a list of roles to which the web part should be displayed. This may be used to implement pages with specific functionality for different types of users. The roles in the list must be specified by their code names and separated by semicolons (;). If empty, the web part will be displayed to all users.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.docperpage
data.value: Sets the default number of items that will be displayed at the same time. If the amount of items exceeds the selected number, the remaining items will be accessible using the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.documentage
data.value: Filters pages according to their age in days. Only pages that are older than the first value and newer than the second will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.documentname
data.value: Filters pages according to their page name. Only pages that contain the entered string somewhere in their name will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.documentsorderby
data.value: Selects the data field according to which the displayed items will be sorted by default.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.documenttypes
data.value: Determines which page types to load. Specify the page types as a list of code names separated by semicolons (;). The * wildcard can be used as a substitute for a random sequence of characters. For example, Product.* includes page types such as Product.Camera, Product.CellPhone, Product.Computer etc. If left empty, the web part retrieves all page types by default. With an empty value, only the general page fields from View_CMS_Tree_Joined are available - you cannot use the fields of individual page types when writing transformations, WHERE conditions etc.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enabled
data.value: Indicates if the web part is enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enableoutputfilter
data.value: If checked, the output code of this web part is processed by the output filters

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enablepostspaging
data.value: Indicates if the posts in a thread should be paged. Paging can only be applied if the selected Forum layout supports paging (Flat).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enableuserafterregistration
data.value: Indicates if users should automatically be enabled after registration. Please note that if the website is configured to require email confirmation or administrator approval for registration, users will always be disabled when they register.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.encodemenucaption
data.value: Indicates whether HTML encoding should be applied to the navigation items. Useful only in special cases where the names of the displayed pages contain HTML code.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.failuretext
data.value: Sets the text displayed to users if authentication fails. For example: Incorrect user name or password.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.filterduplicates
data.value: Indicates if the retrieved data should be filtered to contain pages only once, even if they are linked multiple times.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.filtername
data.value: Sets the name of the Filter web part that is to be connected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.firstpage
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the first page. Use <%# Eval("FirstURL") %> to get the URL of the first page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.firsttransform
data.value: Sets the transformation applied to the first item displayed on every hierarchical level. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.forumsenableavatars
data.value: Indicates if user avatar images should be displayed in the forums.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.friendlybaseurl
data.value: Sets the path that will serve as the base of the friendly URLs used by the forums, e.g. /Forums. If empty, the URL of the current page is used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.friendlyurlextension
data.value: Sets the extension that should be used in the friendly URLs. For extensionless URLs, leave the property blank.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.generateurlswithlangprefix
data.value: Indicates if the URLs generated for different language versions should include culture specific page URL paths and language prefixes (if they are enabled for the site).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridallowsorting
data.value: Indicates if sorting according to individual columns should be allowed in the displayed grid.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridcolumnselector
data.value: Allows the selection and configuration of the columns that should be displayed in the grid. Please be aware that it is impossible to display columns that are not loaded by the web part (depending on the settings of the 'Selected columns' property). The selection dialog provides the option to display the values of a column as links. If you wish to use this function, your query must retrieve the NodeAliasPath and DocumentUrlPath columns (e.g. from the View_CMS_Tree_Joined view), so that an appropriate URL can be generated for the links.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridpagingmode
data.value: Allows the selection of the method used for navigation between pages. The options are Previous/Next buttons and page number links.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridsetfirstpageaftersortchange
data.value: Indicates if the first page should be displayed instead of the current page after the sorting of the grid is changed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridshowfooter
data.value: Indicates if the grid footer should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridshowheader
data.value: Indicates if the grid header should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridsortascending
data.value: Indicates if the default sorting order should be ascending.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridsortfield
data.value: Sets the name of the field used to sort the records in the grid by default.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.gridtooltip
data.value: Sets the tooltip displayed when a user hovers their mouse over the grid.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.groupsize
data.value: Sets the maximum amount of page number links that will be displayed together. Any additional links that do not fit can be accessed in the next or previous group.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hideheadfootforsingle
data.value: If checked, the header and footer transformations will not be applied if only a single item is displayed on a given hierarchical level.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hidelayoutforzerorows
data.value: Indicates if the content specified using the Content before/after properties in the Layout category should be hidden if no items to be displayed are retrieved.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hideonsub
data.value: If checked, the web part does not appear on pages that inherit the web part from an ancestor page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hidepagerforsinglepage
data.value: Indicates whether the pager should be hidden if the displayed items fit onto a single page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hideunavaliblecultures
data.value: Indicates whether links for cultures that are not available for the current page should be hidden.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hierarchdisplaymode
data.value: Allows the hierarchical display mode to be selected. Inner: generates sub-levels inside the parent item (tree structure). Separate: generates sub-levels outside of the items on parent levels (flat structure).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hierarchfootertransform
data.value: Sets the transformation used at the end of every hierarchical level. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hierarchheadertransform
data.value: Sets the transformation used at the beginning of every hierarchical level. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hierarchicaltransformation
data.value: Sets the transformation to be used for the displayed pages in list view mode. This property can be used to set both standard and hierarchical transformations. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.highlightallitemsinpath
data.value: If enabled, all items on the path of the currently selected page will also be selected (highlighted) in the menu.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.highlightednodepath
data.value: Sets the path of the page that should be selected in the menu by default. If empty, the path of the currently selected page is used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.idcolumnname
data.value: Sets the name of the column which serves as a unique identifier for objects. It is used in a parent-child relationship with the column specified in the 'ParentID column' property. It is recommended to use the NodeID column when displaying pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.inclfinishedtasks
data.value: If enabled, tasks that have a status designating them as finished will be counted by the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.inclnotstartedtasks
data.value: If enabled, tasks that have a status designating them as not yet started will be counted by the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.includejquery
data.value: If enabled, the jQuery core script will automatically be included on the page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.indexes
data.value: Selects one or more smart search indexes that the web part uses for searching.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.initscript
data.value: Contains the script that initializes the effect applied to the displayed items.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.inlinecss
data.value: Can be used to specify additional inline CSS styles that will be placed directly into the page header.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.itemhtmlafter
data.value: HTML content placed after each of the generated items. This content is not used if a single selected page is viewed in detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.itemhtmlbefore
data.value: HTML content placed before each of the generated items. This content is not used if a single selected item is viewed in detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.itemseparator
data.value: Contains the code of a separator that is placed between displayed items, e.g. <hr />.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lastpage
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the last page. Use <%# Eval("LastURL") %> to get the URL of the last page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lasttransform
data.value: Sets the transformation applied to the last item displayed on every hierarchical level. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.levelcolumnname
data.value: Sets the name of the column used to determine an object's level in the hierarchy. It is recommended to use the NodeLevel column when displaying pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxanimate
data.value: Indicates if the lightbox animation should be enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxbordersize
data.value: Sets the width of the image border in the lightbox.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxgroup
data.value: Sets a group name for the generated lightbox. It is necessary to set this property when displaying multiple lightboxes on a single page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxheight
data.value: Sets the height of the frame used in lightbox detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxloaddelay
data.value: Sets the load delay time (in miliseconds). When using automatic resizing, this value indicates how long the lightbox will take to reach the size of the displayed element. If there are problems displaying lightbox content, try to use a higher value.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxoverlayopacity
data.value: Determines the transparency of the lightbox background. Must be a decimal number between 0 and 1, where 0 is fully transparent and 1 is completely dark.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxpermanentnavigation
data.value: If checked, the navigations buttons will always be visible in lightbox detail view mode. Otherwise they will only be shown on mouse over.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxresizespeed
data.value: Allows the selection of the image resizing speed. Options range from 1 (slowest) to 10 (fastest).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.lightboxwidth
data.value: Sets the width of the frame used in lightbox detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.linkselectedtext
data.value: Sets the text displayed for the given link if it is currently selected by the user. You can insert HTML code into this field.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.linktitle
data.value: Sets the title (tooltip) for the link used to select the given style option.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.listingtype
data.value: Selects which category of pages should be displayed. If the All option is chosen, some pages may be listed multiple times if they fit the conditions of more than one category.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.loadhierarchdata
data.value: Indicates whether pages should be loaded with regard to their hierarchical position in the content tree. Hierarchical data has a parent-child relationship (NodeID/NodeParentID). Hierarchical transformations can be used for this type of data. Please be aware that hierarchical data cannot be displayed if paging is enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.logonpageurl
data.value: Sets the URL of the logon page to which unauthorized users are redirected if the "Redirect unauthorized users" property is enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.margin
data.value: Specifies the margin of the content in pixels, e.g., 15px

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.maxnestinglevel
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of content tree sub-levels from which the content is to be loaded. This number is relative, i.e. it is counted from the beginning of the path specified for the content of the web part. Entering -1 causes all sub-levels to be included.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.maxpages
data.value: Sets the maximum number of pages which should be displayed, even if the results are divided into more pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.maxrelativelevel
data.value: Sets the maximum amount of allowed levels in the forum post hierarchy. For example, setting 1 would only let users reply to the first post of each thread. Entering -1 causes the level to be unlimited.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.medialibraryname
data.value: Content of this media library will be displayed by the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.messageboard
data.value: Selects the specific message board (or all boards) from which the posts will be loaded.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.navcolumns
data.value: Lists database columns that should be loaded in addition to the set used by default; separated by commas (,). Entering an asterisk (*) causes all columns to be loaded. It is recommended to load only those columns that are necessary.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.navigationdocumenttypes
data.value: Determines which page types are displayed. Specify the page types as a list of code names separated by semicolons (;). If empty, only CMS.MenuItem pages are loaded by default.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.navigationpath
data.value: Specifies the path of the pages that will be displayed. If empty, the path is set to all pages of the given website (/%).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.navigationtreeorderby
data.value: Sets the value of the ORDER BY clause in the SELECT statement used to retrieve the content. Please be aware that it is necessary for the root of the displayed tree (or sub-tree) to be first in the resulting order, otherwise all pages may not be displayed correctly. This can be ensured by having the value of this property start with the NodeLevel column, such as for example: NodeLevel, NodeOrder

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nextgroup
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the next group of page links. Use <%# Eval("NextGroupURL") %> to get the URL of the next group.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nextpage
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the next page. Use <%# Eval("NextURL") %> to get the URL of the next page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.noeventtransf
data.value: Sets the transformation used for days without any items to be displayed. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.noresultstext
data.value: Sets the text that is displayed if no search results are found.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.orderby
data.value: Sets the value of the ORDER BY clause in the SELECT statement used to retrieve the content.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputconverttablestodivs
data.value: If enabled, the TABLE tags in the output are automatically converted to DIV tags with CSS class corresponding to the tag name (table, tr, td, etc.) Blocks of HTML code can be optionally marked with class="_divs" or class="_nodivs" to allow or disable conversion for that particular block of code.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputfixattributes
data.value: If checked, the filter ensures that all HTML tag attributes are in valid XHTML format.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputfixhtml5
data.value: If checked, the filter replaces attributes that are obsolete in HTML5 with CSS classes named in format <attribute name>_<attribute value>. The affected attributes are: cellpadding, cellspacing, width, height, border, align, valign

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputfixjavascript
data.value: If checked, the filter ensures that the type and language attributes are included in all <script> tags.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputfixlowercase
data.value: If checked, the filter ensures that all HTML tags and attributes are generated in lower case.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputfixselfclose
data.value: If checked, the filter ensures that HTML tags without end tags are properly closed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.outputresolveurls
data.value: If checked, the filter removes the "~" character in relative URLs and replace it with the root URL of the website.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.padding
data.value: Specifies the padding of the content in pixels, e.g., 15px

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagenumbersseparator
data.value: Contains the HTML code of a separator to be placed between the page number links.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagerhtmlafter
data.value: Contains the HTML code placed on the page after the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagerhtmlbefore
data.value: Contains the HTML code placed on the page before the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagerlayout
data.value: Sets the transformation that determines the overall design of the pager.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pageseparator
data.value: Sets the transformation used as a separator between page links.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagesize
data.value: Determines the maximum number of records displayed per page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagingmode
data.value: Determines which method is used to pass information about the currently selected page - it can be passed either as a parameter in the URL (Query string) or through postback (Postback).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.parentidcolumnname
data.value: Sets the name of the column that contains the unique identifier of an object's parent. It is used in a parent-child relationship with the column specified in the 'ID column' property. It is recommended to use the NodeParentID column when displaying pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.partialcachedependencies
data.value: Contains a list of cache keys on which the partial cache of the web part depends. When the specified cache items change, the system deletes the partial output cache of the web part. Add one cache key per line. If you leave the 'Use default cache dependencies' box checked, the system automatically clears the partial cache whenever you change the property configuration of the web part instance.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.partialcacheminutes
data.value: Sets the number of minutes for which the output HTML code of the web part should remain cached. This process is similar to full-page caching, but only for the code of the web part specifically. If left empty or set to 0, partial caching will be not be used for the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.path
data.value: Specifies the path of the selected pages. If you leave the path empty, the web part either loads all child pages or selects the current page (depending on the page type and the configuration of the web part's other properties).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pm.allowcreatefor
data.value: Designates what type of users can manage the displayed projects (create/modify projects and tasks). The selection made in this property overrides the security settings of individual projects.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pm.authorizedroles
data.value: Sets the roles that should be authorized to manage the displayed projects. This option is used only if the Authorized roles option is selected in the 'Project can be managed by' property.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.postspagesize
data.value: Sets the number of posts displayed per page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.predictivesearchenabledesc
data.value: Enables predictive search functionality. Predictive search displays results instantly while users type into the search box.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.predictivesearchmaxresultsdesc
data.value: Sets the maximum number of search results that the predictive search displays.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.previousgroup
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the previous group of page links. Use <%# Eval("PreviousGroupURL") %> to get the URL of the previous group.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.previouspage
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the link to the previous page. Use <%# Eval("PreviousURL") %> to get the URL of the previous page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.project
data.value: Allows the selection of the projects whose tasks should be displayed. All projects from the current site that do not belong under any group are available.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.querycolumns
data.value: Lists the columns (separated by commas) that should be loaded by the specified query. For this property to be applied, the used query must contain the ##COLUMNS## macro expression after its SELECT statement.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.queryorderby
data.value: Sets the value of the ORDER BY clause in the query used to retrieve data. For this property to be applied, the used query must have the ##ORDERBY## macro expression as the value of its ORDER BY clause.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.queryselecttopn
data.value: Sets the maximum amount of items to be retrieved by the specified query. For this property to be applied, the used query must contain the ##TOPN## macro expression directly after its SELECT statement.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.querywhere
