data.value: Sets the value of the WHERE clause in the query used to retrieve data. For this property to be applied, the used query must have the ##WHERE## macro expression as the value of its WHERE clause.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.ratingtype
data.value: Determines which type of content rating will be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.redirecttouserprofile
data.value: Indicates whether the usernames of forum post authors should serve as links to the given user's profile page. This requires the ##ui|cms|settings## -> Community -> Member profile path setting to be configured properly.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.registrationapprovalpage
data.value: Sets the URL of the page where users can confirm their registration. This page will be linked in the registration confirmation email. The page must contain the 'Registration email confirmation' web part to work correctly.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.registrationassigntoroles
data.value: Can be used to set a list of roles to which users will be assigned when they register through the web part. The roles must be specified using their code names and separated by semicolons (;). For example: CMSPublicUsers;CMSEditors

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.registrationassigntosites
data.value: Can be used to select which sites users should automatically be assigned to when they register through the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.renderimagealt
data.value: Indicates if ALT attributes should be rendered for all images used in the menu (for XHTML compatibility).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.renderlinktitle
data.value: If enabled, the menu will render page names as Title attributes (tooltips) for all links. This can improve the accessibility of your website.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.repeatcolumns
data.value: Sets the number of columns into which the displayed items will be divided.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.repeatdirection
data.value: Determines the direction in which items should be displayed when multiple columns are used - can be either vertical or horizontal.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.repeaterhtmlafter
data.value: HTML content placed after the list of generated items. This can be used to define the layout required for the effect, e.g. by adding closing block elements. The content is not used if a single selected page is viewed in detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.repeaterhtmlbefore
data.value: HTML content placed before the list of generated items. This property can be used to define the layout required for the desired effect, e.g. by adding wrapping block elements to apply CSS classes. The content is not used if a single selected page is viewed in detail view mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.repeatlayout
data.value: Allows the selection of the layout that should be used when displaying items. The available options are table or flow (no predefined structure).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.reportchart
data.value: Selects the report and specific chart that will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.resetscrollposition
data.value: Indicates whether scroll position should be cleared after post back

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.resultsposition
data.value: Allows the position of the paging results summary text to be selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.rssitemscount
data.value: Number of items to be displayed in the RSS feed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.scriptfiles
data.value: Can be used to specify the path to external script files that are required to generate the effect. A request for these scripts will be added to the head element of the page. Each path must be entered on a new line. For example: ~/CMSWebParts/Viewers/Effects/lightbox_files/jquery.js

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchbutton
data.value: Sets the text caption of the search button.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchcheckpermissionsdesc
data.value: Indicates whether the web part filters the search results to exclude pages for which users do not have the "Read" permission.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchconditiondesc
data.value: Sets a search condition that is added to any conditions specified in the search expression. You can use special characters (+ -) and field conditions (e.g. +documentnodeid:(int)255).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchculturedesc
data.value: Sets the culture code of the pages that should be included in searches. If empty, the current culture is searched. The ##ALL## macro can be used to search in pages of all cultures.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchdocumenttypesdesc
data.value: Allows you to restrict page searches to specific page types. Enter the code names of page types, separated by semicolons (;). If empty, all page types specified by the index are searched.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchdofuzzysearchdesc
data.value: If checked, the search finds results for words that are similar in spelling to the search terms (fuzzy search). For example, searching for 'code' also matches words such as 'core' or 'node'. Only works for search requests that use the 'Any word' Search mode.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchforlabel
data.value: Sets the text displayed before the search textbox.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchmaxresultsdesc
data.value: Sets the maximum number of search results that can be displayed. If empty, no limits are used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchmincharsdesc
data.value: Sets the minimum number of characters that users need to type into the search box before the predictive search starts showing results.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchmode
data.value: Sets the default search mode. The options are searching for results that contain all words in the entered expression, any of the words or only the exact phrase.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchmodedesc
data.value: Sets the default search mode, which determines how the smart search handles expressions with multiple words. The options are searching for results that contain any words in the entered expression, any words or their synonyms (English only), all of the words, or only the exact phrase.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchmodelabel
data.value: Sets the text displayed before the search mode selector.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchoptionsdesc
data.value: Sets the level of syntax that is allowed in search expressions: Basic - users are allowed to input special syntax, but cannot search specific fields(field:value). None - users can only enter text, everything is processed as a part of the search expression. Full - all search options can be used, including field searching.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchorderby
data.value: Sets the ORDER BY expression that defines the order in which page attachments are displayed in the search results.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchpathdesc
data.value: Can be used to limit the path that is searched by page searches.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchresultspageurl
data.value: URL of the page where the search results are displayed. This page must contain either the Smart search results or Smart search dialog with results web part. If empty, the current page is used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchsortdesc
data.value: Defines the order in which search results are displayed. You can specify one or more search fields (separated by commas), according to which the results will be sorted. Use the ##SCORE## macro to order results by their score (relevance). The default order is ascending - you can reverse the order by adding the DESC keyword (e.g. articleid DESC).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.searchwhere
data.value: Sets the WHERE condition that limits which pages have their attachments searched.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecteddatabasecolumnname
data.value: Determines which custom table field is used to identify records for selection. This field must be a unique identifier.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectedfootertransf
data.value: Sets the transformation placed after an item when it is displayed in detail view mode. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectedheadertransf
data.value: Sets the transformation placed before an item when it is displayed in detail view mode. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecteditemcolumn
data.value: Sets the name of the column which should be used to identify the currently selected item. It is recommended to use the DocumentID column when displaying pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecteditemvalue
data.value: Can be used to enter a value of the column specified in the 'Selected item value' property to designate the currently selected item. The {%currentpageinfo.documentid%} macro can be entered to dynamically give the value of the current page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectedquerystringkeyname
data.value: Sets the name of the URL query string parameter used to determine which custom table record is selected (for detail view mode).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectedvalidationtype
data.value: Sets the type of validation applied to the input of the query string parameter used for the selection of custom table records.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectpublished
data.value: Specifies whether the web part only loads published pages.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecttopndocuments
data.value: Specifies the maximum amount of pages to be loaded. At least as many pages as in the 'visible' value of the 'Initialization script' property need to be specified. If empty, all possible pages will be selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sendconfirmationemails
data.value: If true, confirmation emails will be sent to users who subscribe or unsubscribe to/from a newsletter.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sendwelcomeemail
data.value: Indicates whether a welcome email should be sent to users after registration. The emails are based on the appropriate email template (depends if the website is configured to require email confirmation or administrator approval for registration).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showcurrentitemaslink
data.value: Indicates whether the current breadcrumbs item should be generated as a link.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showfinishedprojects
data.value: If enabled, projects that have a status designating them as finished will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showfinishedtasks
data.value: If enabled, tasks that have a status designating them as finished will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showfordocumenttypes
data.value: Contains a list of page types on which the web part should be displayed. If the currently selected page uses the page template containing this web part, but its type is not specified by this property, the web part will be hidden. The page types in the list must be specified by their code names and separated by semicolons (;). If empty, the web part will be displayed on all page types.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showglobaleventsonly
data.value: Indicates if only events that are not related to a specific site should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showontime
data.value: If enabled, tasks that haven't yet reached their deadline will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showoverdue
data.value: If enabled, tasks that have passed their deadline will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showprivate
data.value: If enabled, private tasks will be displayed. Private tasks are visible only by users who are involved in them.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showsearchmode
data.value: Indicates if the search mode selector should be displayed to users.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showsignout
data.value: If enabled, the web part will display a sign out link for authenticated users.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showstatusas
data.value: Selects the way that task statuses should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.signinimageurl
data.value: Specifies the URL of an image that will be used for the sign in button if the Sign in text property is empty.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.signoutimageurl
data.value: Specifies the URL of an image that will be used for the sign out button. Default Facebook sign out image will be used if no URL is set.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.singletransform
data.value: Sets the transformation applied when only a single item is displayed on a hierarchical level. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.site
data.value: Allows the selection of the site from which content should be loaded. Global administrators have the option of selecting all sites.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sitename
data.value: Defines the website (specified by its code name) from which to load the content. If left empty, the current site is used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.siteorglobal
data.value: Allows the selection of the site from which content should be loaded. You can choose current site, global or global and current site related content.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.skinid
data.value: Sets the SkinID of the skin that should be applied to the web part. The skin must be defined in the Default.skin file located in the App_Themes directory under the folder of the stylesheet used by the page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sorting
data.value: Determines whether the default sorting order should be ascending or descending.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spfields
data.value: If the Use dataset property is enabled, this field can be used to specify which of the retrieved fields should be converted to columns in the dataset (field names must be separated by semicolons). If empty, all fields will be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spitemidfield
data.value: If entered, items will be selected based on the presence of this key in the URL query string.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spitemidfieldtype
data.value: Used to specify the type of the itemID field. The two basic types are Text (for string values) and Counter (for IDs). More information can be found at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms437580.aspx

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.splistname
data.value: Name of the SharePoint list(or picture library) from which the list items/pictures should be loaded. This field is case sensitive!

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spquery
data.value: Can be used to set a query to filter which rows should be loaded or change their order. It uses CAML syntax. A sample query could look like the following: <Query><Where><Eq><FieldRef Name="ID" /><Value Type="Counter">1</Value></Eq></Where></Query> More information can be found at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd586530.aspx

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sprowlimit
data.value: Sets the maximum number of items (data rows) to be retrieved.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spselecteditemfieldname
data.value: Determines which field is used for item selection. Original field names are used here - without the ows_ prefix. This property is case sensitive!

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spservicemode
data.value: Determines what kind of data will be loaded by the web part. This also automatically sets the appropriate web service to be used. The selected mode may affect the behaviour of some of the web part's other properties.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spservicepassword
data.value: Sets the password used for authentication against the web service. If empty, the credentials specified in ##ui|cms|settings## -> Integration -> Microsoft SharePoint will be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spserviceurl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the SharePoint site that should be used or the direct URL of the requested web service (Eg. Lists.asmx, Imaging.asmx). If only the site URL is entered, then the web service used for data retrieval is automatically determined according to the value of the Mode property.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spserviceusername
data.value: Sets the username for authentication against the web service. If empty, the credentials specified in ##ui|cms|settings## -> Integration -> Microsoft SharePoint will be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spshowreturnedcaml
data.value: If enabled, the retrieved data will be displayed in raw CAML format. This can be useful for debugging purposes or when searching for the content of specific fields.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sptransformationname
data.value: Sets the transformation used to display the listed data. Standard ASCX transformations should be selected if the Use dataset property is enabled, otherwise XSLT can be used to transform CAML directly to HTML. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spuseclassicdataset
data.value: If enabled, the retrieved XML data will be converted to a dataset that can be used with standard ASCX transformations. If disabled, the data will not be modified and can be converted to HTML using XSLT.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.spviewfields
data.value: Directly specifies the names of the SharePoint list fields that should be loaded. If empty all fields will be retrieved. Note: Certain fields will always be retrieved.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.sqlsearch
data.value: If checked, the web part runs an SQL search through the content of page attachments and interlaces the results with the other results provided by the specified smart search indexes. Your SQL server must be properly configured for full-text search. We recommend searching attachment content using Page indexes instead.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.tagcloud.selectpublished
data.value: Indicates if only tags from published pages should be displayed. Applied only when 'Site name' or 'Alias path' property is defined. If not, all tags from the selected tag group will be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.taskinfotext
data.value: Sets the text of the displayed message. It may contain the {0} formatting macro expression, which will be resolved into the number of tasks assigned to the current user.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.threadpagesize
data.value: Sets the number of threads displayed per page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.threadviewmode
data.value: Sets the default mode used to display forum posts under threads. Only applied if the Forum layout property is set to flat.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.timezonetype
data.value: Specifies the type of time zone used for the content of the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.transformation
data.value: Sets the transformation used for the displayed content in list view mode. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.transformationfeed
data.value: Transformation used for generating the feed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.transformationname
data.value: Sets the transformation according to which the search results will be displayed. You can find predefined search result transformations under the CMS.Root page type.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.urltarget
data.value: Specifies the name of the target frame in which the navigation links will be opened. For example: _blank

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.usefordocumenttypes
data.value: The web part only performs its function on the specified page types. If the page template containing the web part instance is assigned to a page whose type does not match, the web part is disabled. Enter a list of page type code names separated by semicolons (;). If empty, the web part is enabled for all page types.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.useforroles
data.value: The web part only performs its function for users assigned to at least one of the specified roles. Allows you to implement pages with specific functionality for different types of users. Enter a list of role code names separated by semicolons (;). If empty, the web part works for all users.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.usehiearechorder
data.value: Indicates whether the default hierarchical order should be used when displaying pages. This order is applied only if the LoadHierarchicalData property is enabled. The default order value is "NodeLevel, NodeOrder". The value of the ORDER BY expression property is added to the end of the order by clause.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.useupdatepanel
data.value: Indicates if an AJAX UpdatePanel container should be used for this web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.visible
data.value: Indicates if the web part should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.webparttitle
data.value: Title of the web part displayed on the Design tab in administration and in on-site editing mode. If empty, the value of the Web part control ID property is used for this purpose.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.where
data.value: Sets the value of the WHERE clause in the SELECT statement used to retrieve the content.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.wordwrap
data.value: Indicates if long menu item captions should be broken into multiple lines (word wrapped).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.zonetitle
data.value: Title of the zone displayed on the Design tab.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.zonetype
data.value: The following zone types are available: None - a standard web part zone. User personalization - widget zone that website users can personalize on the live site. Customization by page editor - widget zone that website editors can customize on the Page tab of the Pages application. Customization by group administrator - widget zone that group administrators of the group that owns the page can customize on the live site. Dashboard - this type of zone is only available on Dashboard page type templates. If selected, user can customize the widget zone on dashboard sections located in the administration interface.

data.name: documentation.webparts.abuse.status
data.value: Allows the selection of a status according to which the displayed abuse reports will be filtered. Reports with a different status than chosen here will not be shown.

data.name: documentation.webparts.blogs.blogname
data.value: Selects the specific blog (or all blogs ) from which the comments will be loaded.

data.name: documentation.webparts.blogs.isapproved
data.value: Can be used to filter the listed comments according to their approval status (e.g. if the no option is selected, only comments that require approval will be displayed).

data.name: documentation.webparts.blogs.isspam
data.value: Can be used to filter the listed comments according to their spam flag.

data.name: documentation.webparts.forum.groups
data.value: Selects the forum groups from which posts should be displayed. If empty, all forum posts will be loaded, including those from ad-hoc forums.

data.name: documentation.widgetproperties.container
data.value: Selects which container (if any) should be displayed around the widget.

data.name: documentation.widgetproperties.containercssclass
data.value: CSS class used for the widget container. Applied only if the {%ContainerCSSClass%} macro is used as a value of the Class attribute of a wrapping element in container code.

data.name: documentation.widgetproperties.containercustomcontent
data.value: Custom content of the widget container. Applied only if the {%ContainerCustomContent%} macro is used in container code.

data.name: documentation.widgetproperties.containertitle
data.value: Sets the text of the title displayed in the header of the widget's container.

data.name: documentation.widgets.widgetpropertiestitle
data.value: Allows user to set widget title. If empty widget name is used.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.container
data.value: Specifies the name of the container (box) to be displayed around the entire web part zone. Only the containers defined at ##ui|cms.design|Development.WebContainers## can be selected. The selected container can be edited directly by using the Edit button.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.containercssclass
data.value: CSS class used for the web part zone's container. Applied only if the {%ContainerCSSClass%} macro is used as the value of the Class attribute in the code of the container.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.containercustomcontent
data.value: Custom content to be displayed in the web part zone's container. Applied only if the code of the used container contains the {%ContainerCustomContent%} macro.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.containerhideonsub
data.value: If enabled, the zone's container does not appear on pages that inherit the zone from an ancestor page.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.containertitle
data.value: Sets a title for the container (if one is specified for the web part zone). This title is displayed only if the {%ContainerTitle%} macro is used in the code of the container.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.contentafter
data.value: HTML content placed after the web part zone. Can be used to display a footer or close the tags contained in the 'ContentBefore' property, such as or elements.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.contentbefore
data.value: HTML content placed before the web part zone. Can be used to display a header or add some encapsulating code, such as <div> or <table> elements to achieve the required layout.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.displaytoroles
data.value: Contains a list of roles to which the web part zone should be displayed. This may be used to implement pages with specific functionality for different types of users. The roles in the list must be specified by their code names and separated by semicolons (;). If empty, the zone will be displayed to all users.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.hideonsub
data.value: If checked, the web part zone does not appear on pages that inherit the zone from an ancestor page.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.showfordocumenttypes
data.value: Indicates for which page types should the web part zone be displayed. If the type of the currently selected page is different, the web part zone is not displayed.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.visible
data.value: Indicates if the entire content of the web part zone should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.zoneproperties.zonetitle
data.value: Specifies the title of the web part zone. If not entered, code name of the web part zone is used.

data.name: documentlibrary.libraryrootnotexist
data.value: Page with specified library path ('{0}') does not exist.

data.name: documents.selectdocuments
data.value: You have to select some pages first.

data.name: documenttype.classdefaultpagetemplateid.description
data.value: The page template used by default when pages of this type are created. If no page template is specified, new pages inherit the template of their parent page by default.

data.name: documenttype.classdisplayname.description
data.value: The name of the page type displayed in the user interface.

data.name: documenttype.classeditingpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the editing page displayed when the page is being edited on the Form tab.

data.name: documenttype.classicons.description
data.value: The icons representing the pages of this type in the interface.

data.name: documenttype.classinheritsfromclassid.description
data.value: A page type from which fields are loaded into the current page type. These fields can be then modified without affecting the parent page type.

data.name: documenttype.classismenuitemtype.description
data.value: The default view mode for pages of this type is the Page tab instead of the Form tab. Pages of this type do not inherit the parent page's page template by default. Viewer web parts placed on pages automatically display child pages if their Path property is empty.

data.name: documenttype.classlistpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the page displayed when the page is being viewed in list mode.

data.name: documenttype.classloadgeneration.description
data.value: Indicates the wave in which the objects of this type are loaded at the system start.

data.name: documenttype.classname.description
data.value: Serves as a unique identifier for the page type. For example, in the API. Consists of a namespace and an identifier of the specific page type.

data.name: documenttype.classnewpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the page used when creating new pages of this type.

data.name: documenttype.classpagetemplatecategoryid.description
data.value: Limits the page template selection options available when creating this type of page. Users can then only choose from a specific sub-section of the template catalog.

data.name: documenttype.classpreviewpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the page displayed when the page is being displayed in preview mode.

data.name: documenttype.classshowtemplateselection.description
data.value: Indicates whether users are required to select a page template when creating a new page of this type.

data.name: documenttype.classtablename.description
data.value: Displays the full name of the database table used to store coupled data for pages of this type, that is, the content of the specific fields.

data.name: documenttype.classusepublishfromto.description
data.value: Indicates if the Publish from/to fields are offered for pages of this type. These fields are used to schedule publishing of the pages.

data.name: documenttype.classviewpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the editing page displayed when the page is being edited on the Page tab.

data.name: DocumentType.FieldIsInherited
data.value: This item is inherited from page type '{0}', you need to edit it in that page type properties.

data.name: documenttype.scopes.allpages
data.value: Page type can be used on all pages

data.name: documenttype.scopes.selectedscopes
data.value: Page type can be used only within the following scopes

data.name: documenttype_edit_form.confirmlayoutchange
data.value: Current layout will be lost. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: DocumentType_Edit_Transformation_Edit.UniqueTransformationNameCustomTable
data.value: Transformation with the same name already exists in this custom table.

data.name: DocumentType_New_Step7.Description
data.value: Please set search fields for Smart search module.

data.name: documenttype_new_step8_finished.searchspecificationcreated
data.value: Page smart search specification was created.

data.name: ecommerce.cartcontent.customerdisabled
data.value: You are not allowed to make an order because your customer account is disabled. Please contact on-line store administrator.

data.name: ecommerce.customer.invalidemail
data.value: Customer does not have a valid email address.

data.name: Ecommerce.DeleteCarrier
data.value: The selected carrier cannot be deleted because its shipping options are used by other records. You need to remove them from the related records first.

data.name: ecommerce.disablemaincurrencyerror
data.value: Currency "{0}" can't be disabled because it is set as main currency.

data.name: ecommerce.order.norecalculation
data.value: If you change the address, the system will not recalculate shipping, tax, discounts or other order amounts.

data.name: ecommerce.orderpreview.errorordersave
data.value: An error occurred during saving the order. Please check order informations or contact administrator.

data.name: ecommerce.settings.doubleormacro
data.value: Please insert double value or macro.

data.name: edit_user.membershipInfo
data.value: The user is assigned to the following memberships

data.name: EditCode.NotAllowed
data.value: You are not authorized to edit the ASCX code, you need to switch to HTML code type or contact the administrator to grant you with the required permissions.

data.name: EditCode.NotAllowedNoHtml
data.value: You are not authorized to edit the ASCX code, you need to contact the administrator to grant you with the required permissions.

data.name: EditContent.DocumentCannotCheckIn
data.value: The node has not been checked out, it cannot be checked in.

data.name: EditContent.DocumentCannotCheckOut
data.value: The node has already been checked out or is exclusively checked out by another user.

data.name: EditContent.DocumentCannotUndoCheckOut

data.name: editcontent.documentnamecheckedoutbyanother

data.name: editcontent.documentnewversion

data.name: editeddocument.notexists
data.value: The page does not exist, it may have been deleted by someone else.

data.name: editedobject.notexists
data.value: The object does not exist. It may have been deleted by someone else.

data.name: editmenu.approvepublish
data.value: Approve the page until it is published

data.name: editmenu.archiveconfirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to archive the page?

data.name: EditMenu.CommentAutomationMoveNext

data.name: EditMenu.CommentAutomationMovePrevious

data.name: editmenu.commentcheckin

data.name: editmenu.commentdocumentapprovesubmit
data.value: Comment and submit the page for approval

data.name: EditMenu.IconCommentAutomationMoveNext
data.value: Comment and move to next step

data.name: EditMenu.IconCommentAutomationMovePrevious

data.name: editmenu.iconcommentautomationmovespecific
data.value: Comment and move to specific step

data.name: editmenu.newversion
data.value: Create new version and move the page to edit step.

data.name: editmenu.saveandclose
data.value: Save the page and close the dialog

data.name: editmode.showdeletebutton.description
data.value: If enabled, the web part offers delete button for each item when displaying the page in edit mode. You can set the exact position of the button by adding the ##editbuttons## macro into the code of the used item transformation (must be of the ASCX type).

data.name: editmode.showeditbutton.description
data.value: If enabled, the web part offers edit button for each item when displaying the page in edit mode. You can set the exact position of the button by adding the ##editbuttons## macro into the code of the used item transformation (must be of the ASCX type).

data.name: editnewsletters.differentsite
data.value: Requested email campaign is not placed on the current site.

data.name: editnewsletters.differentsitesubscriber
data.value: Requested email campaign subscriber is not from current site.

data.name: editnewsletters.differentsitetemplate
data.value: Requested email campaign template is on different site.

data.name: editpage.actionnotallowed
data.value: This action is not allowed in current context.

data.name: editsubscriber.email.description
data.value: The email address of the subscriber.

data.name: editsubscriber.firstname.description
data.value: The first name of the subscriber.

data.name: editsubscriber.lastname.description
data.value: The last name of the subscriber.

data.name: EditTemplateFields.GenerateFormDefConfirmation

data.name: macros.refreshsecurityparams.currentsaltisconnectionstring
data.value: (Current salt is a connection string, not shown for security reasons)

data.name: macros.refreshsecurityparams.currentsaltiscustomvalue
data.value: (Current salt is a custom value, not shown for security reasons)

data.name: macros.refreshsecurityparams.description
data.value:
Whenever a user saves a macro expression, the system automatically adds a security signature containing the user name of the macro's author and a hash of the expression. The hash function also appends a salt to the input. By default, the system uses a randomly generated GUID as the salt.

If your application's hash salt value changes, the security signatures of existing macro expressions become invalid. This may lead to problems with unresolved macros in certain scenarios:

  • After setting a new salt via the CMSHashStringSalt web.config key.
  • When using content staging to transfer data containing macros to another instance with a different hash salt.
  • If your application does not have a custom hash salt, and the connection string has changed (for example when moving to a different server or after setting a new database password).

To re-sign all occurrences of macros in the system, enter the appropriate hash salt values and click Update macro signatures.

data.name: macros.refreshsecurityparams.refreshalldescription
data.value: (Re-signs all macros based on the current user)

data.name: macros.refreshsecurityparams.refreshalltooltip
data.value: If enabled, the macro re-signing process skips the signature integrity check, so you do not need to enter the old salt value. Check this option to re-sign all macros, including those that are unsigned or have invalid signatures.

data.name: macros.report.description

data.name: macros.report.intro
data.value: Click 'View used macros' to display all macros used within the system.

data.value: Allows you to view frequently used sources of information and tools in one place. You can customize the widgets available on the dashboard.

data.name: MyDesk.CheckedOutDocs.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of pages which have been checked out by the logged-on user. The following properties are shown for each page: its name, type, date and time of check-out and workflow step. You can choose to be redirected to any of the listed page.

data.name: MyDesk.MyBlogs.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage your blogs, including blog posts and blog comments.

data.name: MyDesk.MyDocuments.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of pages which are owned by the logged-on user. The following properties are shown for each page: its name, type, date and time of last modification and workflow step. You can choose to be redirected to any of the listed page.

data.name: MyDesk.MyFriends.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of your friends. You can approve your friends, reject your friends and view your pending requests. You can also add new friends in this section.

data.name: MyDesk.MyMessages.Description
data.value: This section represents the user interface of the Messaging module. The message Inbox and Outbox are both displayed here. You can also create and send new messages. Contact list and Ignore list are displayed here too and you can add or remove users to/from these lists.

data.name: MyDesk.MyProfile.Description
data.value: This section displays the logged-on user details. You can edit your email address, preferred content culture and preferred user interface culture. User name and full name are displayed as well. However, you cannot edit them in this section.

data.name: MyDesk.MyProjects.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of tasks assigned to you, projects assigned to you and tasks owned by you. You can edit your tasks, create new personal tasks and edit projects.

data.name: MyDesk.MyRecycleBin.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of pages which have been deleted from the given site. You can choose to view, restore or destroy any of the pages. The following properties are shown for each page: its name and date and time of last modification.

data.name: MyDesk.OutdatedDocs.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of pages older than specified date. The following properties are shown for each page: its name, type, date and time of last modification and workflow step. You can choose to be redirected to any of the listed page.

data.name: MyDesk.RecentDocs.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of recently modified pages. The following properties are shown for each page: its name, type, date and time of last modification and workflow step. You can choose to be redirected to any of the listed page.

data.name: om.score.ruletype.description
data.value:
Attribute is a static characteristic of a contact. For example, the state or country the contact lives in.
Activity is something that a contact can perform on the site. For example, making a purchase or submitting a form.
Macros can combine multiple conditions that the contact has to fulfil.

data.name: onlinemarketing.abtests.description
data.value: Allows you to optimize pages according to visitor reactions. An original page is tested against one or more of its variants and then evaluated based on the gathered data.

data.name: onlinemarketing.activities.description
data.value: This section allows you to view the on-line marketing activities logged for the website's visitors (contacts). You can also define custom activities.

data.name: onlinemarketing.campaigns.description
data.value: Allows you to manage campaigns and view their results. Use campaigns to monitor the traffic generated by marketing campaigns, such as banners or marketing emails.

data.name: onlinemarketing.configuration.description
data.value: This section allows you to create and manage contact statuses, account statuses, contact roles and on-line marketing macro rules.

data.name: onlinemarketing.contactgroups.description
data.value: Allows you to specify marketing segments for the contacts on your site.

data.name: onlinemarketing.contacts.description
data.value: Allows you to manage contacts, representing the website’s visitors, and segment them into contact groups and accounts. You can also define the contact activities that your website tracks, or monitor the currently on-line users.

data.name: onlinemarketing.conversions.description
data.value: Allows you to manage conversions for specific actions on your website and assign them to campaigns. Conversions are integrated into other applications, such as A/B tests or MVT tests.

data.name: onlinemarketing.dashboard.description
data.value: Allows you to view frequently used sources of information and tools in one place. You can customize the widgets available on the dashboard. This dashboard is intended as an overview for the system's on-line marketing features.

data.name: onlinemarketing.mvttests.description
data.value: Allows you to optimize the components, web parts, web part zones and widgets, on particular pages according to the reactions of visitors. Page's original component variants are tested against component variants with different content.

data.name: onlinemarketing.personas.description
data.value: Allows you to transparently segment your site visitors (contacts) into typical visitor groups. You can then display different content to visitors belonging to different personas.

data.name: onlinemarketing.processes.description
data.value: Allows you to prepare processes that automatically handle your contacts and perform various marketing actions based on the conditions that you define.

data.name: onlinemarketing.scoring.description
data.value: Allows you to create and monitor scores. Use scores to evaluate your site visitors (contacts) based on their attributes and the activities they perform on the site.

data.name: optionselector.help
data.value: None: No values will be offered. List of options: To specify the list of options, you have three possibilities: a) Type one value on one line. For example: GLaDOS Holly b) Type values in the form value;name on each line. Value will be stored in the database and name will be displayed in the list. For example: 1;GLaDOS 2;Holly c) Type values in the form value;name;macro expression (used as a visibility condition). For example: 1;GLaDOS;{%CurrentUser.UserName=="administrator"%} 2;Holly; Macro expressions may be used in value and text parts too. Please, use 'listitem' resolver name to ensure the macros are resolved right before they are added into a list collection. Macro expression: Enter a data macro expression (without macro brackets). The result of the expression should be an enumerable object whose items will be used to fill the list. For example: CurrentUser.PurchasedProducts.DisplayNames SQL query: Enter a SELECT query, which returns values and text fields. For example: Select UserID, UserName From CMS_User

data.name: separationDB.deleteolddbhelp
data.value: The separated contact management database was successfully joined with the main database and will no longer be needed. To delete the separated database, tick the box. Otherwise, the system only deletes the Kentico tables from the database.

data.value: Disable scheduled tasks in order to start the database separation, please. They will be automatically enabled after the separation process is over.

data.name: separationDB.errorCMexists
data.value: Selected database already contains Contact management tables. Please select different database or create new one.

data.name: separationDB.ErrorDBExists
data.value: Database with given name already exists.

data.name: separationDB.errorLinkedServer
data.value: Creating link between SQL Servers failed. Please make sure that SQL Server enables remote connections, that specified login has appropriate permissions and that SQL connections are not blocked.

data.name: separationDB.errorWinAuth
data.value: Database separation is not possible for SQL connections using Windows Authentication.

data.name: separationDB.joindescription
data.value:
Current database status: two databases; main database and contact management database

Click "Join contact management DB with main DB" button to merge second database with Contact management data into the main database.

All tables and database objects related to Contact management will be moved to the main database. It is strongly recommended to backup your database beforehand. Please note that your web site will be inaccessible during the join process. All scheduled tasks will be disabled during the join process.

data.name: separationDB.joinerror
data.value: It is not possible to proceed in database join. You need to separate database first.

data.name: separationDB.joinready
data.value: Database join is ready to proceed.

data.name: separationDB.launchjoin
data.value: Join contact management DB with main DB

data.name: separationDB.manualcopy
data.value: Separation process created structure of contact management tables on the second database only. If you wish to move content of tables as well, you need to do it manually due to SQL Azure limitations. Please export data from following tables in the specified order:

data.name: separationDB.permissioncreate
data.value: SQL user isn't granted 'CREATE ANY DATABASE' permission.

data.name: separationDB.permissionmodify
data.value: SQL user isn't granted 'CONTROL SERVER' permission.

data.name: separationDB.processalreadystarted
data.value: The process was already started in different browser or by another user.

data.name: separationDB.removeConnectionStringError
data.value: The process couldn't update the web.config file on your server. This may be caused by limited file system permissions. Please open your web.config file manually in Notepad and remove following line inside the <connectionStrings></connectionStrings> section:

data.name: separationDB.removeConnectionStringErrorAzure
data.value:
The process couldn't remove the database connection string in any of your configurations files. You can manually remove following connection string in your web.config and smart search worker role app.config file, or from the application settings connection string in the service configuration file. Choose the option that suits your project. If you are using Windows Azure emulator you will have to stop and restart the debugger afterwards.

Connection string for your web.config and app.config file:

{0}

Connection string for your ServiceConfiguration.Cloud.cscfg file:

{1}

data.name: separationDB.separatedescription
data.value:
Current database status: one database

Click "Separate contact management database" button to create second database with Contact management data.

All tables and database objects related to Contact management will be moved to the second database. It is strongly recommended to backup your database beforehand. Please note that your web site will be inaccessible during the separation process. All scheduled tasks will be disabled during the separation process.

data.name: separationDB.separationerror
data.value: It is not possible to proceed in database separation. You need join database first.

data.name: separationDB.server
data.value: SQL Server for Contact management data

data.name: separationdb.startsites
data.value: Separation process failed to take the web sites back on-line and to start the scheduled tasks. Please, do it manually.

data.value: Scheduled tasks must be stopped and disabled in order to start the separation process. These tasks will be automatically enabled after the process is over.

data.name: separationDB.stoptaskserrorjoin
data.value: Scheduled tasks must be stopped and disabled in order to start the joining process. These tasks will be automatically enabled after the process is over.

data.value: Current site '{0}' does not inherit this global value, changing this setting won't change current site behavior.

data.name: settings.group.nokeysfound
data.value: There are no settings in this group.

data.name: settings.keys.globalsettingsnote
data.value: These settings are global, they can be overridden by individual website settings. Please select a site to see or change the site settings.

data.name: settingscategory.cmsdebughandlers.description
data.value: Enables event handlers debugging and the Event handlers tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingscategory.cmsdebughandlersloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the event handlers debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Event handlers tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingscategory.cmsintegrationsalesforceleadreplication
data.value: Replication of contacts into Salesforce leads

data.name: settingscategory.cmsloghandlers.description
data.value: If enabled, event handlers debug log is saved into the logHandlers.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require event handlers debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingscategory.cmsonlinemarketinggeomapping
data.value: Geolocation data to contact fields mapping

data.name: settingscategory.disablededitting
data.value: This settings group belongs to the module '{0}', you cannot edit it from this module.

data.name: settingsedit.settingskey_edit.errorcodename
data.value: Please enter code name in identifier format without spaces and special characters.

data.name: settingsedit.settingskey_edit.errordelete
data.value: The key could not be removed.

data.name: settingskey.bitlyapikey.description
data.value: Your bitly API key. It can be found under your account's settings. You must provide this information in order to use this service.

data.name: settingskey.bitlylogin.description
data.value: Your Bitly account username. All shortened links will be associated with this account. You must provide this information in order to use this service.

data.name: settingskey.cms51degreesmobilicense.description
data.value: Use these settings to register your 51degrees.mobi licence into Kentico and leverage the mobile device data that this service offers.

data.name: settingskey.cmsabtestingenabled.description
data.value: Indicates whether A/B testing module is enabled

data.name: settingskey.cmsaccessdeniedpageurl.description
data.value: URL of the page that should be displayed when the user is not allowed to read the page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsforblogcommentpost
data.value: Activity points for blog comment post

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsforblogcommentpost.description
data.value: Number of points which are given to user for blog comment post.

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsforblogpost.description
data.value: Number of points which are given to user for blog post.

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsforforumpost.description
data.value: Number of points which are given to user for forum post.

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsformessageboardpost
data.value: Activity points for message board post

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitypointsformessageboardpost.description
data.value: Number of activity points which are given to user for a message board post.

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitytrackedextensions
data.value: Track file downloads (cms.file) for these extensions

data.name: settingskey.cmsactivitytrackedextensions.description
data.value: File types (extensions) that will be tracked as activity (separated by semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, all types of files will be tracked.

data.name: settingskey.cmsadminemailaddress.description
data.value: Administrator email address. This email address is used as a default administrator's address in modules where email cannot be specified through UI or web part properties (such as on the user account confirmation page).

data.name: settingskey.CMSAllowAttachmentTranslation.description
data.value: If true, page attachments can be included to translations submitted to the translation services.

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowcomponentscss.description
data.value: If checked, the CSS styles for components (e.g. web part containers) are automatically linked to the page. Otherwise, you need to include them to the main stylesheet through macros.

data.name: settingskey.CMSAllowedHTML5MediaExtensions
data.value: Media extensions to be rendered with HTML5

data.name: settingskey.CMSAllowedHTML5MediaExtensions.description
data.value: Specifies a list of media extensions to be rendered with HTML5 media tags. Enter a list of extensions separated by a semicolon, e.g. .mp4;.ogg".

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowedurlcharacters.description
data.value:
Regular expression which limits usable characters in URL.
Example: Value 'a-zA-Z0-9' (without quotes) limits URL only for alphanumeric characters.

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowglobalcategories.description
data.value: Indicates if global categories are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.CMSAllowGZip.description
data.value: Enables compression for the HTML output code of all pages rendered by Kentico. Browsers that do not support compression always download uncompressed page output.

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowpermanentpreviewlink.description
data.value: Indicates if page preview links remain usable even if page workflow cycle is restarted (when pages in Published/Archived workflow step are switched to the Edit step).

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowurlswithoutlanguageprefixes.description
data.value: Indicates whether URLs without language prefix should be allowed. This setting is usable only if 'Use language prefix for URLs' is set to true.

data.name: settingskey.cmsallowwireframing.description
data.value: If enabled, it will be possible to create and edit wireframe schematics in the ##ui|cms.content|content## interface. This provides a way to easily plan out the structure, design and functionality of the website's pages directly in the content tree.

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsenabled.description
data.value: If true, web analytics module logs the events

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsexcludedfileextensions.description
data.value: List of the file extensions excluded from logging by the analytics module, separated by semicolon (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsexcludedips.description
data.value: List of the IP addresses excluded from the logging by the analytics module, separated by semicolon (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsexcludedurls.description
data.value: List of the URLs excluded from the logging by the analytics module, separated by semicolon. All child URLs are also excluded.

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsexcludesearchengines.description
data.value: If enabled, hits generated by search engine robots will not be included in tracking statistics.

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticstrackaggregatedviews.description
data.value: Enables aggregated views tracking. (Aggregated views are views of pages from feed readers.)

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticstrackvisits.description
data.value: Indicates if site visits should be tracked. A single visit includes any number of page views or other actions performed by a specific user during one session.

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsvisitoridletime.description
data.value: Determines how long (in minutes) a visitor must be inactive before the system logs their visit, browser and country on the website again. Note that browser and country logging has to be allowed seperately.

data.name: settingskey.cmsanalyticsvisitorssmartcheck.description
data.value: If the entered value is higher than 0, the IP addresses of the website's visitors will be stored in the memory for the specified number of minutes.

data.name: settingskey.cmsapplicationhealthmonitoringinterval.description
data.value: Time interval (in seconds). In this periodical interval, the application reads monitored values and writes them to performance counters. Setting 0 stops monitoring of counters.

data.name: settingskey.cmsapplicationid.description
data.value: Identifier of your application, which you get when registering application at Windows Live Site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsapplicationsecret.description
data.value: This secret code will be used to encrypt all information between your site and Windows Live servers.

data.name: settingskey.cmsarchiveemails.description
data.value: If greater than 0, sent emails are archived in queue for specified number of days.

data.name: settingskey.cmsauthorizenetapilogin.description
data.value: Allows to set the API login ID for the payment gateway account.

data.name: settingskey.cmsauthorizenettestmode.description
data.value: Gateway behavior depends on test mode settings both in the administration interface (##ui|cms|settings##) and in the Authorize.NET Merchant Interface. Test mode configuration in the CMS administration interface and in the Authorize.NET Merchant Interface resulting in the transaction being processed as a test transaction: ON/ON, OFF/ON, ON/OFF. Test mode configuration resulting in the transaction being processed as a live transaction: OFF/OFF.

data.name: settingskey.cmsauthorizenettransactionkey.description
data.value: The transaction key obtained from the merchant interface.

data.name: settingskey.cmsautocompleteenableforlogin.description
data.value: If true Autocomplete for user name text box in login form is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsautomaticallysigninuser
data.value: Automatically sign-in user when site changes

data.name: settingskey.cmsautomaticallysigninuser.description
data.value: Indicates if the user is automatically authenticated when the site is changed in the administration.

data.name: settingskey.cmsautoresizeimageheight.description
data.value: The system automatically reduces the height of uploaded images to the specified value (in pixels).

data.name: settingskey.cmsautoresizeimagemaxsidesize
data.value: Automatic image resize on upload (max side size)

data.name: settingskey.cmsautoresizeimagemaxsidesize.description
data.value: The system automatically reduces the size of uploaded images to the specified value (in pixels). If the image's larger dimension is greater than the value, the given dimension is reduced. Aspect ratio is preserved and the width and height settings are not applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsautoresizeimagewidth.description
data.value: The system automatically reduces the width of uploaded images to the specified value (in pixels).

data.name: settingskey.cmsavatarmaxsidesize.description
data.value: Specifies maximal width or height of user avatar.

data.name: settingskey.cmsavatartype.description
data.value: Determines what kind of user avatars will be usable on the website.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbadwordsaction.description
data.value: Default action which will be performed during bad words check.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbadwordsreplacement.description
data.value: Default replacement text which will be used during bad word check.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbannedipenabled.description
data.value: Enables or disables banned IP module.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbannedipredirecturl.description
data.value: If the IP address is banned the user is redirected to this page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbizformfilesfolder.description
data.value: Physical path to the folder where uploaded Form files should be stored.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblocksubscribersglobally.description
data.value: If enabled and a subscriber is blocked then all subscribers with the same email address throughout the sites are blocked as well.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogenableoptin
data.value: Enable double opt-in for blog post comments

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogenableoptin.description
data.value: Indicates if double opt-in should be enabled for blog post comments. When enabled, users are required to confirm their subscription by clicking a link that is sent to them in an email.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogenableoptinconfirmation.description
data.value: Indicates if double opt-in confirmation should be sent to user after they approve the subscription.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogoptinapprovalpath.description
data.value: Path to the page that contains the Blog post subscription confirmation web part. The subscription confirmation link that will be sent to users will point to this page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogoptininterval.description
data.value: Interval in hours in which user has to confirm his request.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogsunsubscriptionurl.description
data.value: The default unsubscription URL for all the blogs.

data.name: settingskey.cmsblogsuseexternalservice.description
data.value: Indicates if the external Scheduler Windows service should be used to process scheduled tasks which handle trackbacks.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardbaseurl.description
data.value: Specifies the global board base URL which can be inherited by board. This URL is used for emails and board viewers.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardenableoptinconfirmation.description
data.value: Indicates if an email confirmation should be sent to user after they approve a subscription. If double opt-in is disabled, these confirmation emails are always sent.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardoptinapprovalpath.description
data.value: Path to the page that contains the Forum subscription confirmation web part. The subscription confirmation link that will be sent to users will point to this page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardoptininterval.description
data.value: Amount of time in hours, during which a user has to confirm their subscription request.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardsenableoptin
data.value: Enable double opt-in for message boards

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardsenableoptin.description
data.value:
Indicates if double opt-in should be enabled for message boards. When enabled, users are required to confirm their subscription by clicking a link that is sent to them in an email.
You can override this setting in the properties of a particular forum group or a forum.

data.name: settingskey.cmsboardunsubsriptionurl.description
data.value: The default unsubscription URL for all the boards. Applied when board specific URL isn't specified.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbouncedemailaddress.description
data.value: Specifies the address where bounced emails are sent when delivery fails.

data.name: settingskey.cmsbouncedemailslimit.description
data.value: When the number of subscriber's bounced emails reaches this number the subscriber is blocked.

data.name: settingskey.cmscacheimages.description
data.value: Number of minutes for which the application caches images and other files on the server. The system always caches files for at least 1 minute to protect from brute force attacks.

data.name: settingskey.cmscacheminutes.description
data.value: Number of minutes the content should be cached for.

data.name: settingskey.cmscachepageinfo.description
data.value: Number of minutes the page information should be cached for.

data.name: settingskey.cmscampaigntrackingparameter.description
data.value: URL parameter name to identify the campaign.

data.name: settingskey.cmscaptcha.description
data.value:
The default CAPTCHA control that should be used for CAPTCHA verification throughout the system - in web parts and for the Security code form control. The following four types of controls are available: Logic CAPTCHA - requires answering a logical question . Simple CAPTCHA - requires re-typing of a string displayed in an image . Text CAPTCHA - requires re-typing of a string into multiple fields. reCAPTCHA - requires re-typing of two words from which one is checked for correctness.
The behavior of these form controls throughout the system can be changed by modifying the settings of the individual controls.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatallowanonymglobally.description
data.value: Indicates if users can enter chat without being logged in on the website.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdaysneededtodeleterecods.description
data.value:
Messages, rooms and chat users will be deleted after the number of days specified in this setting.
Records will be deleted acording to these rules:
All messages written earlier than the time specified will be deleted.
All rooms will be deleted, which don't have any messages in them, no one has access to them and were created earlier than the time specified.
All users will be deleted, who are anonymous, have not written any message and haven't been on-line for the specified time.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplayannouncementatfirstload.description
data.value:
Announcement is a message written from the administration interface (Chat -> Chat room -> Messages -> New announcement).
If checked, Announcements will be displayed when user enters a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplaychangenicknameatfirstload.description
data.value: If checked system messages of this type will be displayed when user enters a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplayenteratfirstload.description
data.value: If checked system messages of this type will be displayed when user enters a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplayinvitedatfirstload.description
data.value: If enabled system will display messages when users invite other users to chat room in that room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplaykickatfirstload.description
data.value: If checked, system messages of this type will be displayed when user enters a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplayleaveatfirstload.description
data.value: If checked system messages of this type will be displayed when user enters a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatdisplaysupportgreetingatfirstload.description
data.value: Indicates if automatic greting support message will be displayed to user when he enters support chat.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatenablebbcode.description
data.value:
Indicates if BBCode tags will be allowed and resolved in chat messages. This setting affects the Room messages web part (resolving) and the Send message web part (inserting BBCode tags).
If BBCode is enabled globally, you can still disable it for a specific web part in its settings.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatenablefloodprotection.description
data.value: Enables flood protection according to other settings in this section.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatenablesmileys.description
data.value: Indicates if emoticons will be converted to images in messages.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatenablesoundlivechat.description
data.value: Enable sound notification of a new message in opened one on one conversation.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatenablesoundsupportchat.description
data.value: Enable sound notification of a new support request and a new message in support chat.

data.name: settingskey.cmschaterrordeletealltrans.description
data.value: Transformation that will be used to display the Close all button.

data.name: settingskey.cmschaterrortrans.description
data.value: Transformation that will be used for displaying errors.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfirstloadmessagescount
data.value: Number of messages displayed after entering room

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfirstloadmessagescount.description
data.value: Indicates how many messages will be displayed when a user enters a chat room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfloodprotectionchangenickname.description
data.value: Number of seconds which have to pass between two nickname changes made by one chat user.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfloodprotectioncreateroom.description
data.value: Number of seconds which have to pass between two subsequent room creatings by one chat user.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfloodprotectionjoinroom.description
data.value: Number of seconds which have to pass between two subsequent room joinings made by one chat user.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatfloodprotectionpostmessage.description
data.value: Number of seconds which have to pass between two messages posted by one chat user.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatforceanonymuniquenicknames
data.value: Force unique nicknames for anonymous users

data.name: settingskey.cmschatforceanonymuniquenicknames.description
data.value:
If checked, nicknames of anonymous users on chat will have to be unique.
Nicknames of registered users always have to be unique.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatglobalpinginterval.description
data.value:
Defines how often global chat web parts will update their content (on-line users, available rooms and notifications).
The ping interval is the time in seconds between requests for new data to the server.
If you are experiencing performance issues with chat, consider setting this number to a higher value.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatguestprefix.description
data.value: Text that will be appended with a number and used as the user name for anonymous users.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatinitiatedchattrans.description
data.value: Transformation for displaying chat bubble, which informs site visitors that a support person wants to initiate chat with them.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatkicklastingtime.description
data.value: Defines how long a kicked user will not be able to join the room they were kicked from.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatmaximummessagelength.description
data.value: Maximum number of characters in a message.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatnotificationtrans.description
data.value: Transformation used for displaying notification messages.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturljoin
data.value: Default redirection path - join room action

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturljoin.description
data.value: When this setting has a value, users will be redirected to the given path after they join a chat room. Specified web part setting will override this global setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturlleave
data.value: Default redirection path - leave room action

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturlleave.description
data.value: When this setting has a value, users will be redirected to the given path after they leave a chat room. Specified web part setting will override this global setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturllogin
data.value: Default redirection path - enter chat action

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturllogin.description
data.value: When this setting has a value, users will be redirected to the given path after they enter chat. Specified web part setting will override this global setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturllogout
data.value: Default redirection path - leave chat action

data.name: settingskey.cmschatredirecturllogout.description
data.value: When this setting has a value, users will be redirected to the given path after they leave chat. Specified web part setting will override this global setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatresolveurlenabled
data.value: Convert URLs to HTML anchors in messages

data.name: settingskey.cmschatresolveurlenabled.description
data.value: If checked, URLs in messages will be converted to clickable HTML anchors.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroommessagetrans.description
data.value: Transformation that will be applied to messages in a normal (not one-on-one chat) room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroomnametrans.description
data.value: Transformation for displaying chat room name in the room title.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroompinginterval.description
data.value:
Defines how often room related web parts will update their content (messages, users in the room, etc.).
The ping interval is the time in seconds between two requests to the server.
If you are experiencing performance issues with chat, consider setting this number to a higher value.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroompopupwindow.description
data.value: URL of the window that is opened as a chat room pop-up (for support chat or one-on-one chat).

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroomtrans.description
data.value: Transformation to be used for displaying rooms in their list.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatroomusertrans.description
data.value: Transformation for displaying users present in a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsendsupportmessagesto
data.value: Send support messages to this email address

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsendsupportmessagesto.description
data.value: Messages sent in support chat when no support person is on-line will be sent to this email address. When not set, users will not be able to use support chat unless any support person is on-line.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupportenabled.description
data.value: Indicates if support chat is enabled in the administration interface

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupportengineerlogouttimeout
data.value: Log out support engineer when inactive for more than (seconds)

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupportengineerlogouttimeout.description
data.value: Defines how long a support person can be inactive, i.e. not send any request to the server, before the system logs them out. This can happen if the support person's internet connection has gone down or they have closed the chat window.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupportrequesttrans.description
data.value: Transformation name for the element that allows to initiate on-line support.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupporttakenroomreleasetimeout
data.value: Release room taken by support when not pinging for more than (seconds)

data.name: settingskey.cmschatsupporttakenroomreleasetimeout.description
data.value: Time of inactivity before releasing a room taken by a support person. After this period, the room will appear as available to other supporters.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatuserlogouttimeout
data.value: Log out user when inactive for more than (seconds)

data.name: settingskey.cmschatuserlogouttimeout.description
data.value: Defines how long a chat user can be inactive, i.e. not send any request to the server, before the system logs them out. This can happen if the user's internet connection has gone down or they have closed the chat window.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultgrouppagesby.description
data.value: Number of pages displayed in one group when paging is enabled. Value 0 (zero) means pages won't be grouped. Affects on-line users, users in rooms, user search results, and rooms. This setting can be overridden by a web part's setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultinvitemodepagingitems.description
data.value: Defines how many users will be displayed on one page when inviting a user to a room.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultinvitemodesearchmode.description
data.value: If enabled, the Search on-line users web part will be used when inviting a user to a room. Otherwise, the On-line users web part will be used. This setting can be overridden by a web part setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultpagingitems.description
data.value: Number of items displayed on one page when paging is enabled. Affects on-line users, users in rooms, user search results, and rooms. This setting can be overridden by a web part's setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultsearchonlinemaxusers
data.value: Search on-line users - maximum users in response

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultsearchonlinemaxusers.description
data.value: Defines how many users can be returned as a response to a search query when the Search on-line users web part's search mode is activated. If this setting is set to 0, the response will not be limited.

data.name: settingskey.cmschatwpdefaultshowfilterlimit.description
data.value:
Filter will be shown when there is at least the specified number of items displayed by a web part.
This setting can be overwritten by a specific web part's setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckbadwords.description
data.value: Determines whether bad word check should be performed.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckdocumentpermissions.description
data.value:
If enabled, only pages for which the current user has the "Read" permission are displayed in the content tree (both on in ##ui|cms.content|content##, in page listings and in various dialogs where the content tree is displayed).
In case that a user doesn't have the "Read" permissions for any page at all, the root of the content tree is still displayed to them. If a user has the "Read" permission for a child page but not for its parent, the child page is not displayed.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckfilespermissions.description
data.value: If checked, page permissions are applied to the files.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckmediafilepermissions.description
data.value: If checked, "See media library content" permission is checked when retrieving media files using permanent URL.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckpagepermissions.description
data.value: Check page permissions according to the user access permissions in the defined section of the website.

data.name: settingskey.cmscheckpublishedfiles.description
data.value: If checked, only files from published pages can be accessed from the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsclientcacheminutes.description
data.value: Sets the number of minutes for which client browsers are allowed to cache files. Client file caching includes images, and web resources such as CSS stylesheets and JavaScript files.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmabusereport.description
data.value: Enables logging of abuse report activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmactivitiesenabled.description
data.value: Enables logging of all activities. Please note that on-line marketing must be also enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmaddingproducttosc
