data.value: Adding a product to shopping cart

data.name: settingskey.cmscmaddingproducttosc.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when product is added to shopping cart.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmaddingproducttowl.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when product is added to wish list.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmbizformsubmission.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after submitting on-line form.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmblogpostcomments.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after visitor adds new comment to blog post.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmblogpostsubscription.description
data.value: Enables logging of blog post subscription.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmchatacceptautomaticallyinitiatedchat.description
data.value: Enables logging activities when user accepts automatically initiated chat request.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmchatacceptinitiatedchat.description
data.value: Enables logging activities when user accepts initiated chat request.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmchatrequestsupport.description
data.value: If true, activity will be logged when user requests support.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmchatrequestsupportofflineform.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when user request support using chat support offline form (when there are no online supporters).

data.name: settingskey.cmscmclickthroughtracking.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when users click a particular hyperlink in email.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmcontentrating.description
data.value: Enables logging of content rating activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmcustomerregistration.description
data.value: Enables logging of customer registration activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmcustomtableform.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after submitting custom table form.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmemailopening.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after campaign email has been opened.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmeventbooking.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when attendee subscribes to an event.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmexternalsearch.description
data.value: Enables logging of external search activity (i.e. visitor uses external search engine that leads to the web site).

data.name: settingskey.cmscmforumposts.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after visitor adds new forum post.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmforumpostsubscription.description
data.value: Enables logging of forum post subscription.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmglobalaccounts.description
data.value: Indicates if global accounts should be available on site.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmglobalconfiguration.description
data.value: Indicates if global configuration should be available on site.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmglobalcontactgroups.description
data.value: Indicates if global contact groups should be available on site.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmglobalcontacts.description
data.value: Indicates if global contacts should be available on site.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmjoiningagroup.description
data.value: Enables logging of joining the group activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmlandingpage.description
data.value: Enables logging of landing page activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmleavingagroup.description
data.value: Enables logging of leaving the group activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmmessageboardposts.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after visitor adds new post.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmmessageboardsubscription.description
data.value: Enables logging of message board subscription.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmnewslettersubscribe.description
data.value: Enables logging of newsletter subscription activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmnewsletterunsubscribe.description
data.value: Enables logging of newsletter unsubscription activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmpagevisits.description
data.value: Enables logging of page visit activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmpollvoting.description
data.value: Enables logging activity after user votes in a poll.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmpurchasedproduct.description
data.value: Enables logging of purchased items individually.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmremovingproductfromsc
data.value: Removing a product from shopping cart

data.name: settingskey.cmscmremovingproductfromsc.description
data.value: Enables logging activity when product is removed from shopping cart.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmsearch.description
data.value: Enables logging of internal search activity (user uses standard search web part).

data.name: settingskey.cmscmstamp.description
data.value: Customizable stamp which will be used in accounts or contact notes.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmuserlogin.description
data.value: Enables logging of user login activity.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmuserregistration.description
data.value: Enables logging of user registration event.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmwikicontributiondelete.description
data.value: Enables activity logging when a user deletes a page as a user contribution.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmwikicontributioninsert.description
data.value: Enables activity logging when a user creates a new page as a user contribution.

data.name: settingskey.cmscmwikicontributionupdate.description
data.value: Enables activity logging when user changes an existing page as a contribution.

data.name: settingskey.cmscombinecomponentscss.description
data.value: If checked, the CSS styles from components are combined to a single request.

data.name: settingskey.cmscombineimageswithdefaultculture.description
data.value: Indicates if default culture version of the file should be used when the page is not translated.

data.name: settingskey.cmscombinewithdefaultculture.description
data.value: Indicates if default culture version of the page should be used when the page is not translated.

data.name: settingskey.cmsconfirmchanges
data.value: Prompt to save changes on exit

data.name: settingskey.cmsconfirmchanges.description
data.value: Notifies the user that she hasn't saved the changes when the user tries to leave the page in the editing mode.

data.name: settingskey.cmscontactforvisitor
data.value: When a visitor has more contacts, use

data.name: settingskey.cmscontactforvisitor.description
data.value: Determines what contact will be selected for a visitor which has multiple contacts assigned.

data.name: settingskey.cmscontentimagewatermark.description
data.value: If checked, the watermark is used for page attachments.

data.name: settingskey.cmscontentpersonalizationenabled.description
data.value: Indicates whether content personalization feature is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmscontrolelement.description
data.value: Specifies element that should be used instead of standard <span> element.

data.name: settingskey.cmsconverttablestodivs
data.value: Convert TABLE tags to DIV tags

data.name: settingskey.cmsconverttablestodivs.description
data.value: Determines how the output filter converts TABLE tags to DIV elements. The output filter automatically assigns a CSS class to the replacement DIVs according to the name of the original tag (table, tr, td). Table conversions can either be disabled completely, enabled for all tables except for those market by the _nodivs CSS class, or enabled only for tables designated through the _divs class.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdatacomcompanymapping.description
data.value: Mapping of Data.com company fields to Kentico account fields.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdatacomcontactmapping.description
data.value: Mapping of Data.com contact fields to Kentico contact fields.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdatacompassword.description
data.value: Data.com user account password. You need a Data.com user account to be able to buy contacts.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdatacomtoken.description
data.value: As a member of Data.com developer program you receive an access token which enables your organization to use the Data.com API. More information is available at http://developer.jigsaw.com.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdatacomusername.description
data.value: Data.com user account login. You need a Data.com user account to be able to buy contacts. The registration is available at http://www.jigsaw.com.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdbobjectowner.description
data.value: Name of the schema which is used for all newly created database objects by the current database user (e.g. for new database table of the page type). If not specified, database user's default schema is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallcaches
data.value: Debug cache access of UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallcaches.description
data.value: If enabled, access to data cached for pages of the administration interface will also be included in the cache access debug. This option requires cache access debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallfiles
data.value: Debug IO operations of UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallfiles.description
data.value: If enabled, IO operations called by pages of the administration interface will also be included in the IO operation debug. This option requires IO operation debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallforeverything
data.value: Include UI pages in all debugs

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallforeverything.description
data.value: If enabled, actions performed on UI pages are included in all debugs. This only applies to debugs that are already enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallhandlers.description
data.value: If enabled, event handlers raised by pages of the administration interface will also be included in the event handlers debug. This option requires event handlers debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallmacros
data.value: Debug macros resolved on UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallmacros.description
data.value: If enabled, macros resolved on pages of the administration interface will also be included in the macro debug. This option requires macro debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugalloutput.description
data.value: If enabled, output of administration interface pages will also be included in the output debug. This option requires output debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallrequests.description
data.value: If enabled, administration interface page requests will also be included in the macro debug. This option requires request debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallsecurity
data.value: Debug security operations of UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallsecurity.description
data.value: If enabled, security checks performed by pages of the administration interface will also be included in the security debug. This option requires security debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallsqlqueries
data.value: Debug SQL queries of UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallsqlqueries.description
data.value: If enabled, SQL queries called by pages of the administration interface will also be included in the SQL query debug. This option requires SQL query debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallviewstates.description
data.value: If enabled, ViewState of administration interface pages will also be included in the ViewState debug. This option requires ViewState debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallwebfarm
data.value: Debug web farm operations of UI pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugallwebfarm.description
data.value: If enabled, operations performed via the administration interface will also be included in the web farm debug. This option requires web farm debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebuganalytics.description
data.value: Enables web analytics debugging and the Analytics tab in ##ui|cms|debug## .

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebuganalyticslive
data.value: Display web analytics debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebuganalyticslive.description
data.value: If enabled, web analytics debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each page on the live site. Requires web analytics debugging to be enabled. Debugging on the live site is only available if your site does NOT use JavaScript logging for web analytics ('On-line marketing -> Web analytics -> Log via JavaScript snippet' setting).

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebuganalyticsloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the web analytics debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Analytics tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebuganalyticsstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging web analytics and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the loganalytics.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugcache.description
data.value: Enables cache access debugging and the Cache access tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugcachelive
data.value: Display cache access debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugcachelive.description
data.value: If enabled, cache access debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires cache access debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugcacheloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the cache access debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Cache access tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugcachestack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging cache access and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logcache.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugeverything.description
data.value: Enables all debugs and ensures that the corresponding tabs are displayed in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.CMSDebugEverythingEverywhere.description
data.value: Enables all debugs, includes UI pages in all debugs and ensures that the debugs are displayed both in the ##ui|cms|debug## interface and on the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugeverythinglive
data.value: Display all debugs on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugeverythinglive.description
data.value: If enabled, debug information of all debug types is displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This only applies to debugs that are already enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugeverythingloglength.description
data.value: Sets the default maximum length of all debugs on the respective tabs in ##ui|cms|debug## . This value is used if no log length is configured for the respective type of debug.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugfiles.description
data.value: Enables IO operation debugging and the IO tab in ##ui|cms|debug## .

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugfileslive
data.value: Display IO operation debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugfileslive.description
data.value: If enabled, IO operation debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires IO operation debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugfilesloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the IO operation debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> IO tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugfilesstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging IO operations and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logfiles.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebughandlerslive
data.value: Display handlers debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebughandlerslive.description
data.value: If enabled, event handlers debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires event handlers debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebughandlersstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging event handlers and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logHandlers.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugimportexport.description
data.value: If disabled, debug information is not logged for the Import/Export user interface. To optimize system performance, it is recommended to have this option disabled unless you really need to debug the Import/Export process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugmacros.description
data.value: Enables macro debugging and the Macros tab in ##ui|cms|debug## .

data.name: settingskey.CMSDebugMacrosDetailed.Description
data.value: If true, more detailed information is logged into the Macro debug section while evaluating macros.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugmacroslive
data.value: Display macro debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugmacroslive.description
data.value: If enabled, macro debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires macro debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugmacrosloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the macro debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Macros tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugmacrosstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging cache macros and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logmacros.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugoutput.description
data.value: Enables page output debugging and the Output tab in ##ui|cms|debug## .

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugoutputloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the output debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Output tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugrequests.description
data.value: Enables request debugging and the Requests tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugrequestslive
data.value: Display request debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugrequestslive.description
data.value: If enabled, request debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires request debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugrequestsloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the request debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Requests tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugrequestsstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging requests and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logRequests.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugresources.description
data.value: If false, all resource requests (GetResource and GetCSS) are ignored by all debugs.

data.name: settingskey.CMSDebugScheduler.description
data.value: If false, all the scheduler operations are excluded from debugs.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsecurity.description
data.value: Enables security operation debugging and the Security tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsecuritylive
data.value: Display security debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsecuritylive.description
data.value: If enabled, security operation debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires security debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsecurityloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the security debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Security tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsecuritystack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging security and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logSecurity.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlconnections.description
data.value: If enabled, SQL connection operations (new, open, close) are logged in the SQL query debug log.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlqueries.description
data.value: Enables SQL query debugging and the SQL queries tab in ##ui|cms|debug## .

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlquerieslive
data.value: Display SQL query debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlquerieslive.description
data.value: If enabled, SQL query debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires SQL query debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlqueriesloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the SQL query debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> SQL queries tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugsqlqueriesstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging SQL queries and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logsql.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugstackforeverything
data.value: Display stack information in every debug

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugstackforeverything.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked by all debugs and is displayed in the Context column on the respective tabs in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugviewstate.description
data.value: Enables ViewState debugging and the Page ViewState tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugviewstatelive
data.value: Display ViewState debug on live site

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugviewstatelive.description
data.value: If enabled, ViewState debug information is also displayed at the bottom of each live site page. This option requires ViewState debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugviewstateloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the ViewState debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> ViewState tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugwebfarm.description
data.value: Enables request debugging and the Web farm tab in ##ui|cms|debug##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugwebfarmloglength.description
data.value: Sets the maximum length of the web farm debug log on the ##ui|cms|debug## -> Requests tab, i.e. the number of requests for which debug information is preserved and displayed on the tab. If empty, value of the Default log length setting (or the CMSDebugEverythingLogLength key) is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdebugwebfarmstack.description
data.value: If enabled, stack is tracked when debugging web farm operations and is displayed in the Context column. This information is only available in the debugging UI and on the live site, not in the debug log written into the logwebfarm.log file.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultaliaspath.description
data.value: Alias path of the default page.

data.name: settingskey.CMSDefaultControl.description
data.value: Sets the form control that will be offered as the default option for the given data type in the field editor.

data.name: settingskey.CMSDefaultControlForDateTime
data.value: Default control for date and time

data.name: settingskey.CMSDefaultControlForLongIntegerNumber
data.value: Default control for long integer number

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultculturecode.description
data.value: Culture code of the default content culture.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultdeletednodepath.description
data.value: The entered path will be loaded as the default value of the 'Replacement page' field if the option of specifying an alternate page is selected when deleting a page in administration.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultproductimageurl.description
data.value: The default product image URL (virtual path). This image is used if no image is specified for a given product.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultreportconnectionstring.description
data.value: Sets the database connection string that the system assigns to new reports. Existing reports may also inherit the connection string value from this setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaulturlpathprefix.description
data.value: Defines a default URL path prefix that will be used for all URLs of the content pages. This prefix is rewritten to urlpathprefix query string parameter.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdefaultuserid.description
data.value: Default user ID that is used when no current user is defined

data.name: settingskey.cmsdeleteinactivecontacts.description
data.value: Indicates if old contacts can be deleted automatically using a scheduled task.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdeletenonactivateduserafter.description
data.value: Deletes all users who weren't activated during given number of days.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdenylogininterval.description
data.value: Interval (in minutes) which have to pass between time when was user kicked and time when he can log in again.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdepartmenttemplatepath.description
data.value: Alias path of a page that will be used, together with the pages stored under it, as a template for newly created departments.

data.name: SettingsKey.CMSDeviceProfilesEnable.Description
data.value: Indicates whether device profiles support is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSDisableDebug.description
data.value: Globally disables all debugging features, regardless of individual debug settings.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplayaccountlockinformation.description
data.value: Indicates if user friendly information about account lock should be displayed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplayarchivedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "archived" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to archived pages.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaycheckedouticon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "checked out" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to checked-out pages.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaylinkedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "linked" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to linked pages.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaynotpublishedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "not published" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that have not yet been published (and also have no previously published version). By enabling this option, the "Scheduled to be published" icon is enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaynottranslatedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "not translated" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that are not translated to the current culture.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaypublishedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "published" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that are currently published. By enabling this option, the "Scheduled to be published" and "Version scheduled to be published" icons are enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplayredirectedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "redirected" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that have redirection configured in Properties -> Navigation -> URL redirection.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplayversionnotpublishedicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "version not published" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that already have a published version, but whose current version is not published yet. By enabling this option, the "Version scheduled to be published" icon is enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.cmsdisplaywireframeicon.description
data.value: Indicates if the "wireframe" icon should be displayed in the content tree next to pages that contain a wireframe definition.

data.name: settingskey.cmsemailbatchsize.description
data.value: Sets the number of emails to fetch from email queue at one time

data.name: settingskey.cmsemailencoding.description
data.value: Encoding of the workflow notification emails. If not specified, UTF-8 is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsemailqueueenabled.description
data.value: If true, emails are stored in queue until successfully sent

data.name: settingskey.cmsemailsenabled.description
data.value: If true, email sending is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEmailTranslationFrom.description
data.value: Default email address which will be used as a sender of email with translation submission when a user submitting the page for translation does not have an email address in their profile.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEmailTranslationRecipients.description
data.value: List of recipients (separated with semicolon) who will receive ZIP file with pages for translation when the pages are submitted for translation. This value can be overridden by a specific service parameter in service setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableblogposttrackbacks.description
data.value: Indicates if trackback pings should be sent after blog post is saved.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablecodeeditsiteadministrators.description
data.value: Specifies whether site administrators can edit ASCX layouts and transformations and SQL queries in reporting module.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenabledefaultavatars.description
data.value: Indicates whether users should be allowed to choose an avatar image from a gallery of predefined avatars.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablefacebookconnect.description
data.value: Enables Facebook members to log onto your web site with their Facebook identity.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablefriends.description
data.value: Indicates if the Friends functionality should be available in other modules on the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablegeolocation.description
data.value: Indicates if contact's location can be tracked down and stored into his profile.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablehealthmonitoring.description
data.value: Indicates if Health monitoring is enabled. i.e. if monitored values are written to both general and site specific performance counters related to this instance of Kentico. If disabled, no values are written to any of these performance counters.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablelinkedin.description
data.value: Indicates if LinkedIn authentication is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableobjectsversioning.description
data.value: Globally enables or disables object versioning. This option is enabled by default. If disabled, no versions are created when objects are modified.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableonlinemarketing.description
data.value: Indicates if on-line marketing should be enabled, which includes tracking of users on the live site as contacts and logging of activities.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableopenid.description
data.value: Indicates if OpenID authentication is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEnableOutputCache.description
data.value: If checked, the output caching is enabled. If unchecked, no output caching is allowed on the whole site. The page settings still apply, both this settings and page settings must be enabled to use output cache.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEnablePartialCache.description
data.value: If checked, the system allows partial caching of web parts. The partial cache stores the HTML output of individual web part instances. If not checked, partial caching is disabled on the whole website for all web parts. By default, web parts do not use partial caching. You need to enable this setting and then set the Partial cache minutes property of individual web part instances.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablesitecounters.description
data.value: Indicates if values are written to site specific performance counters. If disabled, values are written to general counters only.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEnableTranlsationRESTService.description
data.value: Enables the REST translation service through which XLF pages can be retrieved from and submitted to the system.

data.name: settingskey.CMSEnableTranslations.description
data.value: If true translations via translation services are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableusercounts.description
data.value: Indicates if user activity points should be enabled (forum posts, blog posts, blog comments and message board posts).

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningalternativeformform.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of alternative form objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmscssstylesheet.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of stylesheet objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmscustomtable.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of custom table objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmsdocumenttype.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page type objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmsemailtemplate.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of email template objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmsform.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of bizform objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmslayout.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page layout objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmspagetemplate.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page template objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmsquery.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page type/custom table query objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmstemplatedevicelayout.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page template device layout objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmstransformation.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of page type/custom table transformation objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmswebpartcontainer.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of web part container objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmswebpartlayout.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of web part layout objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningcmsworkflow.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of workflow objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningmaautomationprocess.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of automation process objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningmediafile.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of media file objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningnewsletteremailtemplate.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of email campaign template objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningnewsletterissue.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of email objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningreportingreport.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of report objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningreportingreportgraph.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of report graph objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningreportingreporttable.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of report table objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenableversioningreportingreportvalue.description
data.value: Indicates if versioning of report value objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablewebdav.description
data.value: Indicates if WebDAV support is enabled (in Edit or Browse mode). Please note that WebDAV is only functional if Kentico is configured for Windows authentication—otherwise, this setting has no effect.

data.name: settingskey.cmsenablewindowsliveid.description
data.value: Indicates if Windows Live ID authentication is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmseventmanagerinvitationfrom.description
data.value: Email address of the invitation sender.

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedattributesfilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the Tag attribute XHTML filter, which ensures that all attributes of HTML tags are generated in valid XHTML format. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedformfilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the Form output filter, e.g. / or /products. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedhtml5filterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the HTML5 output filter, which ensures that tag attributes obsolete in HTML5 are replaced by CSS classes named in format <attributename>_<attributevalue>. Handles attributes: cellpadding, cellspacing, border, align, valign, width, height, rules

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedjavascriptfilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the JavaScript tag XHTML filter, which ensures that the type attribute is included in all <script> tags. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedlowercasefilterurls
data.value: Excluded XHTML lower case filter URLs

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedlowercasefilterurls.description
data.value: List of URLs paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the Lower case XHTML filter, which ensures that all HTML tags and attributes are generated in lower case. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedocumentsfromsearch.description
data.value: Specifies site sections that should be excluded from search. Please note: You can specify several site sections or particular pages, separated with semicolon (;). You can use wildcard character %.

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedocumenttypesfromsearch
data.value: Exclude page types from SQL search

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedocumenttypesfromsearch.description
data.value: Specifies page types that should NOT be searched. Please note: You can specify several page types separated with semicolon (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedresolvefilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the URL resolving output filter, e.g. / or /products. This filter ensures replacing of the ~ character in URLs with the website root URL. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedselfclosefilterurls
data.value: Excluded XHTML self close filter URLs

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedselfclosefilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from the Self closing tag XHTML filter, which ensures that all HTML elements without closing tags are properly closed, e.g. <br> will be replaced by <br />. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedurls.description
data.value:
List of URL prefixes (without domain) that should be excluded from the Kentico rewriting engine.
You can enter several paths separated by semicolon (;). Example: "/MyFiles/;/MyPage.aspx"
Warning: Do not exclude the URLs used by the regular pages in the website's content tree.

data.name: settingskey.cmsexcludedxhtmlfilterurls.description
data.value: List of URL paths (without the domain name, virtual directory and extension) that should be excluded from all functionality provided by the XHTML output filter, e.g. / or /products. You can enter several paths separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: settingskey.cmsexportlogobjectchanges.description
data.value: Specifies whether the export tasks are logged when the object is deleted (incremental update support)

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookapplicationsecret.description
data.value: The secret key of your Facebook application that will be used to encrypt all communications between your site and Facebook servers. Any interaction with Facebook requires existing Facebook application.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookconnectapikey.description
data.value: The identifier of your Facebook application. Any interaction with Facebook requires existing Facebook application.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookmapuserprofile
data.value: Update users using their Facebook profile

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookmapuserprofile.description
data.value: Specifies when the users, who log onto your website with their Facebook identity, are updated using information from their Facebook profile. Only empty fields are updated.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookroles.description
data.value: Facebook members who log onto your web site with their Facebook identity will be assigned to the selected roles.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookusermapping.description
data.value: Specifies how the users are updated using information from their Facebook profile.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfacebookusersettingsmapping.description
data.value: Configures mapping between Facebook profile's fields and user's setting fields.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfileimportfolder.description
data.value: Path to folder used for file import

data.name: settingskey.cmsfilesfolder.description
data.value: Physical path to the folder where uploaded files should be stored.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfilesfriendlyurlextension.description
data.value:
Specifies the extension that the system adds to file URLs, such as ".aspx" or ".html".
Example: getattachment/<node guid>/myimage.aspx When you omit this value, the files friendly URLs will end with no extension: getattachment/<node guid>/myimage
You need to configure IIS to allow custom URL extensions before using this setting.

data.name: settingskey.CMSFileSystemOutputCacheMinutes.description
data.value: Specifies the amount of time for which the output cache should be stored in the file system to provide persistent cache storage on application restart. If not set, standard caching mechanism in memory is used. If set, the system checks both caches.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfloodinterval.description
data.value: Value in seconds which represent the minimal interval between user's actions.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforbiddencharactersreplacement.description
data.value: Character that will be used as a replacement of forbidden characters in the page alias and in the file system.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforbiddenurlcharacters.description
data.value: List of additional characters that can't be used in page alias and in the file system. The following characters are forbidden by default: \/:*?"<>|&%.'#[]+ =

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumattachmentextensions.description
data.value: File types (extensions) that can be uploaded to the server (separated with a semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, all types of files can be uploaded.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumbaseurl.description
data.value: Specifies the global forum base URL which can be inherited by forum groups. This URL is used for emails and forum viewers.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumenableoptin.description
data.value:
Indicates if double opt-in should be enabled for forum objects. When enabled, users are required to confirm their subscription by clicking a link that is sent to them in an email.
You can override this setting in the properties of a particular forum group or a forum.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumenableoptinconfirmation.description
data.value: Indicates if an email confirmation should be sent to user after they approve a subscription. If double opt-in is disabled, these confirmation emails are always sent.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforummaxpostnode.description
data.value: Maximum number of forums posts displayed in forum post tree.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumoptinapprovalpath.description
data.value: Path to the page that contains the Forum subscription confirmation web part. The subscription confirmation link that will be sent to users will point to this page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumoptininterval.description
data.value: Amount of time in hours, during which a user has to confirm their subscription request.

data.name: settingskey.cmsforumunsubscriptionurl.description
data.value: Specifies the global unsubscription URL which can be inherited by forum groups. This URL is used for email unsubscription links.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfriendlyurlextension.description
data.value:
Specifies the extensions that the system adds to page URLs, such as ".aspx" or ".html".
When you leave this value empty, the friendly URLs will be the same as the alias path, for example: /products/nokia
You can also specify multiple extensions in format: extension1;extension2;extension3
The first extension is used as the default option when generating links and page URLs. Additional extensions are supported in URLs when accessing pages.
You need to configure IIS to allow custom URL extensions before using this setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsfriendsmanagementpath.description
data.value: Alias path of page containing Friendship management web part.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeneratenewsletters
data.value: Generate campaign emails if emails are disabled

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeneratenewsletters.description
data.value: If true and emails are disabled, campaign emails are generated into the email queue.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeneratethumbnails.description
data.value: Indicates if GetFile.aspx page should save the resized images on the disk for the next request in order to improve the performance.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeoarea.description
data.value: Assign found area code to an appropriate contact's column. Can be selected for text-based or integer-based columns. Suffix can be applied to text-based columns.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeocity.description
data.value: Assign found city name to an appropriate contact's text-based column. Suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeocountry.description
data.value: Assign found country ID or country display name into an appropriate contact's column. If the selected column is text-based, then suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeodma.description
data.value: Assign DMA code to an appropriate contact's column. Can be selected for integer-based or text-based columns. Suffix can be applied for text-based columns. DMA code (or designated market area code) is applicable to the United States only.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeolatitude.description
data.value: Assign found latitude position into a float-based or text-based contact's column. If the selected column is text-based, then suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeolongitude.description
data.value: Assign found longitude position into a float-based or text-based contact's column. If the selected column is text-based, then suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeometro.description
data.value: Assign found metro code to an appropriate contact's column. Can be selected for integer-based or text-based columns. Suffix can be applied to text-based columns.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeonewdb.description
data.value:
Geolocation data are based on free IP geolocating database 'GeoLite City'.

You can download monthly database updates from: http://client.kenticoasia.com/Download#GeoIP.
You can download 'GeoIP Organization Database' with additional Organization/ISP data as well.

Please upload geolocating database files into the following location: ~/App_Data/CMSModules/WebAnalytics/MaxMind/

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeoorganization.description
data.value: Assign found organization name or Internet service provider name into text-based contact's column. Suffix can be applied. This column will be updated only when GeoIP Organization Database is available.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeopostal.description
data.value: Assign found postal code to an appropriate contact's text-based column. Suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeostate.description
data.value: Assign found state ID or state display name into an appropriate contact's column. If the selected column is text-based, then suffix can be applied.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgeosuffix.description
data.value: Informative suffix which will be applied to text-based contact columns. Indicates that the inserted geo information is based on contact's position. Leave blank if you do not want to apply any suffix.

data.name: settingskey.cmsglobalcontactmultiplesites
data.value: Automatically create global contact for user

data.name: settingskey.cmsglobalcontactmultiplesites.description
data.value: Automatically creates a global contact for users and merges created site contact into that. If there are multiple global contacts merge them into one selected by 'When choosing from global contacts, select' setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgooglesitemapurl.description
data.value: Sets the URL where the website's Google (XML) sitemap can be accessed. The entered value is added to the website's domain to form the final URL. The internal path to the page responsible for generating the sitemap can be specified in the 'Google sitemap path' setting.

data.name: settingskey.CMSGoogleTranslateAPIKey.description
data.value: Google API key to identify your project. Go to https://code.google.com/apis/console/ to obtain your API key.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgravatardefaultimage.description
data.value: Determines what type of image should be displayed as the avatar of users who do not have a valid Gravatar registered for their e‑mail address. If (none) is selected, the local avatar image specified as the default option for users is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgravatarrating.description
data.value: Specifies the maximum Gravatar rating that will be allowed on the site. The following options are available: g: suitable for display on all websites with any audience type. pg: may contain rude gestures, provocatively dressed individuals, the lesser swear words, or mild violence. r: may contain such things as harsh profanity, intense violence, nudity, or hard drug use. x: may contain hardcore sexual imagery or extremely disturbing violence.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgroupavatarmaxsidesize.description
data.value: Specifies maximal width or height of group avatar.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgroupmanagementpath.description
data.value: Alias path of group management page, e.g. "/Groups/{GroupName}/Management", where {GroupName} will be replaced by current group name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgroupprofilepath.description
data.value: Alias path of group profile page, e.g. "/Groups/{GroupName}", where {GroupName} will be replaced by current group name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgroupssecurityaccesspath.description
data.value: Alias path where user will be redirected when accessing group without appropriate permission, e.g. "/Groups/{GroupName}/Access", where {GroupName} will be replaced by current group name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsgrouptemplatepath.description
data.value: Alias path of a page which will be used as a template for new group.

data.name: settingskey.cmshideunavailableuserinterface.description
data.value: If checked, the user interface is not visible for features that are unavailable due to license restrictions.

data.name: settingskey.cmsimagewatermark.description
data.value: Allows you to specify an image file that the system adds as a watermark to images. Either enter the full relative path to a physical file on the server (~/..), or use only the name of an image file located in the ~/App_Themes/Default/Images/Watermarks folder. You cannot use web links or images loaded using Kentico system pages, such as GetFile.

data.name: settingskey.cmsimagewatermarkposition.description
data.value: The position where the image watermark is placed on the watermarked images.

data.name: settingskey.cmsindentoutputhtml.description
data.value: If checked, the HTML output of pages will be processed to produce properly indented, easier to read code. The setting is applied to all pages on which the XHTML output filter is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSIntegrationEnabled.description
data.value: Indicates if the Integration bus logs and processes both incoming and outgoing integration tasks. Logging and processing of incoming and outgoing tasks can be enabled or disabled separately by means of the Enable logging of incoming tasks, Enable processing of incoming tasks, Enable logging of outgoing tasks and Enable processing of outgoing tasks settings below.

data.name: settingskey.CMSIntegrationLogExternal.description
data.value: Indicates if the Integration bus logs incoming integration tasks received from external systems. For this to work, the Enable system integration bus setting above must be enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.CMSIntegrationLogInternal.description
data.value: Indicates if the Integration bus logs page and object changes made in the Kentico system as outgoing integration tasks. For this to work, the Enable system integration bus setting above must be enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.CMSIntegrationProcessExternal.description
data.value: Indicates if the Integration bus processes logged incoming integration tasks received from external systems. For this to work, the Enable system integration bus setting above must be enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.CMSIntegrationProcessInternal.description
data.value: Indicates if the Integration bus processes outgoing integration tasks logged by page and object changes made in the Kentico system. For this to work, the Enable system integration bus setting above must be enabled as well.

data.name: settingskey.cmsinvitationacceptationpath.description
data.value: Alias path of page containing web part which is able to accept invitation.

data.name: settingskey.cmsinvitationvalidity.description
data.value: Number of days after which an invitation expires. Use 0 if it never expires.

data.name: settingskey.cmskeepchangeddocumentaccesible
data.value: Remember original URLs when moving pages

data.name: settingskey.cmskeepchangeddocumentaccesible.description
data.value: Specifies if new page alias should be created if page URL or alias path is updated or page is moved.

data.name: settingskey.CMSKeepNewCheckedOut.description
data.value: Check this option if you want the newly created objects (for which the check-in/check-out is supported) to be checked out automatically.

data.name: SettingsKey.CMSLayoutMappingEnable.Description
data.value: Indicates whether automatic layout mapping should be enabled. This mapping is editable in ##ui|CMS.DeviceProfile|Development.DeviceProfiles##.

data.name: settingskey.cmslinkedinapikey.description
data.value: Identifier of your application, which you acquire when registering an application at LinkedIn site.

data.name: settingskey.cmslinkedinapplicationsecret.description
data.value: This secret code will be used to encrypt all information between your site and LinkedIn servers.

data.name: settingskey.cmslinkedinroles.description
data.value: Registered LinkedIn users will be assigned to these roles. Separated by semicolon (;)

data.name: settingskey.cmsliveidconversionname.description
data.value: Default conversion name used for tracking registered users.

data.name: settingskey.cmsliveidrequireduserdatapage.description
data.value: URL of the page, where the RequiredLiveIDUsersData web part is placed. If set, LiveID users are not directly created in the system and they must provide additional information on specified page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsliveidroles.description
data.value: Registred Windows Live users will be assigned to these roles. Separated by (;)

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogAnalytics.description
data.value: If enabled, web analytics debug log is saved into the loganalytics.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require web analytics debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogCache.description
data.value: If enabled, cache access debug log is saved into the logcache.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require cache access debugging to be enabled. Only ADD operations are logged.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogEverythingToFile.description
data.value: Enables logging of all possible operations (including the Event log and Email sending log) into .log files stored in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogFiles.description
data.value: If enabled, IO operation debug log is saved into the logfiles.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require IO operation debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogMacros.description
data.value: If enabled, macro debug log is saved into the logmacros.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require macro debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogmetadata.description
data.value: If enabled, changes of object and page metadata (i.e. when an object or page is created, edited or deleted) are logged in the Event log.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogOutputToFile.description
data.value: If enabled, output debug log is saved into the logOutput.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require output debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogpagenotfoundexception.description
data.value: If enabled, page not found (404) exceptions will be logged as a warning in the event log.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogRequests.description
data.value: If enabled, request debug log is saved into the logRequests.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require request debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogSecurity.description
data.value: If enabled, security debug log is saved into the logSecurity.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require security debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogsize.description
data.value: The number of events stored in the Event log. When exceeded by 10% (or a different percentage set by means of the CMSLogKeepPercent web.config key), the percentage of the oldest events is deleted from the log in a batch. Set 0 if you don't want the system to log any events.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogSQLQueries.description
data.value: If enabled, SQL query debug log is saved into the logsql.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require SQL query debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogtodatabase.description
data.value: Indicates if events are logged to database. Doesn't overwrite 'Event log size' set to 0.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogtofilesystem.description
data.value: Indicates if events are logged to filesystem. Doesn't overwrite 'Event log size' set to 0.

data.name: settingskey.cmslogtotrace.description
data.value: Indicates if events are logged to trace. Doesn't overwrite 'Event log size' set to 0. This feature requires fully trusted application.

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogWebFarm
data.value: Log web farm operations to file

data.name: settingskey.CMSLogWebFarm.description
data.value: If enabled, web farm debug log is saved into the logwebfarm.log file in the ~/App_Data/CMSTemp/Debug folder. This option does not require web farm debugging to be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSManualTranslationDeleteSuccessfulSubmissions.description
data.value: If true, ZIP file with translated submission is deleted once the XLF files from within the ZIP file are downloaded into the submission item queue.

data.name: settingskey.CMSManualTranslationExportFolder.description
data.value: Path where submission ZIP files are exported when pages are submitted to translation.

data.name: settingskey.CMSManualTranslationImportFolder.description
data.value: Path to the folder where translated XLF files packed in ZIP files are imported from.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmaxcachefilesize.description
data.value: Specifies the maximum size of the file in kilobytes that is allowed to be cached.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmaximuminvalidloginattempts.description
data.value: Maximum invalid logon attempts before user account is locked. If set to 0. invalid logon attempts functionality is disabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmaxtreenodes.description
data.value: Maximum number of pages that will be displayed under unfolded page in the tree view.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmaxuitreenodes.description
data.value: Maximum number of nodes displayed under one parent node in administration UI trees.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmediafileallowedextensions.description
data.value: File types (extensions) that can be uploaded to the media library (separated with a semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, all types of files can be uploaded.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmediafilehiddenfolder.description
data.value: Name of the folder which is located in each media library subfolder. All file previews and image thumbnails of the files from the current subfolder are stored in its hidden folder. This folder is hidden both in administration UI and on the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmediafilepreviewsuffix.description
data.value: Media file preview suffix for identification of preview file. Format of the preview file name: &lt filename &gt _ &lt fileextension &gt&lt previewsuffix &gt . &lt previewextension &gt

data.name: settingskey.cmsmediaimagewatermark.description
data.value: If checked, the watermark is used for media files.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmedialibrariesfolder.description
data.value: Physical path to the folder where root folders of all media libraries should be stored. For example "~/Libraries", "c:/Libraries" or "\\servername\Libraries". If empty "~/[site name]/media" will be used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmedialibrarymaxsubfolders.description
data.value: Maximum number of folders that will be displayed under unfolded folder in the folder tree view.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmediausepermanenturls.description
data.value: If set to true, URLs of the media library files will be generated as permanent links using getmediafile.aspx.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmembermanagementpath.description
data.value: Alias path of member management page, e.g. "/Members/{UserName}/Management", where {UserName} will be replaced by the user name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmemberprofilepath.description
data.value: Alias path for member profile page, e.g. "/Members/{UserName}", where {UserName} will be replaced by the user name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmembershipreminder.description
data.value: Number of days before membership expiration when notification is to be sent to the user.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmergecontactsforcustomers
data.value: Merge contacts for identical E-commerce customers

data.name: settingskey.cmsmergecontactsforcustomers.description
data.value: Automatic contact merging will occur whenever multiple contacts exists for e-commerce customer.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmergecontactsforsubscribers
data.value: Merge contacts for identical Email campaign subscribers

data.name: settingskey.cmsmergecontactsforsubscribers.description
data.value: Automatic contact merge will occur when multiple contacts exist for email campaign subscriber.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmergecontactsforuser.description
data.value: Automatic contact merging will occur whenever multiple contacts exist for single user.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmessagingemailfrom.description
data.value: Notification email address of the email sender.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmetaimagewatermark.description
data.value: If checked, the watermark is used for object attachments.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmetaweblogdeleteattachments.description
data.value: Indicates whether the post attachments should be removed when not used anymore.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmetawebloggeneratesummary.description
data.value: Indicates whether the characters from blog post body should be copied as a blog post summary text. Number of characters is specified by 'Summary length' setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmetaweblogsummarylength.description
data.value: Number of characters copied by automatic summary to populate blog post summary.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmfdisplayinittoken.description
data.value: Displays an initialization token which is required by the Kentico Passcode Generator mobile application.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmfenabled.description
data.value: If set, the multi-factor authentication can be enabled for individual users and new users can choose to enable multi-factor authentication for their profile when they register on the website.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmfrequired.description
data.value: Multi-factor authentication is required for all users.

data.name: settingskey.cmsminwatermarkimageheight.description
data.value: Minimum height of an image to be watermarked.

data.name: settingskey.cmsminwatermarkimagewidth.description
data.value: Minimum width of an image to be watermarked.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmonitorbouncedemails.description
data.value: Indicates if bounced emails should be monitored.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmoveviewstatetoend
data.value: Move ViewState to the end of the page

data.name: settingskey.cmsmoveviewstatetoend.description
data.value: If checked, the ViewState field is moved to the end of the page which results in more content being processed by the search engines.

data.name: settingskey.CMSMSTranslatorClientID.description
data.value: To obtain Client ID you have to register your application with Azure Datamarket. Visit https://datamarket.azure.com/developer/applications/ using the LiveID credentials from step 1, and click on “Register”. In the “Register your application” dialog you can define your own Client ID and Name.

data.name: settingskey.CMSMSTranslatorClientSecret.description
data.value: To obtain Client Secret you have to register your application with Azure Datamarket. Visit https://datamarket.azure.com/developer/applications/ using the LiveID credentials from step 1, and click on “Register”. In the “Register your application” dialog you can define your own Client ID and Name.

data.name: settingskey.cmsmvtenabled.description
data.value: Indicates whether multivariate testing module is enabled

data.name: settingskey.cmsmyaccounturl.description
data.value: The URL of the My account page (virtual path).

data.name: settingskey.cmsnewdocumentorder.description
data.value: Specifies the default order of new inserted page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsnewsletterunsubscriptionurl.description
data.value: Default URL where newsletter unsubscription page is placed. If not specified, '~/CMSPages/Unsubscribe.aspx' is used.

data.name: settingskey.CMSNewsletterUseExternalService
data.value: Use external service for page-based email campaigns

data.name: settingskey.CMSNewsletterUseExternalService.description
data.value: If enabled, the scheduled tasks that are created to ensure the mail-out of new page-based email campaigns will be set to be processed by the external scheduling Windows service by default. Please note that this does not change the settings of existing page-based email campaign tasks.

data.name: settingskey.cmsnoreplyemailaddress.description
data.value: System will use this email address for sending various types of automated emails.

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistorylength.description
data.value: Determines the maximum number of minor object versions (per object) saved in database. If 0, minor versions history length is not limited.

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistorymajorversionslength.description
data.value: Determine maximal number of major object versions (per object) saved in database. If 0 major versions history length is not limited.

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistorypromotetomajortimeinterval
data.value: Promote to major version if older than (hours)

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistorypromotetomajortimeinterval.description
data.value: Determines the number of hours between modifications of an object needed to promote an object version to a major version. If 0, no promoting occurs automatically.

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistoryuselastversioninterval
data.value: Save to last version if younger than (minutes)

data.name: settingskey.cmsobjectversionhistoryuselastversioninterval.description
data.value: Indicates if the last version should be used to store actual object data instead of creating a new version when an object is edited within the specified time interval. If 0, a new version is always created.

data.name: settingskey.cmsopenidroles.description
data.value: Registred OpenID users will be assigned to these roles. Separated by (;)

data.name: settingskey.cmsoptinapprovalurl.description
data.value: URL which should be used for double opt-in confirmation link.

data.name: settingskey.cmsoptininterval.description
data.value: Interval in hours in which user has to confirm his request.

data.name: settingskey.cmsoutputcacheitems.description
data.value: The system stores different versions of the output cache for pages based on the selected variables. For example, if you uncheck the 'username' option, pages use the same output cache data for all logged in users (depending on the remaining variables).

data.name: settingskey.cmspagedescriptionprefix.description
data.value: Specifies prefix that will be used for page description on the whole web site.

data.name: settingskey.cmspagekeywordsprefix.description
data.value: Specifies prefix that will be used for page keywords on the whole web site.

data.name: settingskey.cmspagenotfoundfornonpublished
data.value: Page not found for non-published pages

data.name: settingskey.cmspagenotfoundfornonpublished.description
data.value: If true, non-published pages behave as non-existing. Otherwise, even non-published pages will be visible on the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmspagenotfoundurl.description
data.value: Specifies a custom page that will be displayed to users who encounter a Page not found error (404 HTTP status code). It can either be a physical aspx file in the web project or a dedicated page in the site's content tree.

data.name: settingskey.cmspagetitleprefix.description
data.value: Page title prefix that will be used for all pages.

data.name: settingskey.cmspartialcacheitems.description
data.value: The system stores different versions of the partial cache of web part instances based on the selected variables. For example, if you uncheck the 'username' option, all logged in users share the same partial cache for each web part instance (depending on the remaining variables).

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordexpiration.description
data.value: Indicates if password expiration should be checked during user authentication.

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordexpirationbehaviour.description
data.value: Determines system behavior when user password is expired.

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordexpirationemail.description
data.value: Send password expiration email when user account is locked.

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordexpirationperiod.description
data.value: Indicates number of days for which the user password is valid.

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordexpirationwarningperiod.description
data.value: Indicates number of days before password expiration for which warning should be displayed. Please note: If set to 0, warning will be displayed only after password expiration.

data.name: settingskey.cmspasswordformat.description
data.value: Format of the password. Please note: empty string in the UserPassword field is considered to be blank password for both plain text and hash format. You can use the empty value to reset administrator's password in the database if you forget it.

data.name: settingskey.cmspaypalbusiness.description
data.value: The primary email address used for merchant's PayPal account.

data.name: settingskey.cmspaypalcancelreturnurl.description
data.value: The URL to which the buyer's browser is redirected if the payment is cancelled, e.g.: a URL on your website that displays your custom Payment cancelled page. By default, i.e. if no such URL is defined, the browser is redirected to a corresponding PayPal webpage.

data.name: settingskey.cmspaypalnotifyurl.description
data.value: The URL to which PayPal posts information about the transaction. If set, overrides the settings in PayPal merchant's interface.

data.name: settingskey.cmspaypalreturnurl.description
data.value: The URL to which the buyer's browser is redirected after completing the payment, e.g.: a URL on your website that displays your custom Thank your for your payment page. By default, i.e. if no such URL is defined, the browser is redirected to a corresponding PayPal webpage.

data.name: settingskey.cmspersonalizeuserinterface.description
data.value: Indicates if UI personalization is enabled: If checked, user can see only such UI elements which are allowed according to his UI profile. If unchecked, user can see all UI elements.

data.name: settingskey.cmspolicyforcepolicyonlogon.description
data.value: Indicates if password policy should be forced on user logon. When user password doesn't meet policy requirements she will be forced to change her password.

data.name: settingskey.cmspolicyminimallength.description
data.value: Allowed length (in characters) of the user password. If empty or zero number of characters is not limited.

data.name: settingskey.cmspolicynumberofnonalphanumchars.description
data.value: Minimal number of non alphanumeric characters which password has to contain. National characters aren't taken as alpha characters.

data.name: settingskey.cmspolicyregularexpression.description
data.value: If set password has to meet given regular expression.

data.name: settingskey.cmspollsallowglobal.description
data.value: Indicates if global polls are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmspop3authenticationmethod.description
data.value: Specifies which one of the authenticaton methods will be used

data.name: settingskey.cmspop3usessl.description
data.value: Specifies whether the connection to the server should be made using SSL.

data.name: settingskey.cmsprocessdomainprefix.description
data.value: Determines how the www domain prefix should be handled in the website's URLs. This setting does not apply to IP addresses and top-level domains.

data.name: settingskey.cmsprogressivecaching.description
data.value: If checked, the system optimizes access to uncached data so that concurrent threads only use a single data access operation and share the results. This leads to better performance if the website is under a heavy load, without the drawback of not having the latest data available. Applies only for components and locations where caching is supported when cache minutes are set to 0.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrecognizebyip
data.value: Automatically recognize visitors by IP address

data.name: settingskey.cmsrecognizebyip.description
data.value: Indicates if visitor's IP address should be used to determine what contact should be assigned to current anonymous visitor.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrecognizebyuseragent
data.value: Automatically recognize visitors by user agent

data.name: settingskey.cmsrecognizebyuseragent.description
data.value: Indicates if visitor's browser user agent information should be used to determine what contact should be assigned to current anonymous visitor.

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectaliasestomainurl
data.value: Redirect page aliases to main URL

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectaliasestomainurl.description
data.value: If enabled, the page always has only one valid URL and other aliases are redirected to this main URL, for SEO purposes.

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectfilestoazure
data.value: Redirect files to Windows Azure storage

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectfilestoazure.description
data.value: If files are stored to Windows Azure storage and this option is set to true requests for files are redirected directly to Windows Azure storage and Media library generates absolute links directly to Windows Azure storage. It doesn't control if Windows Azure blob storage accepts requests from public users.

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectfilestodisk.description
data.value: If checked, file requests are redirected to the physical file in the file system if possible.

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectinvalidcasepages
data.value: Redirect invalid case URLs to their correct versions

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirectinvalidcasepages.description
data.value: Checks the URL letter case, and if configured, redirects to their correct versions. Options: NONE, EXACT, LOWERCASE, UPPERCASE.

data.name: settingskey.cmsredirecttomainextension.description
data.value: Indicates whether pages should be redirected to the corresponding URL with current main extension.

data.name: settingskey.cmsregistrationadministratorapproval.description
data.value: Indicates whether the registration needs to be confirmed by the administrator.

data.name: settingskey.cmsregistrationapprovalpagepath.description
data.value: Path to the page that contains the Registration email confirmation web part. The registration confirmation link that will be sent to users will point to this page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsregistrationemailconfirmation.description
data.value: Indicates whether the registration requires confirmation through a link sent by email.

data.name: settingskey.cmsremembercontactspermanently.description
