data.value: Indicates how long should contacts be remembered. If checked then contact will be kept until cookies will be deleted or another contact will be determined. If unchecked then contact will be kept until session expires.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrememberunigridstate.description
data.value: Determines whether grid controls remember their state, i.e., filter, page number, page size and sorting order, between page visits.

data.name: settingskey.CMSRenderHTML5MediaTags.description
data.value: If checked, the system renders HTML5 media tags <audio> and <video> for media content.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrequiredlinkedinpage.description
data.value: URL of the page, where the LinkedInUsersRequiredData web part is placed. If set, new users, who were authenticated by LinkedIn, are not directly created in the system and they must provide additional information on specified page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrequiredopenidpage.description
data.value: URL of the page, where the RequiredOpenIDUsersData web part is placed. If set, OpenID users are not directly created in the system and they must provide additional information on specified page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsreservedusernames.description
data.value: User cannot select these names during registration.

data.name: settingskey.cmsresetpasswordinterval.description
data.value: Float value in hours specifies time interval in which user can reset her password. Value is used only when email approval is set to true.

data.name: settingskey.cmsresetpasswordrequiresapproval.description
data.value: If checked, the forgotten password functionality in the login form web part and on the login page to the administration interface will require email approval to regenerate the password.

data.name: settingskey.cmsresetpasswordurl.description
data.value: Custom page for reset of user password (if not set, system page ~/CMSModules/Membership/CMSPages/ResetPassword.aspx will be used)

data.name: settingskey.cmsresizeimagestodevice
data.value: Resize images according to device profile

data.name: settingskey.cmsresizeimagestodevice.description
data.value: If enabled, the system automatically reduces the maximum side size of images to the larger of the dimensions set for the used device profile ('Preview width' or 'Preview height'). To disable the resizing for individual images, add the 'resizemode=1' query string parameter to the image source URL.

data.name: settingskey.cmsresolvemacrosincss.description
data.value: If checked, the macros are resolved within the CSS stylesheet code.

data.name: settingskey.cmsresourcecompressionenabled.description
data.value: Determines whether web resources such as JavaScript and CSS should be served compressed to browsers

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestalloweddoctypes.description
data.value: List of page types which will be accessible by the service. Enter the names of page types separated by semicolons. If the field is empty, all page types will be accessible.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestallowedobjecttypes.description
data.value: List of object types which will be accessible by the service. Enter the names of object types separated by semicolons. If the field is empty, all object types will be accessible.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestauthenticationtype.description
data.value: Determines which type of authentication will be used by the REST service. Supported types are Basic and Forms authentication.

data.name: settingskey.CMSRESTDefaultEncoding.description
data.value: Sets a default encoding which is used when no Accept-Charset header in a REST request is used or the requested encoding is not supported.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestdocumentsreadonly.description
data.value: If true, only GET page requests can be processed by the service and pages can't be modified by the service.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestdocumentssecuritycheck.description
data.value: If false, security is not checked when accessing published versions of pages. If true, security is always checked.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestgeneratehash.description
data.value: Click the link to open a dialog where you can generate an authentication hash for a specified URL. This hash can be used instead of authentication afterwards to access specified data.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestobjectsreadonly.description
data.value: If true, only GET object requests can be processed by the service and objects can't be modified by the service.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestoreobjects.description
data.value: Indicates which object types support deletion of the objects into the recycle bin.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestserviceenabled.description
data.value: Enables or disables the Kentico REST service.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrestservicetypeenabled.description
data.value: Choose if the REST service should be used for access to objects, pages or both.

data.name: settingskey.cmsrevalidateclientcache.description
data.value: If enabled, browsers perform revalidation when requesting files that have expired in the client cache. Revalidation allows the client cache to refresh unchanged files without reloading the file data from the server. If disabled, browsers always fully load expired files.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforcecredentials.description
data.value: Salesforce integration requires access to your organization on behalf of a specified user.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationbatchsize.description
data.value: Number of contacts that are processed together. Larger batch size reduces the number of Salesforce API calls. There's a limit on the number of API calls your organization is allowed to make in a 24 hour window.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationdefaultcompanyname.description
data.value: The company name that is associated with replicated contact when it does not belong to any company. Salesforce leads require company name.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationenabled.description
data.value: Enables or disables the replication of contacts into Salesforce leads.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationleaddescription.description
data.value: The macro expression for customized description of each replicated contact. You can map this description to a Salesforce lead attribute. The contact being replicated is accessible from the Contact property.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationmapping
data.value: Mapping of contacts to Salesforce leads

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationmapping.description
data.value: The mapping of contact fields to Salesforce lead fields.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationmappingdatetime.description
data.value: This setting is for internal use only.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationminscorevalue
data.value: Minimum number of points for replication

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationminscorevalue.description
data.value: Only contacts that get at least the specified number of points for the specified score will be replicated.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationscoreid.description
data.value: Only contacts that get at least the specified number of points for the specified score will be replicated.

data.name: settingskey.cmssalesforceleadreplicationupdateenabled.description
data.value: Enables or disables the propagation of changes in contacts that were replicated into Salesforce leads.

data.name: settingskey.cmsschedulerinterval.description
data.value: Determines how often the application should check if there are any tasks ready to be executed (in seconds). By default, the scheduler is configured to check tasks only on page requests; you can set the minimum time between the checks to any interval. If it is configured to check automatically, you can set an interval of 1 to 30 seconds. Setting 0 stops the scheduling of tasks.

data.name: settingskey.cmsschedulerserviceinterval.description
data.value: Determines how often the external Windows service should check if there are any tasks ready to be executed (in seconds). You can set an interval of 1 to 30 seconds. Setting 0 stops the scheduling of tasks.

data.name: settingskey.cmsschedulertaskenabled.description
data.value: Indicates if scheduled tasks are enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmsscheduleruseexternalservice.description
data.value: Indicates if scheduled tasks that have the Use external service option enabled should be processed by Kentico CMS Scheduler external Windows service. Please note that for this to work, the service must be installed and running. If enabled and the service is not running, these tasks are not processed at all. If disabled, all scheduled tasks are processed by the application itself.

data.name: settingskey.cmsscriptminificationenabled.description
data.value: Determines whether JavaScript should be served minified to browsers

data.name: settingskey.CMSSearchAllowedFileTypesdesc
data.value:
File types (extensions) of attachments the content of which will be indexed along with the parent page (separated with a semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, all supported types of attachment files will be indexed.

Currently, there are extractors installed in the system for the following file types: {%GetSupportedContentExtractors()%}

data.name: settingskey.cmssearchindexingenabled.description
data.value: Indicates whether smart search indexation is enabled

data.name: settingskey.cmssearchonlyifcontentpresent.description
data.value: Indicates if smart search should be used without search text.

data.name: settingskey.cmssecuredareaslogonpage.description
data.value: Logon page used for signing in to the website. Please note: This page is different to the administration logon page.

data.name: settingskey.cmssecurityalgorithm.description
data.value: Security algorithm used for encrypting the information.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendblogemailsfrom.description
data.value: Email address of the blog comment emails sender. Please note: You can use format "Some name <email@domain.com>".

data.name: settingskey.cmssendboardemailsfrom.description
data.value: Specifies the sender email address of emails sent by message board module.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendemailnotificationsfrom.description
data.value: Email address which will be used as a sender for email notifications.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendemailwithresetpassword.description
data.value: This setting is used only when email approval for password reset is required. Specifies if password is sent via email after user resets her password.

data.name: settingskey.cmssenderrornotificationto.description
data.value: If an email address is entered, email notifications about errors logged in the event log will be sent to the address. It is possible to enter more addresses separated by semicolon.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendforumemailsfrom.description
data.value: Email address the emails will be sent from

data.name: settingskey.cmssendpasswordemailsfrom.description
data.value: Specifies the sender of the emails sent on password retrieval

data.name: settingskey.cmssendunlockaccountemail.description
data.value: Indicates if account unlock email is sent when a user account is locked due to reaching maximum invalid logon attempts.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendworkflowemails.description
data.value: Indicates if workflow email notification should be sent.

data.name: settingskey.cmssendworkflowemailsfrom.description
data.value: Email address of the workflow emails sender. You can use format "Some name <email@domain.com>".

data.name: settingskey.cmsservicehealthmonitoringinterval.description
data.value: Time interval (in seconds). In this periodical interval, the external Windows service reads monitored values and writes them to performance counters. Setting 0 stops monitoring of counters.

data.name: settingskey.cmssessionmanagerschedulerinterval.description
data.value: Interval between updating records in database session table.

data.name: settingskey.cmssessionusedbrepository.description
data.value: If checked, on-line users are stored in the database. Must be enabled for web farms.

data.name: settingskey.cmssharepointdefaultcredentials.description
data.value: The system uses the current user's windows domain credentials to access the SharePoint server.

data.name: settingskey.cmssharepointpassword.description
data.value: Password used for authentication to SharePoint server.

data.name: settingskey.cmssharepointusername.description
data.value: Username used for authentication to SharePoint server.

data.name: settingskey.cmsshoppingcarturl.description
data.value: The URL of the Shopping cart page (virtual path).

data.name: settingskey.cmsshowazurelogo.description
data.value: Determines whether Powered by Windows Azure logo is shown in administration.

data.name: settingskey.cmssitesharedaccounts
data.value: Share user accounts on all sites

data.name: settingskey.cmssitesharedaccounts.description
data.value: When checked, all sites share user accounts on live site, otherwise the user can login only to sites to which he belongs.

data.name: settingskey.cmssmtpserver.description
data.value: IP address or name of the SMTP server used to send emails. Use localhost for your local SMTP server.

data.name: settingskey.cmssmtpservertip.description
data.value: You can specify more SMTP servers with advanced settings in ##ui|cms|Administration.SmtpServers##.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstaginglogchanges.description
data.value: Specifies whether content change tasks are generated, check for source server.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstaginglogdatachanges.description
data.value: Specifies whether data change tasks for Custom tables are generated, check for source server.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstaginglogobjectchanges.description
data.value: Specifies whether object change tasks are generated, check for source server.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstaginglogstagingchanges.description
data.value: Specifies whether processing object or content tasks generates staging tasks.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstagingserviceenabled.description
data.value: Specifies whether the staging service is enabled, check for target server.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstagingservicepassword.description
data.value:
Staging service password for username authentication.
Staging won't work when password is blank.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstagingserviceusername.description
data.value: Staging service user name for username authentication.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstagingservicex509clientbase64keyid.description
data.value: Staging service client certificate key ID.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstagingservicex509serverbase64keyid.description
data.value: Staging service server certificate key ID.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreaddtoshoppingcartconversionname
data.value: Add to shopping cart conversion name

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreaddtoshoppingcartconversionname.description
data.value: The name of the conversion that will be logged when a user adds a product to the shopping cart.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreaddtoshoppingcartconversionvalue
data.value: Add to shopping cart conversion value

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreaddtoshoppingcartconversionvalue.description
data.value: Allows to set a number that will be recorded, together with the specified conversion, as the conversion value when this particular conversion is logged. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value is added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current website context.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowanonymouscustomers.description
data.value: Indicates if customers need to register on your site so that they can make the purchase.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobaldepartments.description
data.value: Indicates if global departments are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobaldiscountcoupons.description
data.value: Indicates if global product coupons are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalmanufacturers.description
data.value: Indicates if global manufacturers are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalpaymentmethods.description
data.value: Indicates if global payment methods are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalproductoptions.description
data.value: Indicates if global product options are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalproducts.description
data.value: Indicates if global products are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalshippingoptions.description
data.value: Indicates if global shipping options are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreallowglobalsuppliers.description
data.value: Indicates if global suppliers are allowed.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreAllowProductsWithoutDocuments.description
data.value: Indicates whether it is possible to create stand-alone SKUs (i.e. SKUs without their page representations in the sections tree). If so, the stand-alone SKUs node is displayed in the product sections tree in the products administration UI. This setting has no effect if the sections tree is hidden. Please refer to the 'Display tree of product sections' setting for more details.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreapplytaxesbasedon.description
data.value: Indicates whether the taxes are applied based on a shipping or billing address. Taxes related to orders without a shipping address will be calculated based on a billing address, regardless of this setting.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstorecheckoutprocess.description
data.value: Defines the checkout process used in the store shopping cart.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoredefaultcountryname.description
data.value: Allows to set the default country, choose your country or country where you sell the most. All taxes are applied based on their values in the default country unless the customer specifies their country or state during the checkout process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoredisplaycontenttreeInproducts.description
data.value: Indicates whether product-related part of the content tree will be displayed in products UI.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreDisplayPriceIncludingDiscounts.description
data.value: Indicates if product prices on the live site are displayed including discounts. This takes effect only for prices that are displayed using the 'GetSKUFormattedPrice()' or 'GetSKUPriceSaving()' methods.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreDisplayPriceIncludingTaxes.description
data.value: Indicates if product prices on the live site are displayed including taxes. This takes effect only for prices that are displayed using the 'GetSKUFormattedPrice()' or 'GetSKUPriceSaving()' methods.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreDisplayProductsInSectionsTree.description
data.value: Indicates if products should be displayed in the product sections tree. This setting has no effect if the sections tree is hidden. Please refer to the 'Display tree of product sections' setting for more details.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreenableunassignedproducts.description
data.value: Indicates whether it is possible to create products not assigned to page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreeproductsreminder.description
data.value: The number of days prior to e-product expiration when a notification is sent to the user.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstorefilesindatabase.description
data.value: Indicates if files should be stored in the database.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstorefilesinfilesystem.description
data.value: Indicates if files should be stored in file system.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreInvoiceNumberPattern.description
data.value: A pattern used for invoice number generating. The default pattern {%Order.OrderID%} is used when left empty. In that case, the invoice number is equal to the ID of the order. Please see E-commerce / Configuration / Invoice for more macros examples.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreinvoicetemplate.description
data.value: HTML template used to generate an invoice (or receipt) after an order is finished and saved.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoremassunit.description
data.value: Specifies mass unit of weight of products, shipping options, etc. on all your sites.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreNewProductStatus.description
data.value: A product public status indicating that the respective product has been evaluated as new. Any product may be marked with this status automatically based on the 'Products are new for' setting and 'In store from product' property, regardless of the product-specific public status settings. Properties of the status are then used when displaying the product status indicator on the live site.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreorderconversionname.description
data.value: The name of the conversion that will be logged when a user completes an order.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreorderconversionvalue.description
data.value: Allows to set a number that will be recorded, together with the order conversion, as the order conversion value when this conversion is logged. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value is added to the total sum previously recorded for this conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current website context.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreProductsAreNewFor.description
data.value: The number of days for which created products are marked as New products in the store. The days are counted based on the product's 'In store from' property.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreProductsStartingPath.description
data.value: A path within the content tree where the subtree of product sections starts, e.g.: /Products. This subtree is then displayed in the products administration UI. However, the setting has no effect if the sections tree is hidden. Please refer to the 'Display tree of product sections' setting for more details.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreProductsTree.description
data.value: Indicates whether the tree of product sections is displayed in the products administration UI. If the sections tree is hidden, only stand-alone SKUs can be created from the products administration UI. Otherwise, a complete product (i.e. an SKU with its page representation in the sections tree) can be created.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreredirecttoshoppingcart.description
data.value: If checked, the user is redirected to the shopping cart content page when the Add to shopping cart button is clicked. Otherwise the user stays on the same page and the product is added to the shopping cart at the background.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreregistercustomerafterfirstcheckout.description
data.value: Indicates if the system automatically creates an account for unregistered customers after successfully completing the checkout process. The system uses data that the customer provided during the checkout process. The customer then receives a notification email with their login information, i.e. an email address and a randomly generated password.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreregistrationaftercheckoutemailtemplate.description
data.value: The system sends a notification email to unregistered customers after the first checkout if "Register customer after first checkout" is on. Here you can select or modify the template for this email.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreregistrationconversionname.description
data.value: The name of the conversion that will be logged when a user successfully registers on the website through the checkout process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreregistrationconversionvalue.description
data.value: Allows to set a number that will be recorded, together with the registration conversion, as the registration conversion value when this conversion is logged. The values are cumulative, i.e. when a conversion hit is logged, the specified value is added to the total sum previously recorded for the conversion. You may insert a macro expression into this field to dynamically retrieve a value from the current website context.

data.name: settingskey.CMSStoreRelatedProductsRelationshipName.description
data.value: The name of the relationship which is used for defining related products. If you leave the default option, i.e. (all), the user can choose from all relationships defined on the given site when adding related products. This gives them the possibility to use more than one type of relationship among products.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstorerequirecompanyinfo.description
data.value: Indicates if it is compulsory to provide company account information during the check out process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoresendemailsfrom.description
data.value: An email address from which the E-commerce notification emails are sent.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoresendemailsto.description
data.value: An email address (e.g. merchant's email address) to which the E-commerce notification emails are sent.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoresendordernotification.description
data.value: Indicates if email notifications are sent after an order has been finished and saved.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoresendpaymentnotification.description
data.value: Indicates if email notifications are sent after an order payment has been completed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreshippingfreelimit.description
data.value: The minimum order value in the store main currency when the shipping is not charged.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreshoworganizationid.description
data.value: Show organization ID field - if checked, customer details will contain the organization ID field. The field will be displayed also in My account on the live site and during the check out process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreshowtaxregistrationid.description
data.value: Show Tax registration ID field - if checked, customer details will contain the tax registration ID field (e.g. VAT registration ID). The field will be displayed also in My account on the live site and during the check out process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreusecustomercultureforemails.description
data.value: Indicates if emails to customers should be sent in the shopping cart culture.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseextracompanyaddress.description
data.value: Indicates if the option of providing a company address is available in the check out process.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalcredit.description
data.value: Indicates if customers use global credit.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalcurrencies.description
data.value: Indicates if global currencies are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalexchangerates.description
data.value: Indicates if global exchange rates are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalinternalstatus.description
data.value: Indicates if global internal statuses are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalinvoice.description
data.value: Indicates if global invoice is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalorderstatus.description
data.value: Indicates if global order statuses are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobalpublicstatus.description
data.value: Indicates if global public statuses are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreuseglobaltaxclasses.description
data.value: Indicates if global tax classes are used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstoreweightformattingstring.description
data.value: The format used to display product weight. Use the {0} expression to insert the weight into the format string.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandsapiid.description
data.value: Enter the unique identifier of your Strands Recommender account. The system needs the ID to communicate with the recommendation service. You can find your API ID in the My account section of the Strands Recommender website.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandsautomaticuploadfrequency.description
data.value:
The frequency at which the Strands catalog feed is requested by Strands.
You can set the frequency more precisely directly on the Strands portal (e.g., you can set an exact hour for weekly updates).

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandscatalogpath.description
data.value: The path from which items are generated into the Strands catalog feed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandscatalogtransformation.description
data.value: Transformation used to generate each item in the Strands catalog feed. Only items in the feed will be considered when recommending items.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandscatalogwherecondition.description
data.value: The value of the WHERE condition in the SELECT statement that specifies the items in the Strands catalog feed. For example, DocumentName LIKE 'Apple%' selects all products starting with 'Apple'.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandsenableautomaticcatalogupload.description
data.value: Makes the system upload the Strands catalog feed into Strands automatically on a regular basis.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandsproducttypes.description
data.value: The product types from which items are generated into the Strands catalog feed. Leave empty to include all product types.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstrandsvalidationtoken.description
data.value: Enter the validation token of your Strands Recommender account. The Strands recommendation service requests the token when the application performs certain customer actions. You can find your Validation Token in the My account section of the Strands Recommender website.

data.name: settingskey.cmsstylesheetminificationenabled.description
data.value: Determines whether CSS should be served minified to browsers

data.name: settingskey.cmstimezonesenable.description
data.value: Indicates whether time zones support is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.cmstrackaveragetimeonpage.description
data.value: Enables/disables tracking average time on page.

data.name: settingskey.cmstrackreferringsitesdirect
data.value: Track referring pages by direct link

data.name: settingskey.cmstrackreferringsitesdirect.description
data.value: Enables tracking direct link page access.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslateFileTypes.description
data.value:
File types (extensions, separated with a semicolon, without dot) of the attachments that can be submitted as part of requested translations if the "Allow attachment translation" setting is enabled.

Note: If no value is specified, all types of files will be submitted.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslateWebpartProperties.description
data.value: If true, web part properties which are marked with "Translate column" flag will be submitted to translation as well, replaced with a localization macro {$ ... $}.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslationsAutoImport.description
data.value: If true translations are automatically imported to system once the translation submission is received from the service as translated.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslationsComPassword.description
data.value: Password to access Project Director service.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslationsComProjectCode.description
data.value: Code string to identify a project within the Project Director service.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslationsComUserName.description
data.value: User name to access Project Director service.

data.name: settingskey.CMSTranslationsEncoding.description
data.value: Encoding which will be used for translations (for XLF pages including XLF pages used in translation REST service).

data.name: settingskey.cmsunlockuseraccountpath.description
data.value: Path to custom page for unlocking user account (if not set, system page ~/CMSModules/Membership/CMSPages/UnlockUserAccount.aspx will be used)

data.name: settingskey.cmsupdatedocumentalias.description
data.value: If checked, the page alias is updated when the page name of the default culture changes.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuploadextensions.description
data.value: File types (extensions) that can be uploaded to the server (separated with a semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, all types of files can be uploaded.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseautomaticversionnumbering.description
data.value: Use automatic version numbering for workflow

data.name: settingskey.cmsusebizformssitefolder
data.value: Use site-specific subfolders for custom form files folder

data.name: settingskey.cmsusebizformssitefolder.description
data.value: Indicates if site-specific folder should be used for Forms module forms.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusecheckincheckout.description
data.value: Indicates if content locking (check-in/check-out) should be used for page types that use versioning.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseculturedomain.description
data.value: If checked, page URLs will always be generated using the domain to which the current content culture is assigned. This also means that the URL will be redirected to the corresponding domain name whenever a different language is selected. This option cannot be combined with language prefixes.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseeventloglistener.description
data.value: Indicates if the system logs events in the Windows Event Viewer. Use the Modify feature of the Kentico installer, if you haven't turned the Registration of Kentico in Windows Event Log option on when installing Kentico.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseexternalservice.description
data.value: Indicates if external Windows service should be used to read and write monitored values to the "Scheduled tasks in queue", "Emails in queue" and "Error emails in queue" performance counters. As these counters require database access to get their values, using the external service may optimize your application's performance.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusefilessitefolder
data.value: Use site-specific subfolders for custom files folder

data.name: settingskey.cmsusefilessitefolder.description
data.value: Indicates if site-specific folder should be used for attachment physical files.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuselangprefixforurls.description
data.value: If enabled, the URLs of pages will be generated with a language prefix. By default, a culture code name is used as prefix. If you specify Culture alias property in ##ui|cms.localization|Development.Cultures## -> Cultures then this alias is used as prefix.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseliveurlforediting
data.value: Use live URL for editing modes

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseliveurlforediting.description
data.value: If checked, the live URL of the page is used in the editing modes instead of special system URL. Check if you are using MVC development model only.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusemedialibrariessitefolder
data.value: Use site-specific subfolders for custom media libraries folder

data.name: settingskey.cmsusemedialibrariessitefolder.description
data.value: Indicates if site-specific folder should be used for media files physical files.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusenamepathforurlpath
data.value: Use name path for URL path

data.name: settingskey.cmsusenamepathforurlpath.description
data.value: If checked, this key indicates that name path should be automatically copied to the URL path.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusenofollowforuserslinks.description
data.value: If enabled, the system will instruct crawlers (robots) not to follow links posted by users on forums, message boards or in blog comments. This is achieved by including the rel="nofollow" attribute in the output code of the given link tags.

data.name: settingskey.CMSUseObjectCheckinCheckout.description
data.value: Indicates if object locking (check-in/check-out) should be used for objects.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseparentgroupidfornewdocuments
data.value: Use parent community group for new pages

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseparentgroupidfornewdocuments.description
data.value: Indicates if community group assignment of newly created pages should be inherited from their parent page.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusepasswordpolicy.description
data.value: If checked, each new password defined anywhere in the system will be checked against the specified password policy rules.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusepermanentredirect.description
data.value: If enabled, the system uses permanent (301) redirection instead of standard (302) redirection for SEO purposes.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusepermanenturls.description
data.value: If enabled, URLs of pages and page attachments will be generated in a permanent format. If disabled, friendly URLs will be used.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseruniqueemail.description
data.value: Indicates whether the user email should be unique.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusesessionmanagement.description
data.value: Indicates if on-line users are monitored and logged.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusessl.description
data.value: Indicates if emails should be sent over SSL.

data.name: settingskey.cmsusesslforadministrationinterface.description
data.value: If pages of the administration interface are automatically redirected to https://.

data.name: settingskey.cmsuseurlswithtrailingslash.description
data.value: Specifies how the trailing slash should be handled in URLs. Possible options: LEAVE AS IS, ALWAYS, NEVER

data.name: settingskey.cmsversionhistorylength.description
data.value: Specifies maximum number of versions in the page history. Please note: If the number of versions exceeds the specified maximum number, the older versions are destroyed.

data.name: settingskey.cmsversioningextensionsmediafile.description
data.value: File types (extensions) that will be versioned in the media library (separated with a semicolon, without dot). Please note: If no value is specified, no files will be versioned.

data.name: settingskey.cmswebanalyticsusejavascriptlogging.description
data.value: If enabled, the system will log majority of Web analytic statistics and certain On-line marketing Activities using JavaScript snippet. JavaScript logging filters out all browsers and devices that do not support JavaScript or have it disabled (typically non-human tools such as RSS readers, web crawlers, etc.). Switching to JavaScript logging does not affect performance of the website. Activities logged by JavaScript snippet include Page view, Landing page and External search.

data.name: settingskey.cmswebdavextensions.description
data.value: File types (extensions) supported by WebDAV in Edit mode (separated with semicolons, with or without the leading dots). If blank, all types of files are supported. Files without extensions are not supported. Please note that WebDAV is only functional if Kentico is configured for Windows authentication - otherwise, this setting has no effect.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmApplicationPhysicalPath.description
data.value: Web application physical path for synchronizing physical files.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmDeleteGeneratedServers
data.value: Delete generated servers on application end

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmDeleteGeneratedServers.description
data.value: Ensure that generated web farm servers will be deleted on application end event.

data.name: settingskey.cmswebfarmenabled.description
data.value: Indicates whether web farm support is enabled. Requires one synchronization mechanism to be enabled. Also web farm servers must be configured in Web Farm -> Servers or automatic web farm server generation must be enabled.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmGenerateServers.description
data.value: Specifies whether web farm servers are generated dynamically on application start. If enabled, you don't have to define the servers in the user interface.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmMaxFileSize
data.value: Maximum file size to be synchronized (kB)

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmMaxFileSize.description
data.value: Sets the maximum file size in kilobytes which should be synchronized.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeAttachments.description
data.value: Indicates whether attachment files should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeAvatars.description
data.value: Indicates whether avatar files should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeBizFormFiles.description
data.value: Indicates whether form files should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeCache.description
data.value: Indicates whether cache should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeDeleteFiles.description
data.value: Indicates whether files deletion should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeFiles.description
data.value: Must be set to true to ensure that different files (Attachments, Avatars, Forum attachments, Form files, etc.) will be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeForumAttachments.description
data.value: Indicates whether forum attachments should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeMediaFiles.description
data.value: Indicates whether media files should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeMetaFiles.description
data.value: Indicates whether metafiles should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizePhysicalFiles.description
data.value: Indicates whether physical files from folders App_Themes and CMSVirtualFiles should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmSynchronizeSmartSearch.description
data.value: Indicates whether smart search indexes should be synchronized within web farm.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmUpdaterClass.description
data.value: Specifies custom webfarm updater class (given class must inherit from IWebFarmUpdater interface).

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmUpdateWithinRequest.description
data.value: Indicates if web farm synchronization is triggered with every page request. If you disable this setting, configure the synchronization through the database updater or scheduled task synchronization mechanism.

data.name: settingskey.CMSWebFarmUseDBUpdater.description
data.value: Indicates whether database web farm updater is used.

data.name: settingskey.cmswishlisturl.description
data.value: The URL of the Wishlist page (virtual path).

data.name: settingskey.contactcreatedbefore.description
data.value: Contacts which were created before specified number of days will be deleted. Value represents number of days.

data.name: settingskey.contactcustomquery.description
data.value: Allows you to enter an SQL WHERE condition that determines which contacts are deleted. For example, to create a condition for deleting contacts that have an empty email address, enter the following: (ContactEmail IS NULL OR ContactEmail = '')

data.name: settingskey.contactisanonymousdescription
data.value: Contacts which are/aren't related to a user will be deleted.

data.name: settingskey.contactlastlogon.description
data.value: Applicable to non anonymous contacts with relation to a user. Contacts whose last logon is older than specified number of days will be deleted. Value represents number of days.

data.name: settingskey.contactlastmodified.description
data.value: Contacts which were modified (e.g. contact address changed) before specified number of days will be deleted. Value represents number of days.

data.name: settingskey.contactmergedintosite.description
data.value: Only contacts which are merged into another site contact will be deleted.

data.name: settingskey.contactmergedwhen.description
data.value: Contacts which were merged before specified number of days will be deleted. Value represents number of days.

data.name: settingskey.enablesautomaticuploadofthestrandscatalogfeed
data.value:
Enables automatic upload of the Strands catalog feed to Strands.
When turned on, the Save button automatically uploads the Strands catalog feed to Strands.

data.name: settingskey.enablescreenlock.description
data.value: Indicates if screen lock feature is enabled.

data.name: settingskey.facebookaccesstoken.description
data.value: When you enter a Facebook page ID you can retrieve the access token that allows your site to post notifications onto the page. The token can be retrieved only by the page owner.

data.name: settingskey.facebookpageid.description
data.value: The identifier of a Facebook page where the notifications will be posted. It is a number that can be retrieved from the URL of the Facebook page.

data.name: settingskey.facebookurlshortenertype.description
data.value: Default URL shortener for all new Facebook posts.

data.name: settingskey.goo.glapikey.description
data.value: API key of goo.gl URL shortening service. It can be found in Google API console. You can use goo.gl URL shortener without entering this key.

data.name: settingskey.googleplusaccesstoken.description
data.value: Site-wide access token for Google+ API calls that require authorization.

data.name: settingskey.googleplusclientid.description
data.value: Client ID of your web application.

data.name: settingskey.googleplusclientsecret.description
data.value: Client secret of your web application.

data.name: settingskey.lastactivitydescription
data.value: Contacts whose activities will be older than specified number of days will be deleted. Value represents number of days.

data.name: settingskey.linkedinaccesstoken.description
data.value: Site-wide access token for LinkedIn API calls that require authorization.

data.name: settingskey.linkedinurlshortenertype.description
data.value: This URL shortener will be used to shorten links on all LinkedIn posts.

data.name: settingskey.mergedintoglobal.description
data.value: Only contacts which are merged into global contact will be deleted.

data.name: settingskey.nodata
data.value: No setting keys matching the entered criteria were found.

data.name: settingskey.producttabenabled.description
data.value: Determines whether "Product" tab should be displayed while editing the page in the Pages application. Allows content editors to mark the edited page as a product.

data.name: settingskey.ProjectDirectorURL.description
data.value: URL of the Project Director interface used to translation service.

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAPrivateAPIKey.Description
data.value: Private API key for the domain you want to use the reCAPTCHA service on. Keep the private key secret. You can generate your API keys at http://www.google.com/recaptcha

data.name: settingskey.ReCAPTCHAPublicAPIKey.Description
data.value: Public API key for the domain you want to use the reCAPTCHA service on. You can generate your API keys at http://www.google.com/recaptcha

data.name: settingskey.resettodefaultvalues
data.value: Changing the data type of the setting key assigns the Default value to the setting for all sites. Do you want to proceed?

data.name: settingskey.saml.ipurl.description
data.value: Specify the URL of your identity provider's WS-Federation passive endpoint. You can find the value in the provider's configuration interface or WS-Federation metadata.

data.name: settingskey.saml.realm.description
data.value: Enter a URI that identifies your website or application. You can use your website's domain name (and virtual directory if applicable) in most cases. The value must be exactly the same as in the relying party configuration of your identity provider, including letter case, any trailing slashes and the protocol (http or https).

data.name: settingskey.screenlockinterval.description
data.value: Time (in minutes) that has to pass before the screen is locked. This value has to be greater than 0 and lower than session timeout.

data.name: settingskey.screenlockwarninginterval.description
data.value: Warning period (in seconds). Warning with countdown is shown for this last seconds before the screen is locked.

data.name: settingskey.strandscatalogpassword
data.value: The Password used for restricting access to the Strands catalog feed.

data.name: settingskey.strandscatalogusername
data.value: The Username used for restricting access to the Strands catalog feed.

data.name: settingskey.twitteraccesstoken.description
data.value: Access token - as obtained on details page on Twitter application page.

data.name: settingskey.twitteraccesstokensecret.description
data.value: Access token secret - as obtained on details page on Twitter application page.

data.name: settingskey.twitterconsumerkey.description
data.value: Consumer key - as obtained on details page on Twitter application page.

data.name: settingskey.twitterconsumersecret.description
data.value: Consumer secret - as obtained on details page on Twitter application page.

data.name: settingskey.twitterurlshortenertype.description
data.value: Default URL shortener for all new tweets.

data.name: settingskey.uielement
data.value: Indicates if versioning of UI element objects is allowed.

data.name: settingskey.wif.audienceUrisDescription
data.value: URIs of allowed audience for the identity provider, separated by semicolons. To allow the authentication for all restricted sections of your website and the Kentico administration interface, use the base domain name of the website.

data.name: settingskey.wif.certificateValidatorDescription
data.value: Sets the validation mode used for the certificate specified in the Trusted certificate thumbprint setting. Selecting "None" makes the system accept any certificate with the given thumbprint.

data.name: settingskey.wif.enabled.description
data.value: Enables claims-based authentication using Windows Identity Foundation.. Users need to log in through the identity provider specified by the settings below (for example Active Directory Federation Services or Access Control Service). Disables the standard authentication mechanisms in Kentico.

data.name: settingskey.wif.SignOutRequestUrl.description
data.value: Expected query string parameter sent from identity provider with intention to sign out user.

data.name: settingskey.wif.trustedCertificateThumbprintDescription
data.value: Enter the thumbprint of the certificate used to secure the communication between Kentico and the identity provider. You can typically find the certificate thumbprint in the provider's Key/Certificate configuration.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.lowprecision
data.value: Some Kentico object field values might cause an error as the Salesforce object field has lower precision.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.notcreatable
data.value: This field cannot be set when creating the object.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.notupdateable
data.value: This field cannot be set when updating the object.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.required
data.value: Salesforce object field requires a value that might not be provided by Kentico object and there is no default value.

data.name: sf.attributecompatibility.tooshort
data.value: Some Kentico object field values might get truncated as the Salesforce object field allows a lower maximum number of characters in a string. Kentico object field allows {0} character(s), while Salesforce object field allows only {1} character(s).

data.name: sf.authorization.instructions1
data.value: Salesforce integration requires access to your organization on behalf of a specified Salesforce user. Please enable remote access for your Kentico instance with this callback URL:

data.name: sf.authorization.missingconsumerinput
data.value: Please enter consumer identifier and consumer secret.

data.name: sf.authorization.partialsuccess
data.value: Access to your Salesforce organization has been authorized and the changes have been saved. Please close all dialog windows and refresh the page with replication settings.

data.name: sf.authorization.success
data.value: Access to your Salesforce organization has been authorized. Please save the changes before you continue with replication settings.

data.name: sf.authorizationprologue.error
data.value: Your site might not be accessible over the secured SSL protocol which is required by Salesforce authorization. Please note that Kentico does not configure your website for SSL/HTTPS. It may only be used to automatically redirect users to the appropriate URL. You need to perform the configuration itself manually using the standard IIS settings, as described in IIS documentation or in this article. It might also be the case that your site certificate is not trusted by the browser. If you are sure that your site is accessible over the secured SSL protocol, please continue.

data.name: sf.authorizationprologue.progress
data.value: Checking whether HTTPS protocol is enabled for your site…

data.name: sf.authorizationprologue.success
data.value: HTTPS protocol is enabled, proceeding with authorization…

data.name: sf.automation.deferredreplication.description
data.value:
Check to make the contact's replication wait for a scheduled task. This option can save API calls to Salesforce.
Unchecking replicates the contact immediately.

data.name: sf.automation.error
data.value: There was an error processing your request: {0}

data.name: sf.automation.errors.contactisglobal
data.value: Replication of contacts to Salesforce leads does not support global contacts.

data.name: sf.automation.errors.nocredentials
data.value: Access to Salesforce organization is not authorized.

data.name: sf.credentialsrequiredformapping
data.value: Salesforce organization access authorization is required to edit the mapping.

data.name: sf.exception
data.value: There was an error processing your request, please check the event log for more information.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.nocontactmapping
data.value: Lead replication settings do not contain a contact mapping.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.nodefaultcompanyname
data.value: Lead replication settings do not contain a default company name.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.noexternalid
data.value: A contact mapping in lead replication settings does not contain a name of the external identifier field.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.noscore
data.value: Lead replication settings do not contain a score.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.novalidbatchsize
data.value: Lead replication settings do not contain a valid batch size.

data.name: sf.leadreplication.novalidminscorevalue
data.value: Lead replication settings do not contain a valid minimum score value.

data.name: sf.mapping.instructions1
data.value: Kentico stores information about bindings between Salesforce leads and Kentico contacts in a custom field added to Salesforce leads. Please add a custom field with the following properties to your Salesforce lead objects:

data.name: sf.mapping.instructions2
data.value: Type: Text Label: Kentico contact id (you can choose any label) Length: 32 Name: KenticoContactId (you can choose any name) Required: No Unique: Yes External ID: Yes Default value: None

data.name: sf.mapping.instructions3
data.value: If you are not sure, how to proceed, please follow these steps to create the custom field:

data.name: sf.mapping.instructions4
data.value: In Salesforce, open the Setup page. Navigate to App Setup -> Customize -> Leads -> Fields. Click the "New" button to create a new custom field. Select "Text" as the field type and click the "Next" button to continue. Enter the above mentioned custom field properties and click the "Next" button to continue. If required, customize a field-level security, and click the "Next" button to continue. If required, include the field in selected page layouts, and click the "Save" button to finish.

data.name: sf.mapping.instructions5
data.value: If you have just created the field, please refresh this page and select the custom field from the drop-down list.

data.name: sf.mapping.leadreplication.title
data.value: Mapping of contacts to Salesforce leads

data.name: sf.mapping.noexternalattributeselected
data.value: Please select an external identifier field, or create a new one in your Salesforce organization.

data.name: sf.mapping.requiredattributemappingmissing
data.value: Please select the source of values for required field "{0}" or add a compatible field to the Kentico contact.

data.name: sf.mapping.validationerror

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.description
data.value: Retrieves data from a SharePoint server. The resulting data source can be used by viewers like grid or repeater.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.connection.description
data.value: Specifies a SharePoint connection the system uses for data retrieval. You can configure the connection parameters in the SharePoint application.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.debugenabled.description
data.value: If enabled, the web part displays information suitable for debugging.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.folderrelativeurl.description
data.value:
Specifies the server-relative URL of the SharePoint folder within a list or library. If blank, the system lists the root folder. If the list or library does not support folders, keep blank.
Note: Usually starts with a slash ('/').

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.listname.description
data.value: Specifies the name of the list or library on the SharePoint server from which the system loads the requested items.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.listtype.description
data.value: Specifies what type of data the system retrieves from the SharePoint server.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.mode.description
data.value: Specifies whether the system downloads all lists of the selected type (the 'List type' property), or only items from a specified list (the 'List name' property) of the selected type.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.query.description
data.value:
Allows you to enter a condition determining which items the system retrieves. You can use this property to change the items' order, too.
You need to enter an inner XML of CAML Query element.
Sample query: <Where> <Eq> <FieldRef Name="ID" /><Value Type="Counter">1</Value> </Eq> </Where> <OrderBy> <FieldRef Name="Modified" Ascending="false" /> </OrderBy>

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.rowlimit.description
data.value: Specifies the maximum number of items (data rows) the system retrieves.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.scope.description
data.value:
Specifies whether the system retrieves files and folders, or only files. The system supports inclusion of subfolders.
Note: Some lists and libraries do not support folders. In such case the listing of folders or inclusion of subfolders has no effect.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.selectionfieldname.description
data.value: Specifies the internal name of a SharePoint column the system uses for item(s) selection.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.selectionfieldtype.description
data.value: Specifies the type of column as specified in the ‘Field name’ property. You can use values such as ‘Text’, ‘Integer’, ‘Counter’ (for IDs), etc.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.selectionfieldvalue.description
data.value:
Specifies a value the system uses in equality comparison for item(s) selection. The value means that the field named ‘Field name’ of type as specified in the ‘Field type’ property must contain the exact value.
The system allows you to enter a value of the query parameter like {? selectionValue ?}.

data.name: sharepoint.wp.datasource.field.viewfields.description
data.value:
Specifies SharePoint list or SharePoint library field names (internal names) the system retrieves. Separate the names by semicolons, or keep blank to retrieve all fields.
Note: Certain fields are always retrieved.

data.name: sm.workflow.postonlyonce.decription
data.value: If there already is a post related to the page, the workflow action will do nothing.

data.name: smartsearch.applysearchimmediately.descriptions
data.value: If enabled, the search results will be displayed immediately when the page is loaded, without the need to submit the search dialog. This also applies if the page is refreshed via postback, for example when using a Smart search filter.

data.name: smartsearch.displaycategoriesdesc
data.value: If enabled, the predictive search groups results into categories. The categories represent the smart search indexes where the results were found. The categories are named according to the Display names of the related search indexes.

data.name: smartsearch.enableselectiondesc
data.value: If enabled, users can move between the predictive search results using the up and down arrow keys, and link to the selected result by pressing Enter.

data.name: smartsearch.hidesearchtextbox.description
data.value: Indicates if the search text box should be hided to users.

data.name: smartsearch.moreresultscontentdesc
data.value: HTML content placed after the last search result if the maximum number of predictive results is reached. Use the {0} formatting expression to get the URL of the search result page.

data.name: smartsearch.noresultscontentdesc
data.value: HTML content displayed when the predictive search does not find any results.

data.name: smartsearch.predictivelogsearchactivitydesc
data.value: If enabled, the system logs every predictive search request as an "Internal search" on-line marketing activity.

data.name: smartsearch.predictivesearchresultscssdesc
data.value: Specifies the name of the CSS class assigned to the block element that contains the predictive search results.

data.name: smartsearch.resulttextvalidationfailedcssdesc
data.value: CSS class that will be assigned to the web part when search text validation fails.

data.name: smartsearch.searchboxtextrequireddesc
data.value: If enabled, user is not redirected to search results page when search text is empty. When validation fails the same page is displayed.

data.name: smartsearch.searchonlywhencontentpresent.descriptions
data.value: If enabled, only search expressions that contain at least one standard content keyword will be allowed. With this property disabled, it is also possible to submit field search expressions composed of nothing but special query syntax, such as: DocumentNodeID:(int)17

data.name: smartsearch.searchresulttextvalidationfaileddesc
data.value: Sets the text that is displayed when search text is empty and required.

data.name: smartsearch.searchresulttransformationdesc
data.value: Sets the transformation that defines the HTML output of individual predictive search results. To allow users to open links for selected search results, include one <a> element with a properly defined href attribute in the transformation code.

data.name: smartsearch.searchtextrequired.descriptions
data.value: If enabled, searches will only be performed if a non-empty search expression is submitted. You can disable this property if you wish to allow smart search filtering without the need to specify a search text.

data.name: smartsearch.searchtextvalidationfailedtextdesc
data.value: Sets the text that is displayed when search text validations fails. This text is displayed as tooltip.

data.name: smartsearch.selectedresultcssdesc
data.value: Specifies the name of the CSS class applied to the element containing the selected predictive search result.

data.name: smartsearch.showonlysearchbutton.description
data.value: If enabled, the web part only displays the search submit button, without the search textbox or mode selector. In this case, all search parameters need to be specified through connected Smart search filter web parts.

data.name: smartsearch.showparseerrors.descriptions
data.value: Indicates if parsing errors caused by incorrect search query syntax should be displayed by the web part. Such errors may only occur if special search expressions are allowed by the 'Search options' property.

data.name: smartsearch.taskbatch.startdocument
data.value: Started processing page type {0} on site {1}...

data.name: smartsearch.taskbatch.startdocumentlinked
data.value: Started processing page type {0} on site {1} [Linked pages]...

data.name: smartsearch.taskprocessingrunning
data.value: Task processor is running. Watch progress {0}here{1}.

data.name: smartsearch.taskstarted
data.value: Task started. Type: {0}, Object type: {1}, Object: {2}, Field: "{3}", Value: "{4}".

data.name: smartsearch.textvalidationfailedcssdesc
data.value: CSS class that will be assigned to the web part when search text validation fails and user is not redirected to results page.

data.name: smartsearch.trackwebanalyticskeywordsdesc
data.value: If enabled, the site's web analytics log all text submitted to the predictive search as part of the "On-site search keywords" statistic.

data.name: smartsearch.watermarkcssclass.description
data.value: Specifies the name of the CSS class which will be applied to the watermark text.

data.name: smartsearch.watermarktext.description
data.value:
The text entered here will be displayed in the search textbox if it is empty. It automatically disappears when a user starts entering their own input.
The watermark text is not a default search value, it only provides a way to make the search field more noticeable or give users instructions.

data.name: smtpserver.confirmenable

data.name: smtpserver.deliverymethoddesc
data.value:
Specifies how outgoing emails will be delivered to the SMTP server.
Network: Emails are sent through the network to the specified SMTP server.
Pickup directory: Emails are copied to the directory specified by the Pickup directory location property for delivery by an external application (local SMTP server).
Pickup directory from IIS: Emails are copied to the pickup directory used by a local Internet Information Services (IIS) for delivery.

data.name: smtpserver.editdefaultservers
data.value: Each site has a default SMTP server which can be edited in ##ui|cms|Settings## -> System -> Emails.

data.name: smtpserver.pickupdirectorydesc

data.name: Tools.AbuseReport.Description
data.value: Displays a list of abuse reports submitted by website users. Each report provides a link to the page where the given report was submitted. You can mark reports as solved or rejected.

data.name: Tools.BannerManagement.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage banner categories and the banners they contain. To display banners on a page, go to the Pages application and use the Banner rotator web part.

data.name: Tools.Blog.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage blogs and blog comments.

data.name: Tools.CustomTables.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage the data of existing custom tables. Use the Custom tables application to manage custom tables.

data.name: Tools.Ecommerce.Description
data.value: This section contains information about data and settings of the e-commerce module. You can manage your orders, products, product options, manufacturers, suppliers, product coupons and discount levels. You can choose to display reports or specify e-commerce settings as well.

data.name: Tools.EventManager.Description
data.value: Provides information about events related to the selected website. Events are created through the Pages application as Event (Booking system) pages in the site's content tree. You can manage the attendees registered for events, and send emails to all attendees.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.AliasPathNotFound
data.value: Specified alias path does not exist.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.Description
data.value: Allows you to import multiple files into the system as CMS.File pages. You can import files from the local computer or the server file system.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.FolderNotAllowedChildClass
data.value: Folder page type is not allowed under selected page.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.MaximumCountExceeded
data.value: Total number of files to be imported exceeded the license limitations. Please deselect some files from the list. Maximum allowed number of files to be imported is {0}.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.NoFiles
data.value: There are no files in the directory.

data.name: tools.fileimport.nofilesselected
data.value: There are no files selected for import.

data.name: Tools.FileImport.NotUnderRootPath
data.value: This file is not located under the files import folder.

data.name: Tools.Form.Description
data.value: Allows you to create forms for gathering data from your website's visitors. For each form, you can define the fields and layout, set up email notifications and autoresponders, and manage the data submitted by users through the form. Use the Pages application to publish forms on your website.

data.name: Tools.Forums.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage the selected website's forum groups and forums. You can configure forums, set up moderation, manage subscriptions, and edit forum threads and posts. To display forums on the website, add forum web parts onto pages through the Pages application.

data.name: Tools.Groups.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage user groups. Groups are a social networking feature enabling users to find information and communicate according to shared interests.

data.name: Tools.MediaLibrary.Description
data.value: Allows you to store and manage large amounts of images and videos. Storing files in the media libraries is more efficient than storing them as documents.

data.name: Tools.MessageBoards.Description
data.value: Provides an overview of all messages posted on boards in the system, and allows you to configure the selected website's message boards. You can set up moderation, manage subscriptions, and approve message posts. To display message boards on the site, add message board web parts onto pages through the Pages application.

data.name: Tools.Newsletter.Description
data.value: Allows you to manage the website’s email campaigns, subscribers and email campaign templates. You can track how particular email campaigns are doing or import and export subscribers.

data.name: Tools.Polls.Description
data.value: This section displays a list of polls. You can create a new poll or edit or delete existing ones. For each, you can specify its general attributes, answers. You can further manage roles and users who can answer the poll.

data.name: tools.projectmanagement.description
data.value: Allows you to organize work and keep track of progress. You can create and edit projects and tasks, and define your own statuses and task priorities.

data.name: Tools.Staging.Description
data.value: Staging allows you to transfer changes made to pages (documents), custom table data, and system objects to other instances. The system generates synchronization tasks for changes, which you can manually synchronize. You also need to use this application to set up the target servers for the staging.

data.name: tools.translations.description
data.value: Allows you to manage and display pages submitted for translation. You can import finished pages into the system, resubmit pages for translation or cancel submissions.

data.name: tools.ui.eventmanagerviewsiteevents
data.value: View booking events on this site

data.name: Tools.WebAnalytics.Description
data.value: Allows you to measure and analyze key metrics of your website, such as visits, page views, traffic sources or file downloads.

data.name: cms.abusereport.description
data.value: In this section, you can view a list of abuse reports. Each of the reports is provided with a link to the page from that the abuse was reported. Reports can be marked as solved or rejected. They can also be edited and deleted here.

data.name: cms.badwords.description
data.value: Allows you to manage the list of words included in the system's language filter. The bad word filter applies to user input on the website, such as forums, messages and comments. You can choose the action that the system takes when bad words are detected.

data.name: cms.bannedip.description
data.value: This section allows management of banned IP addresses. Banned addresses can be added, edited and deleted here. Addresses can be banned globally or separately for particular sites.

data.name: cms.blog.description
data.value: Allows you to manage your blogs, including blog posts and blog comments.

data.name: cms.eventmanager.description
data.value: This section displays a list of booked events defined for the given site. You can either view detail of each event or be redirected to it. You can manage attendees for a given event and send emails to all of them. For each event are displayed the following properties: its name, creation time, maximum capacity, number of attendees and open from/to dates.

data.name: cms.fileimport.description
data.value: This section displays the file import interface. You can choose to start import or specify file import settings, e.g. target alias path or culture. The path to a directory, from which are files imported is displayed as well.

data.name: cms.form.description
data.value: This section displays a list of forms defined for the given site. You can either create new form, or edit, delete or export objects from the existing ones. For each form, you can define its general information, fields, layout, whether the email notification should be sent and others.

data.name: cms.forums.description
data.value: This section displays a list of forum groups defined for a given site and a list of forum posts which are waiting for the logged-on user approval. You can choose either to create new forum group, or to edit or delete existing ones. You can choose to approve or reject forum posts as well. You can manage forums of each forum group.

data.name: cms.friends.description
data.value: This section displays a list of your friends. You can approve your friends, reject your friends and view your pending requests. You can also add new friends in this section.

data.name: cms.groups.description
data.value: This section displays a list of existing user groups. This is a social networking feature enabling users to gather according to their interests. Groups can be created, edited and deleted. You can also add users to groups from this section.

data.name: cms.medialibrary.description
data.value: Allows you to store and manage large amounts for images and videos. Storing files in the media libraries is more efficient than storing them as pages.

data.name: cms.messageboards.description
data.value: This section allows management of message boards. These can be managed or deleted using this section of the administration interface.

data.name: cms.messaging.description
data.value: This section represents the user interface of the Messaging module. The message Inbox and Outbox are both displayed here. You can also create and send new messages. Contact list and Ignore list are displayed here too and you can add or remove users to/from these lists.

data.name: cms.newsletter.description
data.value: This section displays a list of email campaigns, subscribers and email campaign templates. It provides interface for import and export of subscribers as well. You can check email queue and resend or delete all failed emails.

data.name: cms.notifications.description
data.value: This section displays list of notification gateways and notification templates. You can add new template or gateway change existing one or delete it.

data.name: cms.polls.description
data.value: Allows you to manage polls. You can either create a new poll, or edit or delete existing ones. For each poll, you can specify its general properties, poll answers, users and roles who should be allow to answer and site for which a poll is enabled.

data.name: cms.reporting.description
data.value: This section displays a list of report categories. You can either create new report category, or edit or delete existing ones. For each report category, you can edit, delete, clone or export individual report or create a new one.

data.name: cms.staging.description
data.value: This section displays a tree view of pages or objects of the given site and a list of synchronization tasks. You can choose either to select and synchronize or delete a group of tasks or view, restore or delete an individual task. You can specify the staging servers as well.

data.name: cms.webanalytics.description
data.value: This section visualizes statistics for a given site. It displays graphs and tables with numbers of page views, file downloads, visits, proportion of individual browser types used by visitors and others.
