data.name: deployment.saveallinfo
data.value: Deployment mode is off. Click "Store all virtual objects in file system" to prepare the website for deployment. Objects containing code that needs to be compiled (form layouts, page layouts, page template layouts, transformations and web part layouts) will be saved to the file system to allow precompilation. You can still edit the objects via the administration interface, the changes are immediately applied to the files.

data.name: designerredirect.choosepermissionsorallowed
data.value: Please choose either Permission Names or Allowed Child Templates.

data.name: development.categoriesdescription
data.value: In this section, you can view a list of global categories. Categories can be created, edited and deleted here. Users' custom categories are not displayed here, you can manage them in ##ui|cms.users|cmsdesk.users## -> Edit user -> Categories.

data.name: development.countriesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage the countries and states used throughout the system. You can add new countires and edit the names and codes of existing ones.

data.name: development.customtablesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage custom tables and their data. You can create new custom custom tables, define their structure or manage the data they contain. Custom tables are a more efficient way of storing large amounts of structured data than pages.

data.name: development.formcontrolsdescription
data.value: Allows you to register custom form controls and configure existing ones. Form controls define the interface of fields in editing forms. Users select form controls for fields when creating any type of form in the system, for both the administration interface and live site. If you wish to create a completely new form control, you first need to develop a user control with the required functionality.

data.name: development.inlinecontrolsdescription
data.value: Obsolete. Use inline widgets instead of inline controls. You can create inline widgets through the Widgets application.

data.name: development.notificationsdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage notification templates and gateways. Templates define the content of notifications, and gateways determine how the system delivers notifications to users. By default, the system provides email notifications for keeping track of page changes. To allow users to subscribe to recieve notifications, add notification web parts to your pages using the Pages application.

data.name: development.pagetemplatesdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage all page templates in the system. Page templates define the structure and core functionality of web pages. Use the Pages application to create pages based on the templates, and edit the design of templates.

data.name: development.systablesdescription
data.value: Provides an overview of the database views and stored procedures used by the system. If necessary, you can customize the code of the database objects.

data.name: development.taggroups.nosite
data.value: There is no site the tag group could be related to. Please create a new site first.

data.name: development.timezonesdescription
data.value: Allows you to configure the system's time zone data, including the GMT differences and daylight saving time rules. To set the correct time zone for your server and websites, go to Settings -> System.

data.name: development.webpartsdescription
data.value: Allows you to manage all web parts in the system. Web parts are the basic building blocks of portal engine pages. Each web parts displays web content or performs some type of functionality. Developers can register custom user controls as web parts. Use the Design tab of the Pages application to add web part instances onto page templates.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.alloweditvisibility
data.value: Indicates if users should be allowed to edit the visibility settings of the fields in the form.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.alternatingstyles
data.value: Indicates if odd and even menu items should have different styles.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.alternativeformname
data.value: Can be used to select an alternative form that will define the layout of the displayed profile. Alternative forms are specified in format <class name>.<form code name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.applyuservisibility
data.value: Indicates if the field visibility settings that users may configure for the fields in their profile should be taken into consideration.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.avatarmaxsidesize
data.value: Sets the maximum size of avatar images in pixels.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardaccess
data.value: Specifies the message board security access level. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boarddisplayname
data.value: Board display name. You can also use macros for the name. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardenablesubs
data.value: Indicates whether the subscription feature should be enabled. This property is only applied after the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardmoderated
data.value: Indicates whether the board is moderated or not. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardmoderators
data.value: Selects which users will be designated as moderators for the newly created message board. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardopen
data.value: Indicates whether the board should be opened (i.e. new messages can be added) by default. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardopenfrom
data.value: Board opening date. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardopento
data.value: Board closing date. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardowner
data.value: Specifies the owner of newly created message board. This property cannot be changed once the board is created.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardroles
data.value: Sets the roles that will be authorized to post on the newly created message board by default. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.boardunsubscriptionurl
data.value: URL of the page used to unsubscribe from the subscribed message board. If it is not specified, default unsubscription URL from ##ui|cms|settings## -> Community -> Message boards is used. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.messageboards|messageboards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.captchatext
data.value: Sets the text displayed before the verification field where users have to enter the content of the CAPTCHA image.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.cssprefix
data.value: Through this property, you can set different CSS styles for individual menu levels. Enter the prefixes of the CSS classes that should be applied, starting from the first menu level and separated by semicolons (;).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.disablefiltercaching
data.value: Indicates if caching should be disabled for the data contained in the connected source. This should only be used in special cases where the displayed data is not being refreshed by the filter.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.display
data.value: Determines if link should be displayed or stay hidden.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaycaptcha
data.value: Indicates if a CAPTCHA security check should be required before allowing users to subscribe to an email campaign.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.displaymode
data.value: Sets the mode used to display forum posts if the Forum layout property is set to Tree. Possible options are: Tree mode - the details of the selected post are displayed above the tree. Detail mode - post details are displayed inside the tree for all expanded nodes. Dynamic detail mode - post details are displayed inside the tree for selected nodes.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.edititemtransform
data.value: The transformation for the item selected for editing in the datalist.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enableanonymread
data.value: Indicates whether the anonymous read is enabled

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enablecontentrating
data.value: If checked, content rating is enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enablepaging
data.value: Indicates if the displayed data should be paged.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enablesubs
data.value: Indicates whether the subscription feature should be enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.enableviewstate
data.value: Indicates if ViewState should be enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.filesfilter
data.value: Can be used to enter an expression to filter which files should be included in the data source. The * wildcard may be used to indicate any number of characters. For example: "*.*", "*.jpg" "*.jpg;*.gif"

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.footertransform
data.value: Sets the transformation placed at the end of the list of displayed items. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.groupname
data.value: Selects which group should be used by the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.headertransform
data.value: Sets the transformation placed before the list of displayed items. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.hidenofound
data.value: Specifies whether to hide the web part if no items to be displayed are retrieved.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.highlightallpath
data.value: Indicates if all items in the currently selected path of the menu control should be displayed as highlighted.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.highlightedpath
data.value: Alias path of the node that should be selected in the menu control. If you do not specify any value, the current path is used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.id
data.value: Serves as an identifier for the web part. This ID must be unique within the context of each page template. The value of this property may only contain alphanumeric characters and the underscore character ( _ ).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.joingroupurl
data.value: Selects the page to which users will be redirected if the group only allows group members to view its content. A link to this URL can be added to the text displayed by the web part by entering the following expression into the Group members only text (site members) property: {0}Link text{1}

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.loginurl
data.value: Sets the URL where public users will be redirected if the group is not accessible to them. A link to this URL can be added to the text displayed by the web part by entering the following expression into the text Site/Group members only text properties: {0}Link text{1}

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.maindoc
data.value: Sets the page for which related pages are displayed. Either the current page is used, or another page can be specified by entering its NodeGUID. Please note that if relationships are used, only the pages defined by the relationship settings are displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.mainonleft
data.value: If checked, pages on the right side of the relationship with the specified page are displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.maxratingvalue
data.value: Sets size of the content rating scale.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nestedcontrolsid
data.value: Must contain the IDs of any nested controls, separated by semicolons (;). For example: myRepeaterID;myDatalistID;myRepeaterID2. This property replaces the previously used NestedRepeaterID and NestedDataListID properties. If you are still using these properties, no changes to functionality will occur, but it is advisable to rewrite your code to use the new property instead. If you need to dynamically set the properties of a nested control, you have to set its DelayedLoading property to 'True'. Please note that this setting can cause problems with ViewState.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nesteddatalist
data.value: ID of the nested CMSDataList control as you specify it in the transformation code.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nestedrepeater
data.value: ID of the nested CMSRepeater control as you specify it in the transformation code.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.newbtntext
data.value: Sets the description text for the New page button.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nomessagestext
data.value: Text displayed when there are no messages to be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.noprofiletext
data.value: Text that will be displayed if no profile is found.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.norecordtext
data.value: Text to be displayed if no records are found. This text is not visible if the 'Hide if no record found' property of the web part is enabled.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.nrandomproducts
data.value: Specifies how many random products to display. Do not enter any value if you want to display all products.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pagerposition
data.value: Determines if the pager is displayed above or below the content displayed by the web part.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.pages
data.value: Sets the transformation used for page links. Use <%# Eval("Page") %> to get the appropriate page number dynamically, <%# Eval("PageURL") %> to get the page URL or <%# Eval("PageLink") %> to get a link to the appropriate page.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.query
data.value: Name of the query used for retrieving data from the system's database. The queries can be defined in ##ui|cms.documentengine|Development.DocumentTypes## -> edit a page type -> Queries.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.queryname
data.value: Sets the name of the predefined SQL query that should be used to retrieve the data. Queries are specified in format <class name>.<query name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.querystring
data.value: Sets the name of the URL parameter used to pass information about the current page number (used if the Paging mode property is set to Query string).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.ratingvalue
data.value: This property could be used to preset rating value. If it is not set then current page rating value is used. Rating value must be a number from the interval <0, 1>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.relationship
data.value: Allows to select the page relationship to be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.requireemail
data.value: Indicates whether the board message requires email address. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|cms.MessageBoards|MessageBoards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecteditemtransformation
data.value: The transformation for the selected item in the datalist.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectedtransf
data.value: Sets the transformation to be used for the displayed content in detail view mode. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecthidden
data.value: Determines if hidden users should be included.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selectonlyapproved
data.value: Indicates if only approved items should be selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.selecttopn
data.value: Specifies the maximum amount of items to be selected. If empty, all possible items are selected.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.separatortransform
data.value: Sets the transformation used to separate the displayed items. Transformations are specified in format <class name>.<transformation name>.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showapprove
data.value: Indicates whether the message APPROVE button should be displayed

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showdelete
data.value: Indicates whether the message DELETE button should be displayed

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showedit
data.value: Indicates whether the message EDIT button should be displayed

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showeditdelete
data.value: If enabled, the web part offers edit and delete buttons for each item when displaying the page in edit mode. You can set the exact position of the buttons by adding the ##editbuttons## macro into the code of the used item transformation (must be of the ASCX type).

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showemail
data.value: Indicates whether the email should be displayed

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showfilter
data.value: Indicates whether a filter should be displayed above the list of items.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showfirstlast
data.value: Indicates if the buttons used for navigating to the first and last page should be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.shownewbtn
data.value: Indicates if the button for adding new pages should be displayed when viewing the page in edit mode. When the button is used, a page of the first type entered into the Page types property is created at the beginning of the path specified for the web part's content.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.showreject
data.value: Indicates whether the message REJECT button should be displayed

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.startingaliaspath
data.value: Sets the alias path of the page that will serve as the root of the content tree in ##ui|cms.content|content## for users who register through the web part. The users will only be able to access the given page and its child pages. Please note that this only affects the administration editing interface and not the live site.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.submenuindicator
data.value: Contains the path to the image that is used to indicate that menu items contain further sub-items. For example: ~/App_Themes/Site/Images/submenu.gif

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.unsubscriptionurl
data.value: URL used to unsubscribe from the subscribed issue

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.username
data.value: Name of a user to be displayed.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.usesecuritycode
data.value: Indicates whether the board uses the security CAPTCHA feature. This property is only applied when the first message is posted. You can later change the properties in ##ui|CMS.MessageBoards|MessageBoards##.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.visibilityformname
data.value: Can be used to select from which form visibility settings should be loaded if the Apply visibility settings property is enabled. If empty, the form specified in the Form name property will be used.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.webserviceparameters
data.value: Can be used to enter a string value that will be passed to the web service as a parameter.

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.webserviceurl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the web service that will provide the data. For example: http://localhost/webservice1/Service.asmx

data.name: documentation.webpartproperties.xmlurl
data.value: Specifies the URL of the XML page from which the data will be loaded. The URL can be absolute or relative from the root of the current website.
